• The present invention relates to a container of a blender, particularly a set of high-speed blades mounted inside the lower portion of the container. The usage of blenders has become popular, and the configuration structure of a blender typically includes a set of rotatable blades inside the container to mix ice cubes, vegetables, and fruits until they become liquid. In the early phases, the container of the blender was made of glass, but it had drawbacks such as breakage and cracks. The manufacturers then used reinforced plastic, but it also had limitations such as nicks and debris mixing into the liquid.

• The inventors of the present invention encountered the problems mentioned above and provided a metal lining to shield the inner wall of the receptacle, which is known by their patent document 1. The metal lining is formed as a shield inside the cup, and a number of teeth projected from the inner wall of the lining are used to grind the fibers of vegetable and fruit. The lining is selected from one of the following: metal lining, glass lining, or lining with approximately the same hardness. The lining is an annular member formed integrally as a whole one, but it is preferred in the shape of a polygon.

• A conventional blender has a cup and a set of blades installed within the base of the cup. When the blades are rotated in high speed, the vegetable and fruit will be grated until they become liquid, and a whirlpool is formed in the receptacle. The whirlpool brings the rough and long fibers to the outer circle in contact with the inner wall by centrifugal force. Some rough and long fibers are neither brought to the lower portion of the cup by the whirlpool nor further grated by the blades.

• The present invention aims to provide a container of the blender that comprises a cup and a lining disposed inside the cup. The lining is formed as a shield inside the cup, and a number of teeth projected from the inner wall of the lining are used to grind the fibers of vegetable and fruit. The lining is selected from one of the following: metal lining, glass lining, or lining with approximately the same hardness. The lining is an annular member formed integrally as a whole one, but it is preferred in the shape of a polygon.

• The lining is combined to the inner wall of the cup to form a shield screen characterized in that a number of teeth projected from the inner wall of the lining are used to grate fibers of vegetable and fruit. Teeth can be arranged in parallel with one another, but they are all

<summary>
* The garnish pick is a device used to hold garnishes, such as olives or fruits, in a beverage container. It consists of a main shaft and one or more appendages that project from the main shaft at various angles. The appendages can serve as skewering shafts to hold garnishes or as a hook to secure the pick to the rim of a glass.

* The garnish pick can be made of various materials, including wood, plastic, metal, glass, or ceramic, and can have different shapes and sizes. The main shaft and appendages can be curved, bent, or twisted, and can have bumps, ridges, or other irregularities. The pick can also have multiple appendages that branch out from the main shaft or from each other.

* The garnish pick can be designed to resemble a branch or an antler, with multiple appendages that curve and twist in different directions. The pick can be used to hold multiple garnishes, making it easier to eat them without having to touch the pick or the garnishes with one's fingers. The hook on the pick can be designed to fit snugly onto the rim of a glass, preventing the pick from falling into the beverage.

* The garnish pick can be used in various settings, including bars, restaurants, and homes, and can be used with different types of beverages, including cocktails, wine, and beer. The pick can be washed and reused multiple times, making it a convenient and practical tool for anyone who enjoys garnished beverages. The design of the pick can be customized to fit different themes or styles, making it a unique and functional addition to any bar or restaurant.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a cardiac assist system that combines a cardiomyostimulator and a cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator to provide cardiac assistance and detect arrhythmias.
• The system features skeletal muscle graft stimulation and cardiac stimulation, and temporarily stops or inhibits skeletal muscle stimulation once an arrhythmia is sensed to ensure accurate detection and diagnosis.
• The system has various states, including normal sinus rhythm, VT counting mode, VF counting mode, deliver VT therapy, deliver VF therapy, and VT/VF termination detection, which are reached based on the intervals between detected cardiac events.
• The system uses programmable parameters, such as VFNID and CNID, to detect VT and VF, and applies a second look criterion to determine whether VT or VF therapy should be delivered.
• The system also features skeletal muscle stimulation while charging for defibrillation, which helps maintain cardiac perfusion and limits the increase in defibrillation thresholds.

• The invention relates to an accommodating intraocular lens (IOL) device that can be implanted in a lens chamber of a subject's eye to correct presbyopia and cataracts. The IOL device has a first lens portion that provides accommodative power and a second base lens that provides corrective refractive power. The first lens portion is elastically deformable and changes shape or curvature in response to the contraction and relaxation of the ciliary muscles. The base lens is substantially more rigid than the first lens portion.

• The IOL device has a circumferential haptic that couples the first lens and the second lens, and a main IOL cavity is defined by the circumferential haptic, the first lens, and the second lens. The first lens has a pair of opposing and deformable surfaces and a cavity defined therebetween, and the cavity is filled with a fluid or gel having a refractive index of 1.46 or greater. The fluid or gel has a Young's modulus of 10 psi or less, preferably 5 psi or less, and more preferably 1 psi or less. The gel is a highly-branched polymer, preferably cross-linked silicone.

• The second lens is substantially more rigid than the first lens and has a thickness that is greater than either one of the opposing sides of the first lens. The second lens is a one of a plano-convex lens, a bi-convex lens, and a positive meniscus lens. The circumferential haptic has an outer peripheral edge configured for engagement with a capsular bag of an eye when the IOL is implanted. The IOL device is resiliently biased to an unaccommodated state and actuates to an accommodated state in response to radial compressive forces exerted on the outer peripheral edge.

• The first lens has a central region and a peripheral region, and the central region is at least two times thicker than the peripheral region. The first lens has a gradually increasing thickness from the peripheral region to the central region. The point of greatest thickness in the central region and the point of least thickness in the peripheral region is characterized as having a thickness ratio of 2:1 or greater. The central region has a thickness of about 100 microns, and the peripheral region has a thickness of about 50 microns.

• The base lens is made of a material having a Young's modulus that is greater than the Young's modulus of the first lens. The base lens is made of a material that

• The invention relates to esophageal electrodes, specifically an esophageal-stomach displacement electrode that can be inserted into the esophagus and stomach to stimulate the ventricle of the heart. The electrode is designed to be positioned close to the heart to reduce the amount of electrical energy required for pacing or defibrillation. The electrode is part of a noninvasive procedure that does not require a sterile atmosphere or a physician's presence. The invention builds upon previous patents and applications that disclose methods and apparatus for esophageal electrodes.

• The esophageal-stomach displacement electrode consists of a semi-rigid plastic tube with an electrode on the distal end, similar to the tube in the prior application Ser. No. 07/589,995. The tube is long enough to be passed down the esophagus into the stomach, and a mechanism is incorporated into the tube to cause the last couple of inches of the distal end to bend back on itself approximately 135 degrees. The user then withdraws the electrode until the bent back section impacts on the stomach wall and displaces the stomach wall toward the heart. This action places the electrode in its operative position closest to the ventricle of the heart.

• The electrode includes a control mechanism that enables the user to cause the distal end of the tube to bend and press against the wall of the esophagus. The mechanism is similar to that in the earlier application, but with modifications to accommodate the longer tube and the need to bend the distal end further. The control mechanism is connected to a displacement mechanism disposed in the tube, which is operated by taking up one cord and playing out the other. The control mechanism is located at the proximal end of the tube outside the mouth when the esophageal-stomach displacement electrode is placed in the stomach.

• The tube is crimped to form a hinge that enables it to bend readily at that point, and ports are formed on opposite sides of the hinge to accommodate the cords. A rigid pin is disposed in the tube and extends generally parallel to the tube axis, with cords connected to the proximal and distal ends of the pin. The cords extend proximally in the tube out its proximal end and into the control mechanism. The location of the pin may be changed by pulling one or the other of the cords in a proximal direction.

• The pin is shorter than the distance between the crimped portion of the tube and the lower port, and travel of the pin

<summary>
• The game is a board game that simulates the ups and downs of life at a lake, where players acquire, sell, mortgage, and improve properties, such as lake areas, dams, and boat dealerships.
• The game board features a continuous path with various spaces, including lake areas, boat dealerships, dams, and other lake-related spaces, which players move through using dice rolls.
• Players can purchase properties from the Bank, and when another player lands on a property, the owner can collect rent, which increases if the property is improved with lake cabins or marinas.
• The game includes special spaces, such as Waterfront Taxes Due, Boat Tab Renewal, and GO TO JAIL, which require players to pay fines or follow specific rules.
• Players can draw Makin A Wake or Sunken Chest cards, which may provide benefits or penalties, and can also erect lake cabins and marinas on their properties to increase rent.
• The game ends when a player's assets, including properties, scrip, and other assets, exceed a certain amount, or when all the players but one have gone bankrupt.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device and method for treating wounds and promoting tissue growth, using a combination of fluid supply and suction. The device includes a dressing with a supply port and a drainage port, and a fluid reservoir connected to the supply port. The fluid reservoir is placed on a rest that can be moved vertically to match the level of the wound.

* The device eliminates the need for hydrostatic pressure to drive fluid flow, instead using suction to distribute the fluid throughout the dressing. This allows for more precise control over the fluid flow rate and pressure. The device also includes a sensor to detect blockages in the dressing.

* The dressing includes an open pore polymer pad that allows for the exchange of fluids and gases with the wound. The pad is covered by a pliable, adhesive film that seals the wound and prevents leakage. The film has apertures that align with the supply and drainage ports.

* The device includes an injection port that allows for the intermittent administration of treatment fluids during ongoing suctioning. The port includes an elastic membrane that prevents air from entering the dressing and allows for the injection of fluid through a needle. The membrane is connected to a rigid frame that is adhesively connected to the dressing sheet.

* The device also includes a drainage port with an open grid that prevents blockages and allows for the drainage of debris. The grid is made of semi-flexible or rigid cells with open pores or spatia, and is adhered to the flange of the drainage port tube.

* The device can be used for tissue regeneration by placing an open polymer pad over a tissue culturing scaffold. The scaffold can be made of biological or non-biological materials, and can include growth factors, cells, and genes. The device minimizes positive and negative pressures to leave diffusional and cellular processes undisturbed.

* The device includes a system for detecting bleeding from the wound during ongoing suctioning. The system uses a load sensor to measure the weight of the fluid collected in a canister, and alerts the user if the rate of fluid formation increases beyond a certain threshold. The system includes a computer, display, and control panel, as well as a telemetric unit.

* The device can be adapted for self-assembly, and includes features such as a horizontal level meter, a drip chamber, and a roller clamp to control the flow rate of the fluid. The device can be used for a variety of applications, including wound treatment, tissue regeneration, and tissue culturing.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a gravity-driven, steerable vehicle that can be ridden in a prone, face-down, face-forward position.
* The vehicle has at least two wheels or skis, a brake, and a suspension system that provides precise control in turns, especially on snow-covered terrain.
* The vehicle can have a combination of wheels and skis, with the skis providing enhanced performance on snow.
* The suspension system is configured to provide a smooth, stable ride over surfaces with irregularities.
* The vehicle can have a three-wheeled embodiment, with the single wheel located at the front or rear of the vehicle.
* The braking system can be hydraulic, mechanical, or a combination of both, and can be operated by a single hand lever.
* The vehicle has a low center of gravity, providing control and stability, and making it difficult to overturn.
* The vehicle can be retrofitted with skis or a slide pan to convert it for use on snow-covered terrain.
* The ski version of the vehicle has a unique steering system that allows the skis to carve into the snow, providing precise control in turns.
* The vehicle has a safety harness and automatic brake system that actuates upon release of the hand grips, providing additional safety features.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a wave-based imaging method and apparatus that employs inverse wave techniques to reconstruct images of a medium surrounding a physical probe in a plane perpendicular to an axis of rotation in a radial reflection configuration. The method uses a Hilbert space inverse wave (HSIW) algorithm to invert the scattering collected fields and form images of one or more objects.
* The invention has various applications, including characterizing vulnerable atherosclerotic plaque, non-destructive evaluation within a bore hole, and evaluating the state of materials residing in waste drum barrels or weapons, and can be used in intravascular ultrasound probes, probes for non-destructive characterization of buried wastes, and probes for non-destructive evaluation of parts with existing access holes.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a biological oil composition derived from a marine copepod, particularly Calanus finmarchicus, which is rich in wax esters, stearidonic acid (SDA), eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA).
• The oil composition has a unique fatty acid profile and is found to have beneficial effects on cardiovascular health, including preventing the formation of atherosclerotic plaques and reducing total blood cholesterol levels.
• The oil composition is distinguished from other marine oils, such as fish oil and krill oil, by its high content of wax esters and SDA, and its low viscosity and free-flowing liquid state at room temperature.
• The invention provides a dietary supplement, functional food, or pharmaceutical formulation comprising the biological oil composition, which can be used for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease, atherosclerosis, hypercholesterolaemia, and elevated blood cholesterol levels.
• The oil composition can be administered orally at a daily dosage level of 4-100 mg/kg body weight, and may be used in combination with other pharmaceutically acceptable additives and carriers.

* The invention relates to pharmacological compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes in microparticulate form and at least one active substance. The active substance can be embedded in the matrix of the polyelectrolyte complex, be a partner in the polyelectrolyte complex, or be bound to a partner of the polyelectrolyte complex. The active substances can be pharmacological active substances, contrast agents, or vaccines.

* The polyelectrolyte complexes are formed by mixing solutions of polyacids and polybases, which can be biocompatible, biodegradable, and naturally occurring or composed of natural subunits. The polyacids and polybases can be hydrophobically substituted derivatives, and the complexes can be prepared in various particle sizes. The particle size can be controlled by the stirring speed, drop rate, nozzle diameter, and pH.

* The incorporation of an active substance in the polyelectrolyte complex particles can be carried out in four ways: entrapment, absorption, precipitation, or by employing the active substance as a partner in the formation of the polyelectrolyte complex. The active substance can be a protein, peptide, enzyme, enzyme inhibitor, antigen, cytostatic, antibiotic, or vaccine. The polyelectrolyte complex particles can be used for various pharmaceutical applications, including wound ointments and ultrasonic diagnosis.

* The polyelectrolyte complex particles can be used to improve the therapeutic index of cytostatics, such as daunorubicin, by achieving a slow-release form. The particles can also be used to protect proteins from hydrolytic attack and achieve controlled release profiles. The particles can be administered orally, intravenously, subcutaneously, or intramuscularly, depending on the particle size.

* The polyelectrolyte complex particles can be used as air-containing echogenic contrast agents for ultrasonic diagnosis. The particles can be prepared from hydrophobically esterified dextran sulfate and a copolymer of poly-α,β-(2-dimethylaminoethyl)-D,L-aspartamide and poly-α,β-(2-palmitoyloxyethyl)-D,L-aspartamide. The particles can pass through capillaries unhindered and provide a strong ultrasonic contrast.

* The release of active substances from the polyelectrolyte complex particles can be controlled and adjusted by the composition of the

<summary>
* The invention relates to a golf ball teeing device that allows a golfer to easily place a golf tee into the ground with a golf ball on top without bending over. The device eliminates the need for a manually controlled unclamping mechanism, allowing a golf club to be used as the handle. The device is lightweight, portable, and does not require a substantial amount of space in a golf bag. It can be quickly and easily used without requiring the cumbersome juggling of a large device and a golf club.

* The device consists of a housing with an upper and lower portion, a delayed urging means, and an interface member. The housing has a slot that allows the golf tee to be inserted underneath the golf ball. The delayed urging means, such as low-recovery foam, provides a delayed rebound after being compressed, allowing the device to automatically unclamp the ball and tee once the tee is pushed into the ground. The interface member provides a uniform surface to contact the golf ball.

* The device can be attached to a golf club grip, allowing the golfer to use the club as a handle. The device has a clip that can be used to temporarily fasten it to a pocket or belt while the ball is being hit. The device can be used to retrieve golf tees from the ground, even if they are in a horizontal orientation. The device can be made from far fewer parts than prior tee setting devices.

* The invention has several advantages, including allowing a golfer to easily tee up a golf ball without bending over, permitting a golf club to be utilized as the handle, and being very simple to use with no cumbersome controls to release the tee and ball. The device can easily and nonintrusively be clipped onto a golfer's apparel while hitting the ball, and can easily be attached to a golf bag. The device can be made from a variety of materials, and the dimensions of the housing, interface member, and slot can be adjusted. The invention provides a convenient and efficient way to tee up a golf ball and retrieve golf tees.

* The present disclosure relates to a person support apparatus, such as a bed, with a mechanism for adjusting the height and orientation of a patient support frame. The apparatus is suitable for hospital or long-term care beds. The patient support deck is supported on a deck support frame, which is supported on leg assemblies that are pivotally connected to the deck support frame. The leg assemblies have linear actuators for pivoting the leg assemblies relative to the deck support frame and adjusting the height of the deck support frame.

* The deck support frame is supported on leg assemblies which are pivotally connected at their upper end to the deck support frame and which have linear actuators for pivoting the leg assemblies relative to the deck support frame and hence adjusting the height of the deck support frame. Separate and separately controllable head end and foot end leg assemblies are provided so that the height of the foot and head ends may be separately adjusted. The leg assemblies can be pivoted together by their respective actuators and thereby raise or lower the deck support frame whilst keeping it substantially parallel to the floor. Alternatively, one of the foot or head end assemblies can be pivoted to lower just one of the foot or head ends and thereby move the deck support frame into the Trendelenburg or reverse Trendelenburg positions.

* Known arrangements for pivoting leg assemblies relative to a deck support frame to allow the raising and lowering of the deck support frame include a leg element pivotally connected at its upper end to a guide element which is coupled to and can slide along the outside of longitudinal elements arranged parallel to, or forming, the sides of the deck support frame. Such arrangements suffer from a number of problems, including a risk of trapping fingers in the guide element, a need to overcome frictional forces, and a propensity for dust and dirt to collect on the surface of the longitudinal element and hence interfere with the sliding operation. The present disclosure provides an improved arrangement that addresses these problems. The improved arrangement includes a channel element having a substantially continuous upper surface, two substantially continuous side surfaces connected at their top edges to the upper surface, and a downward facing opening between the bottom edges of the two side surfaces.

* The channel element is arranged on the sides of the deck support frame, and the first upper end portion of the leg assembly includes a guide or follower element arranged to contact and run along an inner surface of the channel element. This arrangement results in a deck support frame which is robust and stable and can accommodate the changes in geometry necessary for movement or adjustment between the horizontal, Trendelen

<summary>

* The invention relates to a skin reflectance measuring apparatus, which is specifically adapted for measuring the reflectance of the skin. The apparatus comprises a probe, a measuring device, and a flexible connection in fiber optics connecting the measuring device to the probe. The probe is designed to be placed in contact with the skin to illuminate the part of the skin surface requiring examination. The apparatus is useful in pathology and cosmetology, particularly in studying seborrhea and measuring the effect of "anti-reflectance" products.

* The apparatus overcomes the limitations of existing methods and devices, which are not applicable to skin reflectance measurement due to the influence of color and the need for accurate positioning of the apparatus on a flat surface. The invention uses a relative measurement between specular reflection and diffuse reflection, and corrects for variations in the intensity of the emitted light and the effect of ambient light. This allows for accurate measurements without strict operational conditions. The apparatus can tolerate a few degrees of deviation of relative position between the probe and the skin surface.

* The probe is small and has no optical elements, allowing for ready handling and measurement over different areas of the skin surface. The measuring area can be as small as 10-50 mm2, and the apparatus can be used to measure reflectance on surfaces with little rigidity and uniformity. The flexible connection and miniaturization of the probe enable easy handling and measurement on different areas of the skin.

* The measuring device comprises light-emitting means, light-receiving means, and processing means. The light-emitting means includes a lamp and a circuit for regulating the intensity of the emitted light. The light-receiving means includes photodiodes and an analog switch, which receives light beams transmitted by optical channels and produces an analog signal representative of the specular reflection or diffuse reflection. The processing means includes an analog-to-digital converter, a micro-computer, and a display device.

* The apparatus operates by alternately controlling the switching on and off of the light source, and measuring the fluxes ΦSa, ΦDa, ΦS, and ΦD. The reflectance Re is calculated from these fluxes, taking into account the influence of ambient light and the geometry of the probe and optical channels. The apparatus can display the reflectance value as a curve representing the variation of the reflectance, and can store the results in a computer file.

* The apparatus can be calibrated by placing the probe before a light trap, a matt surface of reference, and a reference mirror. The calibration operation

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that provides a higher degree of cleansing, particularly in the gingival crevices, and promotes dental health through gentle massaging of the gums. The apparatus comprises a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members that fit over the teeth and snugly against the gums.

* The mouthpiece has a membrane structure and pneumatic means to move the channel members relative to the gums, massaging them, and hydraulic means to clean the teeth and gingival crevices and lubricate the gums during massaging. The apparatus also includes a control box that provides air pulses and water or cleaning fluid to the mouthpiece.

* The air pulses inflate and deflate air-sacks in the mouthpiece, causing the channel members to ride up and down on the gums, massaging them, while the water or cleaning fluid flows through holes in the channel members to clean and flush out the teeth and gums. The fluid also serves as a lubricant during the massaging action.

* The apparatus includes suction hoses to remove any fluid that seeps out between the gums and channel members, and a source of water and cleaning fluid can be provided to the control box. The control box can be operated in three modes: air only, water only, or both air and water.

* The apparatus can be operated from the control box or a remote control device, and various changes and modifications can be made to the embodiment without departing from the spirit and scope of the invention. For example, bristles can be added to the channel members to assist the massaging action.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, specifically addressing the issue of pelvic organ prolapse (POP) in women. POP occurs when the muscles and tissues that hold the pelvic organs in place become weakened or damaged, causing the organs to shift out of position. The invention aims to provide a reliable anchoring of the mesh implant.

* The invention includes an anterior implant with four straps, each ending with a looped end, and a loop between two interior straps for anchoring to the cervix. The implant may include spaces for reducing its weight. The anterior implant is used for reconstructing the anterior pelvic floor, including prolapse of the urinary bladder and/or the colon and the small intestine.

* The invention also includes a posterior implant with two straps, each ending with a looped end, and two loops for anchoring to the cervix and perineal body. The posterior implant is used for reconstructing the posterior pelvic floor, including prolapse of the colon, the small intestine, and/or the uterus. The implant may include spaces for reducing its weight.

* A needle is used for threading each of the straps through the ligaments. The needle has a rod that can be manually slid back and forth in a track within the body, and a tip for threading the strap through the ligament. The needle is used to thread the straps from the side having surgical access, without requiring additional perforations of the body from the opposing direction.

* The method of using the needle involves trapping the looped end of the strap, threading the needle through the ligament, releasing the trap, and pulling the needle back, leaving the strap threaded through the ligament. The surgeon can perform the procedure from the side having surgical access, without requiring additional perforations of the body from the opposing direction. The natural shrinking of the ligament towards the strap provides a secure anchoring.

* The invention provides a reliable anchoring of the mesh implant, and allows for a minimally invasive procedure with reduced risk of complications. The invention is suitable for reconstructing the pelvic floor in cases of pelvic organ prolapse. The invention provides a new and improved method and device for pelvic floor reconstruction using implants.

<summary>
• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need, particularly for spontaneously breathing human subjects requiring long-term ventilatory assistance during sleep.
The invention aims to match the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts, automatically adjust the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum ventilation, and provide some immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.
The invention is especially suitable for subjects with severe lung disease, chest wall disease, neuromuscular disease, or diseases of respiratory control.

• The invention discloses a method for calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable from 0 to 1 revolution, using fuzzy logic to determine the phase from the respiratory airflow.
The method includes selecting identifiable features of a prototype flow-vs-time waveform, determining the phase in the respiratory cycle for each feature, and assigning a weight to each phase.
The fuzzy inference rules are then applied to determine the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle.

• The invention further discloses a method for providing ventilatory assistance in a spontaneously breathing subject, comprising the steps of ascribing a desired waveform template function, calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle, and calculating a desired instantaneous delivery pressure.
The desired delivery pressure is calculated as an end expiratory pressure plus the desired pressure modulation amplitude multiplied by the value of the waveform template function at the calculated phase.
The delivered pressure to the subject is then set to the desired delivery pressure.

• The invention also discloses a method for calculating the average respiratory rate, comprising the steps of measuring respiratory airflow, calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle, and calculating the instantaneous rate of change of phase.
The average respiratory rate is then calculated by low pass filtering the instantaneous rate of change of phase.
The method can be used to detect changes in the subject's respiratory rate.

• The invention further discloses a method for calculating the instantaneous inspired volume of a subject, operable substantially without run-away under conditions of suddenly changing leak.
The method comprises the steps of determining respiratory airflow approximately corrected for leak, calculating an index varying from 0 to 1 equal to the fuzzy extent to which the corrected respiratory airflow is large positive for longer than expected, or large negative for longer than expected.
The instantaneous inspired volume is then calculated as the integral of the corrected respiratory airflow multiplied by the fuzzy negation of the index with respect to time, from start of inspiration.

• The invention yet further discloses a method for providing assisted ventilation to match the subject's need, comprising the steps

<summary>
• The invention relates to a novel electro-surgical dissection and cauterization instrument for use in laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures, particularly in abdominal surgery.
• The instrument features a rigid arm extending between the distal working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve, which reduces obstruction of the surgeon's view of the working tip electrode and surgical work site.
• The arm includes a portion laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve, providing maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site by the surgeon.
• The instrument also features an electrical insulating layer along the entire length of the tool up to the exposed working tip electrode, eliminating inadvertent cauterization of tissue with portions of the tool other than the working tip electrode.
• The instrument is designed for easy handling and use by the surgeon, and can be used in both open surgeries and laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.
• The working tip electrode comes in various shapes, such as a hook or flattened spatula, depending on the needs of the surgeon in a particular surgical application.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus that allows exposures with a subject in at least two predetermined exposure positions with predetermined adjustment parameters.
• In known MRI apparatuses, exposure parameters must be modified for different exposure positions, which requires a readjustment of the apparatus, taking 10-90 seconds per exposure position.
• The invention aims to provide high-contrast exposures in a short time, even for larger body segments, by determining required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process.
• The adjustment parameters are stored until the conclusion of the examination and can be used again when identical or similar exposure parameters are reached.
• The invention allows for quick switching of transmit and receive coils during the examination, resulting in reduced examination times.
• The apparatus can be used for various forms of MRI, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets, and is suitable for examinations such as tracking doses of contrast agent over a larger body region.
• The invention enables high-contrast exposures without omitting adjustments, and reduced examination times allow for tracking the course of contrast agent without chronological gaps.
• The adjustment process precedes the exposure process, and the required adjustment parameters are determined completely in the adjustment process, allowing for efficient and high-quality imaging.

<summary>
* The invention relates to fasteners for albums, such as photographic albums and scrapbooks, that allow for easy addition or replacement of pages.
* Conventional screw-type fasteners have been used, but they can be difficult to use and align, especially when adding pages to increase the album's size.
* The present invention provides a releasable fastener comprising a pair of strap anchors, one attached to the front cover and one to the back cover, and a strap that passes through aligned apertures in the covers and pages.
* The strap anchors have a channel with locking lips that snap-lock the strap in place, allowing for adjustment of the strap's effective length to accommodate varying album thickness.
* The strap anchors can be attached to the covers using adhesive, and the strap is designed for easy insertion and removal from the channel.
* The invention provides a more convenient and versatile fastening system compared to conventional screw-type fasteners.
* The fasteners can be produced inexpensively, making them a cost-effective alternative to conventional fasteners.
* The invention also provides an album having at least two fasteners mounted along the spine, with the strap anchors attached to the respective covers.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sulky with two wheels, individually fastened to a common frame, designed for trotting races. The sulky requires a lightweight construction, ease of use, and strength to endure strain during exercise and competitions. Conventional sulkies are made of welded steel, but the invention aims to create a sulky made of light metal and other lightweight materials.

• The object of the invention is to provide a sulky construction that can be manufactured from light metal and other lightweight materials, assembled easily by the user, and stored and transported in a flat package. The sulky should have a stable construction, with shafts and crossbar transferring load to the wheel planes only. The invention aims to provide a sulky that can be assembled by the user themselves using ordinary hand tools.

• Conventional sulkies have shafts fastened approximately 10 cm inside the wheels, which is suitable for welded steel pipes but not for light metals. Earlier attempts to build sulkies from aluminum have failed due to poor strength qualities, likely because the design was similar to conventional steel constructions requiring welding. The invention aims to overcome these limitations.

• The new sulky construction has shafts fastened to the frame in the planes of the wheels, allowing for a design well-suited for casting and mass production with low expenses. The invention integrates details required for wheel suspension, shaft fastening, and crossbar fastening into the casting process without additional expenditures. The design enables a structure suitable for box packaging and do-it-yourself kits based on simple threaded connections.

• The sulky has a weight reduction of approximately 40% compared to conventional sulkies, with a total weight of approximately 18 kg in a ready-to-use state. The invention provides a sulky that can be colored by applying color tapes in all recesses of the profiles, leading to an inexpensive and individual color display system. The sulky is designed to be easily assembled by the user themselves using ordinary hand tools.

• The sulky has a stable construction, with the end frames arranged symmetrically related to the plane of the wheels. The crossbar is adapted to the mounting bushings and can be fastened thereto, with the details of these joints being important to obtain a stable and rigid frame. The end frames are casted, preferably from aluminum or a similar light metal, and the crossbar is manufactured from extruded aluminum or a similar light metal.

• The wheels are fastened to the fork section of the end frames by conventional fast

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly for water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts. The system aims to eliminate air bubbles that may accumulate in the cooling system, which can cause local overheating and reduce efficiency. The invention provides a simple and effective solution to this problem.

* Prior art solutions have failed to address the issue of air bubbles in rotating water feeds, and existing ventilation systems are often complex and inefficient. The point of lowest pressure in a rotating machine is usually at the axis of rotation, where air bubbles tend to accumulate. Despite this, no attention has been paid to removing these air bubbles.

* The invention provides a bypass with at least one inlet and outlet arranged between the feed duct and discharge duct, with the inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation. This allows air bubbles to be rapidly and completely removed using the pressure gradient between the inflow and outflow. The bypass is designed to be simple in construction and operation.

* The bypass can be arranged in or on an end face of the feed duct, or as a radially arranged pipe member with an inlet in the space around the axis of rotation. Multiple bypasses can be provided, and the design can be adapted to different structural solutions. The invention provides a flexible and effective solution to the problem of air bubbles in rotating water feeds.

* The bypass can be designed with means to increase the hydrodynamic resistance of flow, allowing for a shorter distance and lower resistance to flow. This enables the provision of a ventilation system with smaller outer dimensions. The invention provides a compact and efficient solution to the problem of air bubbles.

* The invention has been illustrated with five embodiments, each showing a different structural arrangement for the feed duct, discharge duct, and bypass. The embodiments demonstrate the flexibility and adaptability of the invention, and its ability to be applied to different designs and configurations. The invention provides a comprehensive solution to the problem of air bubbles in rotating water feeds.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle, which comprises a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft rotatably about its longitudinal axis and a retaining part, which the jacket unit is secured non-displaceably up to a limit value of a force acting onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the front of the motor vehicle. If the limit value is exceeded, the jacket unit is displaceable parallel to the longitudinal axis in the direction toward the motor vehicle front. The jacket unit is connected with the retaining part across an energy absorption connection, which comprises at least one bending wire or strip that is deformed upon a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part parallel to the longitudinal direction toward the motor vehicle front.
* The steering column is preferably implemented such that it is adjustable in length, and an openable and closable securement device is provided, in the opened state of which the jacket unit is displaceable with respect to a bracket unit supporting the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft and which, in its closed state, applies a securement force for the securement of the jacket unit with respect to the bracket unit against a displacement parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft. The retaining part is formed by a part of the securement device, and the break-away connection between the retaining part and the jacket unit can be formed, for example, by a pin connecting these two parts, which, in the event of a crash, is sheared off if the limit value of the force acting upon the steering shaft and thereover onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the vehicle front is exceeded.
* The invention addresses the problem of at least decreasing the force peak (=break-away peak), and to do so in a simple and cost-effective yet functionally advantageous implementation. The elastic prestress of the at least one bending wire or strip acts on the break-away connection between the jacket unit and the retaining part, and the force required in the event of a crash to release the break-away connection is thereby decreased since the elastic reset force of the at least one bending wire or strip is added to the force exerted, in particular through the secondary collision of the driver with the steering wheel, parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the vehicle front.

<summary>

• The present invention relates to a process for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of motor vehicles and the like, using flat, uncurved glass panels to form curved windows. The conventional process of installing curved glass panels is expensive and has several disadvantages.

• The conventional process involves pre-contouring and pre-stressing the glass panels, which makes them more brittle and prone to shattering in accidents. In contrast, flat glass panels are less rigid and more flexible, making them less likely to shatter and more able to absorb shock.

• The cost of a flat glass panel is significantly lower than that of a pre-treated, pre-contoured glass panel, making it a more economical option. Additionally, the cost of packaging and shipping flat glass panels is lower.

• The present invention provides a process for economically and inexpensively installing glass windows of a curved nature in vehicle windows and the like. The process involves flexing a flat glass panel to conform to the curved window opening.

• The flexed glass panel is held in place by a holding means, such as a reveal molding and clips, which engage and maintain the glass in the curved window opening. The glass panel is then secured in place using a weather sealant and adhesive compound.

• The fastening means comprises a plurality of resilient clips uniformly spaced about the perimeter of the window bay and a reveal molding cooperatively secured to the clips. The reveal molding is provided with a resilient bias, pressing on the outer surface of the glass panel, pushing it into conforming engagement with the bay of the window opening.

• The glass panel is flexed from its initial flat configuration into the conforming curvature of the window, and thereafter, a weather sealant and adhesive compound are applied in situ along the confronting edges of the window panel. The adhesive is allowed to cure until the panel becomes fixed permanently in the window opening in its conforming curvature.

• The present invention provides a method for installing a window panel in a curved opening of a vehicle, which overcomes the disadvantages of the conventional process. The method is simple, economical, and provides a more flexible and shock-absorbing glass panel.

• The invention is illustrated and described with reference to the installation of glass in the rear window of an automobile, but it can be applied to installations in other vehicle windows or the like. The same principles apply to installations in other curved window openings.

• The present invention provides a significant improvement over the prior art, offering a more economical and efficient method for installing curved glass panels in vehicle windows. The

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for removing a gas, such as oxygen, from a liquid, such as water, particularly on an offshore hydrocarbon recovery platform. The apparatus includes a vessel with multiple gasification chambers, each with a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas, such as nitrogen, into the liquid to displace the first gas.
* The invention provides a compact and efficient way to remove oxygen from water, reducing the risk of corrosion in equipment, and can be used in various applications, including oil and gas production, paper and pulp, textile, electricity generating, and food processing industries. The apparatus can be controlled and monitored using sensors and control systems to optimize the removal of the first gas.

<summary>
• The packaging machine has a plurality of work stations that operate in synchronism with each other and define a production direction, with each work station including at least one movable tool member.
• The machine is provided with a rotationally driven shaft arranged in the production direction, which drives the tool members of multiple work stations through transfer mechanisms.
• The transfer mechanisms convert the rotational movement of the shaft into the movement required to operate the respective tool member, synchronizing the movements of the tool members mechanically.
• The machine can be a deep-drawing packaging machine, with work stations including a forming station, a sealing station, and a separating station.
• The forming station forms packaging troughs in a web-shaped packaging material, the sealing station seals the packaging troughs with a top foil, and the separating station cuts the packaging material into individual packages.
• The machine can have a compact design, with work stations arranged on different vertical levels and the packaging material deflected by 180° between two work stations.
• The shaft is supported by a frame, and the transfer mechanisms can include toggle levers and/or cam mechanisms to convert the rotational movement of the shaft into the desired movement of the tool members.
• The machine can be modified to include additional work stations and/or drive further tool members, and tool members can be designed to be replaceable and removable laterally relative to the production direction.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a finishing article, such as a grinding wheel, with a drive member non-removably affixed thereto for mounting on a rotatable spindle of a power tool.
• The drive member includes a backing flange with gripping means secured by a retaining nut positioned on the opposite side from the backing flange.
• The retaining nut extends through an opening in the finishing article and has a radial flange at one end seated against the finishing article face and protrusion means extending outwardly from the other end.
• A pressure cap defining a central opening is held in place by the gripping means on the backing flange and extends longitudinally away from the backing flange to engage the power tool spindle seat.
• The finishing article is placed in compression during use, and the more force that is applied to the grinding wheel during utilization, the greater the operational compression becomes.
• The compression or clamping force maintains the grinding wheel upon the spindle and prevents rotation relative to the drive member or hub assembly.
• The spent grinding wheel may be easily removed from the spindle for disposal without the utilization of hand tools or the like.
• The invention provides a secure attachment of the abrasive finishing article to the power tool and precludes relative rotation of the grinding wheel with respect to the driving member.
• The device is extremely smooth in operation with no vibration, and all parts are perfectly aligned one with the other with abutting surfaces parallel when in compression.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system, which includes a housing block, a motor, and a covering hood, and is designed to prevent pressure fluid from entering the motor and electrical components. The unit features a conduit that diverts pressure fluid entrained by pump pistons away from electrical components and into a spring chamber.
* The conduit is formed by multiple portions, including a first portion that extends downward from the cam element chamber, and a second portion that connects the spring chamber to the motor interior, allowing for pressure equalization between the two. This design prevents electrolytically active ingredients in the pressure fluid from attacking electrical components.
* The invention also features a pressure equalization conduit between the motor interior and the covering hood, which is formed by interstices between wires and a cable sheath, and allows for air flow and pressure equalization between the two. This design prevents water from entering the unit and ensures reliable operation of the brake system.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system that allows for the transfer of carriers from one predetermined path to another by pushing across a transfer zone in a minimum period of time with minimum cost and maintenance.
* The system uses a third dog that is normally urged to an operative carrier pushing position but is held by the track out of operative position, and can be selectively operated to transfer carriers across short or long distances.
* The system can be configured in various ways, including with different track configurations and dog arrangements, to accommodate different transfer distances and requirements.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners, providing effective grounding without the use of conductive plates, clips, or shunts attached to the liner. The liner material has similar mechanical properties to the liner disclosed in Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951, but with improved electrical properties. The invention exceeds the NFPA standards for static electricity conductivity by an order of magnitude.

• The liner is composed of a base ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material with a conductive material additive, such as 2.0% carbon black, which is mixed with the UHMW-PE in particulate or powder form and then heated under mold pressure for thermoforming. The conductive material can be added to other plastics or molding methods, and other polymers can be used as the self-lubricating matrix. The liner still has all the same properties that make the liner beneficial, with the additional benefit of being conductive.

• The liner is formed of dry self-lubricating material to eliminate the need for applying separate lubricating materials to the center plate assembly, which permits the center plate and bowl area of the car to be free of wet type lubricants. The liner is pliable but non-stretchable and is sufficiently compaction resistant to resist any substantial compaction under compressive forces up to its elastic limit. The liner has a high degree of elastic memory for full return to original shape after being stressed, up to its elastic limit.

• The liner is designed to withstand loads imposed by cars having a mass bearing on each center bowl on the order of 25,000 to 122,000 pounds, depending on the specific cars' contents and construction standards. The load placed on the liner by the weight carried in the car has beneficial effects on the properties of the liner, increasing conductivity as the distance between the particles decreases. The liner is compressed under load, and as the matrix wears or ablates, new carbon black particulates are exposed.

• The invention provides a liner with all the benefits of the Chierici et al patent, with the additional benefit that the liner is now conductive, eliminating the need for any additional grounding apparatus. The liner is conductive, made from ultra-high molecular weight polyethylene specially mixed with a conductive material such as 2% carbon black. The carbon black is known on the market as Monarch 700 anti-static agent.

• The full bowl liner

<summary>
• The invention relates to a valve for controlling the dispensing of viscous substances, such as sauces and condiments, from flexible bags or pouches.
• The valve is designed to be operated with one hand, allowing the other hand to hold a receiving vessel, and is particularly useful in fast-food restaurants and other settings.
• The prior art valves have limitations, including inability to be disassembled for cleaning and residue accumulation, which the present invention aims to overcome.
• The present invention provides a gate valve that can be mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch and includes a tubular sleeve, a dispensing passage, and a reciprocable gate.
• The gate is curved complementally to the guide and can be moved to open or close the valve by engaging lugs on the gate and guide with the fingers of one hand.
• The valve can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily, and can function when the valve assembly is in an inclined position, such as when mounted in a dispenser.
• The valve provides an effective seal when closed and allows for variable flow when partially opened, with no obstruction to flow when fully opened.
• The invention includes a spout insert mounting sleeve with annular sealing ribs and a passage with a discharge outlet, and a gate valve guide member with a transversely-curved plate and lugs for guiding the gate.
• The valve can be operated with one hand, allowing for easy and convenient dispensing of viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a vehicle rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of an output of a vehicle control, such as a reverse-gear indication. The system includes a microcomputer that determines the protocol by monitoring the output of the vehicle control and adjusting a running average parameter accordingly. The microcomputer uses a power-up sequence and a main sequence to determine the protocol, which is then used to control the reflectance level of an electrochromic mirror element. The system can be used with various types of vehicles with minimal modifications.

• The invention uses a software-based technique to determine the protocol of the output of the vehicle control, which reduces hardware expenses and utilizes existing microcomputer resources. The technique involves incrementing or decrementing a running average parameter based on the output of the vehicle control, and comparing it to high and low count parameters to determine the protocol. The system can distinguish between different types of light sources, such as incandescent or sunlight, and can be implemented using an 8-bit register. The invention provides a flexible and adaptable solution for vehicle rearview mirror systems.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, which includes a hydraulic pump, a modulator, and a pressure discharge valve. The system is designed to prevent the front wheel from locking during braking, and it achieves this by rapidly cycling the brake on and off. The system also includes a sensor that detects the angular deceleration of the front wheel and triggers the pressure discharge valve to open when the wheel is about to lock.
* The system also includes an anti-dive unit that is connected to the front fork of the motorcycle, which helps to prevent the front fork from diving during braking. The anti-dive unit includes a valve that opens and closes in response to the pressure in the hydraulic system, and it helps to maintain the stability of the motorcycle during braking. The system is designed to improve the safety and stability of the motorcycle during braking, especially on slippery or uneven road surfaces.

<summary>

* The present invention relates to movable partitions and panels used to separate or insulate cargo during transportation or storage, particularly for multi-temperature transport. The invention allows for the segregation of cargo into areas maintained at different temperatures. The partitions and bulkheads are designed to be used in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or ocean-going containers. The invention improves upon existing partition systems by providing more flexibility and efficiency.

* The prior art partition systems have limitations, such as cooling the entire cargo space even when it's not fully utilized, which leads to unnecessary strain on the refrigeration unit, increased fuel consumption, and longer cooling times. The existing systems also do not allow for easy division of the cargo space into sections of varying sizes. The present invention addresses these limitations by providing a more efficient and flexible partition system. The invention allows for the creation of multiple cargo areas with different temperature zones.

* The invention includes an improved partition system with at least two panels that are independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies, allowing each panel to be moved independently. The panels can be slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails in a refrigerated trailer, enabling the creation of multiple cargo areas with different temperature zones. The panels can be moved towards the front or rear of the trailer to define different cargo areas. The system is designed to be flexible and adaptable to different cargo needs.

* The partition system can be implemented in a variety of configurations, such as installing the rails on the side walls of the trailer, enabling the panels to open like a standard household door. The mounting assembly can be replaced with any mechanism that permits rotational, slideable, or hinged movement between the rails and the bulkhead. The rails can be replaced with other receiving members that cooperate with the selected mounting means. The system is designed to be modular and adaptable to different trailer designs.

* The invention includes a rail system with longitudinal rails having an internal channel adapted to receive a slidable member, preferably a roller. The rail system also includes end rails that provide a mount for the ends of the longitudinal rails and function as a trolley stop. The end rails are fixed to the trailer walls or ceiling with standard fasteners. The rail system is designed to be sturdy and reliable.

* The panels are hingedly attached to the trolley assembly, which permits the panels to rotate about the hinge rod. The trolley assembly includes hinge plates fixedly secured to the panels, a hinge rod, and trolleys that serve to suspend the panel from the rails. The trolleys include rollers that

<summary>
• The invention relates to a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and fluid handling, particularly in the pharmaceutical industry. The valve allows for the separation and purification of biological macromolecules without the need for disassembly. The valve features a rotor and stator with a diaphragm that can be partially separated to allow for sanitizing fluid to flush across the process fluid-contacting surfaces. The diaphragm is designed to maintain a sterile condition of the process system during sanitization.

• The valve has a unique design that allows for the rotor and stator to be partially separated, allowing for sanitizing fluid to flush across the process fluid-contacting surfaces without losing fluid to the outside. The valve also features a barrier fluid flow path that prevents the release of liquid to the environment and prevents the accumulation of dried salt deposits. The barrier fluid flow path is designed to clean the inner and outer sides of the port sealing ledges and the diaphragm. The valve also features sumps to contain any liquid that may escape during operation.

• The valve is designed to be used in conjunction with a carousel of columns or solid phase bed segments, and can be used for a variety of applications including simulated moving bed (SMB) adsorption and separation. The valve can be used to separate biomolecules such as proteins or peptides, and can be used in the pharmaceutical industry for the purification of pharmaceuticals. The valve can also be used for size exclusion fractionation and ion exchange fractionation. The valve is designed to be simple and reliable, and can be used in a variety of applications.

• The valve features a diaphragm that is molded to provide hollow sleeves that extend upward from the rotor body to terminate in integral flange gaskets. The diaphragm also features dynamic wipe sealing lips that form the physical delimitation between the first and second diaphragm surfaces. The diaphragm is designed to be flexible and can be molded from a variety of materials, including thermoplastic elastomers. The diaphragm is designed to be steam sterilizable and inert to sodium hydroxide.

• The valve can be operated in a variety of modes, including normal operation, sanitization, and storage. During normal operation, the valve is used to separate and purify biological macromolecules. During sanitization, the valve is partially separated to allow for sanitizing fluid to flush across the process fluid-contacting surfaces. During storage, the valve can be left in an elevated or relaxed position to prevent compression setting of the diaphrag

<summary>
* The present invention relates to gas-liquid contacting trays and improvements in valve-tray assemblies, particularly an improved tray valve assembly for a process column. The valve cover is mounted by first and second legs, the first leg being disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray and being wider than the second leg. The legs are mounted to the tray in outwardly slotted portions thereof for defining the orientation of the valve relative to the liquid flow. The valve also includes means for selectively biasing the rear region of the valve upwardly against the flow of liquid for facilitating initial, directionalized vapor flow therethrough.
* The invention includes an improved method of mixing vapor with liquid discharged from a downcomer of a process column onto an underlying cross-flow tray. The method comprises forming the tray with a plurality of directional thrust valves disposed therein, the valves being formed of generally circular disc members disposed above circular apertures formed within the tray. The disc members have first and second legs in support thereof, the first leg being wider than said second leg for directing flow therearound. The step of forming the disc members includes biasing the frontal end of the disc which first engages the liquid flow downwardly relative to the rear end for facilitating the directional flow of vapor therethrough.
* The invention also includes an improved tray valve assembly for a process column, wherein the valve is formed of a round disc having the first and second legs depending downwardly therefrom. Each of the legs are formed with outwardly extending flange portions for underlying the tray and locking the disc in a floating relationship relative thereto. The valve aperture is circular in shape and the valve legs are disposed in slotted regions disposed outwardly of the circular aperture to prevent the rotation of the valve plate for maintaining the orientation of the valve leg relative to the tray. The biasing means comprises a detent portion formed on the cover of the valve for preventing the surface thereof from resting flush against the tray surface.
* The invention provides a method of and apparatus for enhanced vapor liquid flow manifesting increased efficiency with a directional thrust valve assembly. The valve assembly is provided by the present invention wherein a circular tray valve is supported by first and second support legs, oriented into the liquid flow of the tray with the first leg having a wider surface area presented to the flow for diverting the flow therearound. The width of the first leg is substantially less than the diameter of the circular valve aperture, about which the liquid is induced to flow into engagement with the vapor passing therethrough. The

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure, reducing variances in output pressure, and is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain. The assembly is lightweight and portable, and reduces the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate fluid pressure. It is particularly useful for applications such as gas grills, self-contained underwater breathing apparatuses, and medical applications.

* The assembly comprises a pressurized fluid source, a vane motor, a fluid regulator, and a generator. The vane motor converts pressurized fluid into mechanical power, which is then converted into electrical energy by the generator. The fluid regulator reduces the pressure of the fluid before it exits the assembly.

* The vane motor is a preferred embodiment of the invention, but other types of motors, such as turbines or piston motors, can be used. The vane motor has a drive shaft, a casing, and a hollow interior with vanes that extend and retract to convert fluid pressure into mechanical power. The vanes are designed to reduce drag coefficient and maximize forward torque.

* The fluid regulator is a standard regulator that reduces the pressure of the fluid to a desired level. It has a high-pressure cavity, a low-pressure cavity, and a valve stem that opens and closes to regulate fluid flow. The regulator is designed to maintain a consistent output pressure despite changes in input pressure.

* The generator is an electrical generator that converts mechanical power from the vane motor into electrical energy. It can be used to power electrical appliances, such as a rotisserie or a headlight. The generator can be of any desired type, including direct current or alternating current generators.

* The assembly can be used in various applications, including gas grills, self-contained underwater breathing apparatuses, and medical applications. In a gas grill, the assembly can be used to power a rotisserie or other electrical appliances. In a self-contained underwater breathing apparatus, the assembly can be used to power a headlight or other electrical appliances.

* The advantages of the invention include the ability to generate power while regulating fluid pressure, reducing variances in output pressure, and reducing the size and cost of a regulator. The assembly is also lightweight and portable, and can be used in a variety of applications. The invention can be modified and adapted to suit specific needs and requirements.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a pallet system that facilitates loading and unloading, and limits the shifting of loaded items. The system includes a pallet with raised guide rails that support trays with side supports, and end stops to limit longitudinal movement of the trays.
* The pallet system can be customized for specific loads, such as egg trays, and the guide rails and end plates can be shaped to complement the contours of the trays. The system allows for automated loading and unloading of trays, and provides enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped.
* The pallet cap can be a separate component that fits onto a conventional pallet base, or a single integrated unit. The pallet cap has pockets that fit into the pallet base, and raised guide rails that support the trays.
* The end plates are vertically positioned at the edges of the pallet and have an inside surface shaped to complement the contours of the trays. The end plates can be secured to the stack of trays using wrapping, and provide additional stability and protection to the load.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system.
* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, which includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft in the radial direction and between the upper and lower guideways in the axial direction, and the electromotive ring, magnetic suspension shaft, and magnetic suspension guide rail form a magnetic suspension electric engine.
* The invention also includes two improvement solutions, namely coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings, which can overcome the problem of reactive torque and enhance the power performance of the flying saucer.

<summary>
• The invention relates to streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, which can be used for the isolation, purification, and detection of recombinant proteins. These muteins have mutations in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, resulting in a higher binding affinity than wild-type streptavidin.

• The streptavidin muteins can be produced by transforming a host cell with a vector containing a nucleic acid coding for the mutein, culturing the host cell, and isolating the polypeptide. The muteins can be used in various applications, including affinity chromatography, Western blots, and ELISA.

• The invention also concerns a process for the production of streptavidin muteins, which involves transforming a host cell with a vector containing a nucleic acid coding for the mutein, culturing the host cell, and isolating the polypeptide. The muteins can be used to immobilize proteins fused with a peptide sequence, and can also be used in conventional streptavidin/biotin systems.

<summary>
• The invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, which are more efficient and environmentally friendly than traditional methods. The methods involve reacting amines or pyrrolidines with guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas in the presence of a nickel catalyst. The nickel catalysts are preferably derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, or nickel on silica/alumina. The reactions can be carried out at room temperature or under ambient conditions.

• The guanylating agents used in the methods are thioureas and isothioureas, which have specific structures and can be protected with groups such as Boc or Cbz. The protecting groups can be easily removed from the resulting guanidines under mild reaction conditions. The methods can be used to synthesize N-substituted and N,N-disubstituted guanidines from bis-protected thioureas. The reactions can be carried out in solvents such as DMF, THF, DMSO, or water.

• The invention also provides examples of the synthesis of isothioureas and thioureas, which are used as guanylating agents in the methods. The synthesis of N,N'-bis-tert-butoxycarbonylthiourea, N-arylsulfonyl-S-methylisothiourea, and N,N'-diphenyl-S-methylisothiourea and N,N'-diphenyl-S-benzylisothiourea are described. The guanylation reactions of amines with these guanylating agents are also described, including the reaction conditions and yields.

• The methods of the invention have several advantages over traditional methods, including the use of mild reaction conditions, high yields, and the ability to use a variety of amines and guanylating agents. The methods are also more environmentally friendly due to the use of nickel catalysts, which are less toxic than traditional catalysts such as mercuric salts. The reactions can be carried out on a large scale, making them suitable for industrial applications.

• The invention also provides examples of the guanylation of pyrrolidine with N,N'-bis-tert-butoxycarbonylthiourea in the presence of varying molar concentrations of nickel-boride, as well as the use of different nickel catalysts such as

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires with excellent weatherability or fade resistance.
* The method involves anodic oxidation of the aluminum strip or wire, followed by electrolytic coloring in a bath containing a nickel salt, cobalt salt, copper salt, tin salt, or selenious acid.
* The anodic oxidation bath composition is typically an aqueous solution of 10-55% sulfuric acid, and the thickness of the oxide film formed should be thicker than 4 microns.
* The electrolytic coloring bath composition is selected depending on the desired color, and the color tone obtained is substantially constant regardless of the thickness of the oxide film.
* The apparatus includes a means for continuously supplying the aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, and a sealing bath.
* The aluminum strip or wire is passed successively through the baths, and the electric current is controlled by rheostats and the immersion period or area of the aluminum strip or wire.
* The apparatus can produce continuously and with a low cost aluminum strips or wires having colored oxide films or layers thereon superior in weatherability or fade resistance.
* The invention provides a simple and efficient method for coloring aluminum strips or wires without requiring a large amount of electrical energy.
* The electrolytic coloring bath can be stirred by air stirring, circulation of the electrolyte, or using one or more stirrers to accomplish effective coloring treatment.
* The distance between the electrodes in the electrolytic coloring bath does not influence the color of the oxide film, but the potential between them is influenced by variations in the distance.
