<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for stimulating crude oil reservoirs to enhance production using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods, which can stimulate oil flow and increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs.
* The invention uses a coupled process of direct electrohydraulic acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations to mobilize oil and increase production, and can be customized to produce specific frequencies to achieve optimal stimulation by activating specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir.

<summary>
* The disclosure relates to a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures. The splice includes two wave plates with transverse protrusions that receive and seat transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip. The plates are coupled together using a connective device that extends through perforations in the plates.
* The splice is used to lengthen the extent of a soil reinforcing element into adjacent backfill, which is necessary when the soil reinforcing element is not long enough to adequately reinforce a vertical facing. The grid-strip is attached to the soil reinforcing element using the splice, and the combination of the two forms a composite soil reinforcing element. The spacing of the transverse wires on the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip may be the same or different.
* The splice is secured by tightening a nut onto the connective device, which clamps down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip, preventing them from translating laterally and escaping the splice. Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element to achieve a desired reinforcing distance from the vertical facing. The disclosure provides a system and method for splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, allowing for efficient production and maintenance. The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, enabling the ability to rebuild a blade by replacing worn-out parts. The invention also involves a process of ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along the plow blade, maximizing desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid. This method is adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities.
* The plow blade design includes a leading edge section with a void or channel that allows fluid to flow through and exit at controlled locations and with a controlled flow rate. The fluid pressure at a certain point along the blade's length can be varied by adjusting the length of the fluid tube and the number of leading edge sections. The invention provides a nearly infinite variety of configurations in an economic manner, allowing for tailoring to specific job requirements. The components are manufactured with traditional manufacturing processes, providing an easily tailored configuration.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a building system, particularly stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, procedures, methods, panels, flashings, reinforcements, and cavity walls of part stucco construction. The system allows for the creation of larger panels without movement control joints, exceeding the current regulatory limits of 2.4 meters high and 4 meters wide. The invention provides compliance with NZS3604 and NZS4251 building codes. The system includes a frame or substructure, battens, meshes, and a plaster matrix.

• The invention provides a building envelope with battens that support part or all of an in situ formed panel, which is about 21 mm thick. The panel has an inner mesh attached to the battens, zonal reinforcement mesh outwardly of corners of openings, an outer mesh, and a plaster matrix embedding all of the meshes. The outer mesh is of smaller opening size than the inner mesh and zonal reinforcement mesh. The system provides a useful choice for the public.

• The invention consists of a building having at least one stucco wall, with a stucco matrix laid up as plural settable layers. The wall is at least 2.4 meters high, 4 meters wide, and 21 mm thick, and includes a frame or substructure, battens, reinforcement metal mesh, and a plaster matrix. The system provides a useful choice for the public and complies with NZS3604 and NZS4251 building codes. The invention includes various features such as corner reinforcement, lattice-like periphery defining members, and flashings.

• The invention provides a method of in situ formation of a reinforced plaster panel as cladding of a support structure. The method includes fixing battens to the support structure, preparing for panel creation, applying plaster into and onto the inner mesh, applying a second and levelling coat, overlaying with an outer mesh, and applying a third plaster coat. The method leads to a building, cavity wall type structure, or stucco panel, which is a result of the method. The invention is also any product of the method.

• The invention provides a building structure comprising or including framing of a pair of intersecting walls, battens, a lower set of stucco panels, a higher set of stucco panels, and plural flashing members in and/or behind the space defined between the lower and higher sets. The flashing members include one flashing member that extends about the framing at

<summary>
* The invention relates to a safe and door structure that provides a new and improved readily assembled, low-cost door and safe structure. The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls that provide stops for retaining the door. The door is inserted into the grooves at an angle and then laterally displaced until it is in abutment with the seat of the shallower groove.
* The safe construction can be formed using a liner made of plastic, metal, or other materials, and can be embedded in concrete or formed as a standalone structure. The door is secured with a lock assembly that includes a latch bolt and safety bolts to prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts. The invention provides a simple, yet effective door and safe construction that can be adapted to various applications.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, particularly in low permeability formations. The method involves cementing a conduit fitted with a filter at its bottom end in a borehole at a desired location, and then pressurizing the conduit to clear the filter of cement grout and displace the grout to achieve a fluid connection between the formation and the filter. The pressure sensing device is then connected to the filter to measure the fluid pressure of the formation.

• The invention provides a more reliable connection system between a pressure sensing location within a cement grouted borehole and the transducer system used to monitor the pressure in the surrounding geological formation. The system includes a conduit with a filter at its bottom end, a check valve, and a pressure transducer, which are connected together and lowered into the borehole. The borehole is then filled with a cementitious material, and the filter is cleared of grout and connected to the formation.

• The invention also provides a method of monitoring fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, which includes forming a borehole in the formation, placing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole, and filling the borehole with a cementitious material. The filter is then cleared of grout, and a pressure sensing device is connected to the filter to measure the fluid pressure of the formation. The method can also include a hydrofracture stage to create a fluid pathway between the filter and the formation.

• The invention is particularly useful in low permeability formations, where traditional standpipe systems are not effective. The system can be used in a variety of applications, including groundwater monitoring, oil and gas exploration, and coal seam gas extraction. The invention provides a more accurate and reliable method of measuring fluid pressures in geological formations.

• The pressure transducer can be located at the bottom of the borehole, or can be located at the surface and connected to the filter via a conduit. The system can also include a packer to seal the conduit and prevent fluid flow, and a vent to allow fluid to pass through the seal when it is being moved. The pressure transducer can be removed and relocated to a different depth in the borehole if necessary.

• The invention provides a number of advantages over traditional methods of measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, including improved accuracy, reliability, and flexibility. The system can be used in a variety of formations and applications, and can be adapted to suit specific requirements. The invention provides a valuable tool for

<summary>
* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter.
* The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
* The elastic members are designed to permit no deformation to occur in the elastic member at the time when the drying shrinkage and/or creep of the bridge girders has come to be convergent and the bridge girder length in time of ordinary temperatures has been reached.
* The joint block is mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap, and the components such as the joint block are fitted in detachable fashion by bolting or the like and consequently, may be easily given the maintenance thereof.
* The invention is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to the tires, permits less occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given the maintenance.
* The invention prevents the occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for the achievement of smooth vehicle traveling, and the components such as the joint block are fitted in detachable fashion by bolting or the like and consequently, may be easily given the maintenance thereof.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, particularly in the meat processing industry, where cooked meat products are cooled using a chilled brine solution. The system aims to prevent the contamination of the brine solution by the wheels of hand trucks used to transport the meat products.

* The conventional method of air chilling cooked meat products has several drawbacks, including dehydration and shrinkage of the product, and slow heat transfer rates. The use of a chilled brine solution can overcome these issues, but requires a system to prevent contamination of the solution.

* The invention provides an enclosed floor track system that allows hand trucks to be used in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the brine solution. The system includes a wheel channel that is elevated above the floor and has a cover plate that prevents the brine solution from entering the channel.

* The wheel channel is designed to accommodate hand trucks with horizontally axled wheel structures, and includes a wheel guide to keep the truck centered within the track. The cover plate is hinged to allow for easy cleaning of the track system.

* An alternative embodiment of the invention uses inflatable elastomer seals to enclose the wheel channel and prevent the brine solution from entering. The seals are attached to the sidewalls of the channel and can be inflated to fit snugly around the I-beam strut of the hand truck.

* The invention provides a sanitary and efficient way to cool cooked meat products using a chilled brine solution, and allows for the reuse of the solution without the need for decontamination. The system is particularly useful in the meat processing industry, but may also be applicable to other industries.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a lock device for a work machine, specifically a backhoe, that prevents the boom from tilting due to its weight when not in use.
* The lock device consists of an engaging member, an engaged member, and a guide member, which work together to lock the boom in place when it is rotated to a certain position.
* The engaging member is slidably attached to the boom and has a hook part that engages with the engaged member, which is attached to the boom bracket, to lock the boom in place.
* The guide member guides the engaging member and prevents it from slipping out of place, ensuring that the boom remains locked until it is intentionally released.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaning device with a flexible platform that can be adjusted to regulate suction efficiency during cleaning.
• The device has a central vacuum portion that can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom to enable precise regulation of suction.
• The adjustment mechanism is located on top of the vacuum head and can be operated by hand without tools.
• The device can be used with existing pool cleaning devices with minimal modification.
• The invention overcomes the drawbacks of prior art devices that require adjustment of the suction source or manual adjustment of the suction head.
• The device has a rectangular platform with a central opening and a cylindrical member that connects to a flexible suction line.
• The platform has outboard roller assemblies with vertically movable axles that support rollers that engage the pool bottom.
• The device also has inboard roller assemblies with axles that are connected to a frame member that spans the platform.
• The frame member has apertures that receive the axles, and a connector means that connects the frame member to the platform.
• The device can be sold in kit form for use with existing suction head assemblies, and assembly requires minimal modification to the existing device.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing, including a sub-unit for mounting onto a drill string.
* The apparatus features a retriever section that is slidably engaged onto a mandrel section of the sub-unit, allowing for vertical movement but preventing rotational movement, and is adapted with protruding members to engage with a wear bushing.
* The retriever section can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole, and can be easily removed and installed for quickly removing the wear bushing during drilling operations.
* The invention solves the problem of crimping the walls of the wear bushing or damaging the retriever unit due to the weight of the drill string, by allowing the retriever section to "float" along the length of the mandrel section.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a downhole vibratory tool that allows passage of a wireline or other tools through its central passage, which can be closed by landing a plug on a seat.
• The tool features a modular design with stacked pistons that increase the delivered power per stroke, and a dump valve that opens and closes without slamming against a seat.
• The tool can be operated to deliver high-amplitude, low-frequency oscillating forces to a stuck fish without impacts, or with impacts on each cycle, depending on the overpull amount.
• The design eliminates significant cyclical impacts on the valve and allows for the use of beefier springs, reducing stresses and extending their life.
• The tool can be used in various applications, including fishing, stimulation, and torque transmission, and provides a reliable and economical solution for downhole operations.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a precast concrete retaining wall system comprising a face panel with an integral counterfort and a base piece, which can be assembled on-site without requiring temporary shoring. The counterfort extends perpendicularly from the face panel and has a flat bottom, and may have an opening for drainage near the bottom front corner. The face panel and counterfort are precast with rebars that extend through the bottom of the counterfort, which are then inserted into openings in the base piece and secured with grout. This connection allows for a strong and stable retaining wall that can be used in various applications.

• The invention also discloses various embodiments of the retaining wall system, including the use of H-piles for added stability in poor soil conditions, and the integration of a vehicle impact barrier on top of or behind the wall. The barrier can be cast-in-place or precast and attached to the face panel. The retaining wall system offers flexibility in design and installation, and can be customized to meet specific requirements. The invention provides a cost-effective and efficient solution for retaining walls, eliminating the need for on-site casting and temporary shoring.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production. The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and existing down hole heaters fail for lack of design elements that protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack. The invention provides a down hole heating system that focuses heat in the production zone and protects electrical components from damage.

• The down hole heating system of the present invention includes a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods. The system is designed to contain heat within the desired zone and focus it on the production formation itself, allowing oil and paraffin to flow to the well bore for pumping. The use of stainless steel collars and heat insulating packers helps to minimize heat conduction and convection away from the production zone.

• The invention also includes a method for use of the down hole heating system, which involves installing the system in an oil or gas well and using it to heat treat the well for improving well flow. The method can be used in conjunction with other well treatments or maintenance, and can be particularly beneficial in treating deep gas wells with an iron sulfide occlusion problem. The invention provides a reliable and effective solution for improving oil and gas well production.

<summary>
* The invention relates to downhole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects. The mechanism is designed to promote effective connection and disconnection of a pull tool to a downhole object or fish.

* The invention is an improvement over existing technology, which often requires jarring or violent movement to disconnect the pull tool from the object, potentially causing damage to the tool or well equipment. The new mechanism allows for simple and efficient disconnection and reconnection.

* The pull tool can take the form of an external overshot or an internal spear, and is designed to be run into the well bore on a wire line to establish a mechanical connection with an object and apply sufficient force to remove it. The tool structure includes an outer tubular body and an inner body structure that moves telescopically within the outer body.

* The inner body structure has a locking mandrel that engages with the object to be removed, and a catch mechanism that secures the inner body to the outer body. The catch mechanism includes a pin that alternates between locking and unlocking grooves to control the engagement and disengagement of the tool.

* The tool also includes a piston and guide element that establishes proper positioning of the inner and outer body structures during relative movement. An adjusting spacer element allows for accurate positioning of the tool connector sub with respect to the object to be removed.

* The invention includes a controllable locking mechanism that ensures alternate latching and unlatching of the pulling tool mechanism. The mechanism includes spring elements that guide the pin and control the rotation of the inner and outer body structures.

* The tool can be latched and unlatched multiple times without needing to be removed from the well bore for resetting. This allows for efficient and effective removal of objects from the well bore.

* The invention is not limited to a specific embodiment, and other embodiments may be employed within the teachings of the invention. The mechanism is designed to be versatile and adaptable to different downhole service operations.

* The invention provides a significant improvement over existing technology, allowing for safe, efficient, and effective removal of objects from well bores. The mechanism is designed to reduce the risk of damage to the tool or well equipment, and to simplify the process of removing stuck or lost objects.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors, which includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, and assembling them together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means.

• The invention aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate, prevent deformation, and provide a longer useful life with the possibility of corrective maintenance. The composed stave floors of the invention can be manufactured with a sight substrate obtained from decorative or functional substrate, wood cut in tangential form, quarter form, or another possible cutting.

• The example embodiments of the invention provide improved composed stave floors with increased durability, which do not exhibit detachment or deformation, and can be manufactured with applied glaze from the supplier, eliminating the time and inconveniences of glaze application during installation. The invention also allows for the use of site-preferred glazes, such as aluminum oxide or another metal, which provide higher hardness without changing the aesthetic appearance.

<summary>
* The invention relates to ladder attachments that improve the lateral stability of ladders, prevent slipping or sliding, and prevent damage to the work surface. The attachments provide a non-slip gripping portion that grips the work surface without damaging it, and increase the contact area of the ladder with the work surface.

* The attachments consist of an extension arm with a flange and a U-bolt that secures the arm to the ladder rung, and a resilient pad assembly that pivotally connects to the arm. The pad assembly can pivot vertically or horizontally to accommodate different work surfaces, including corners.

* The attachments can be installed on either side of the ladder and can be adjusted to fit different ladder sizes. The clamp secures the arm to the siderail, and the U-bolt secures the arm to the rung, providing a stable and secure attachment.

* The invention provides a solution to the problems of ladder instability, slipping, and damage to work surfaces, and allows ladders to straddle corners without losing stability. The attachments can be used on various types of ladders, including aluminum and fiberglass ladders.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a collated nail strip with a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the nails, reducing debris generation during driving. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer, such as a polyolefin, polyolefin blend, epoxy, or the like. The collation system includes a collar portion that captures or encircles the nail shank and a connecting portion that extends between and connects adjacent collar portions. The plastic material is molded to, over, and around the nail shanks, and connects each nail to its adjacent nail or nails.

• The nail strip exhibits increased holding power in wood due to the adhesive nature of the plastic as it embeds in the wood structure and bonds with the wood. The withdrawal strength of the nails is significantly higher compared to non-adhered nails. The shape of the collars and connecting portions is designed to facilitate separation of the nail from the strip during driving, with a notch or weakened region at the base of the connecting portion to promote separation. The nail strip can be configured with upper and lower collations of different widths, and the plastic material can be formulated to have varying properties, such as stiffness or impact resistance.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle has a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a special design that allows for precise sealing operations.

• The nozzle's design overcomes the drawbacks of existing nozzles, which are made of metal, require cleaning with hazardous solvents, and do not allow for precise sealant application. The new nozzle is made of plastic, preferably polypropylene, and has a non-permanent coupling between the bell-shaped section and the injection button.

• The nozzle has a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape, a hollow round and threaded section, and a bell or hood-shaped section that encapsulates rivets or nuts. The bell-shaped section has an annular flanged section that matches with the peripheral groove of the injection button.

• The injection button has a circular main body, a peripheral groove, and a hollow central circular protrusion with radially oriented channels and orifices. The button's design allows for precise sealing operations, directing the flow of sealing material towards the chamfers in which the rivet heads are adjusted.

• The nozzle can be used with most cartridges or machines containing sealant, and the protruding ring acts as a stopper, allowing for precision adjustment. The sealant is expelled from the bell-shaped section and moves out through the injection button, which can be fitted or removed at the user's will.

• The nozzle provides a perfect seal from air and oxidizing liquids, which is important for the pressurization and lifetime of aircrafts, ships, trains, or automobiles. The nozzle simplifies the sealing work, reduces the sealant application time, and increases the quality of the resulting sealant application.

<summary>

* The present invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors, and provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system. The invention is directed to sensing the position or movement of an object. A position sensor signal conditioner and remotely electrically connected sensor monitoring equipment are used to achieve this. The invention is particularly useful in mechanical systems such as internal combustion engines.

* The invention provides a sensor that may comprise a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying a sensing signal by removing unneeded power and providing the signal to a remote monitor via two wires. The waveform generator receives an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifies it in response to an error correction signal. The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed. This elimination of unwanted signals reduces energy waste.

* The error correction generator includes a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor. The comparator receives the conditioned sensing signal and determines its value. The controller provides first and second timing signals responsive to the value of the conditioned sensing signal. The signal processor provides the error correction signal responsive to the first and second timing signals. The error correction signal is used to modify the sensing signal.

* The invention includes a window reference circuit that constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal. The window reference circuit ensures that the sensor output is within a desired range. The circuit includes a voltage divider network that provides reference voltages to the negative pins of comparators. The comparators and logic system control the count rate and direction of the signal processor.

* The signal processor includes a counter and a digital-to-analog converter (DAC). The counter counts up or down at a high or low rate depending on the output of the comparators. The DAC converts the count value to an analog signal that is subtracted from the output of the transducer. The output of the DAC is used to correct the sensing signal.

* The invention provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system. The sensors are connected to a single inline resistor, and the output of each sensor is known to be occurring within a separate period or window of time. A timing signal is used to inform the injector position sensor monitoring system which

<summary>
* The invention relates to a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, particularly a desmodromic valve actuation system that is springless and infinitely variable.
* The system aims to reduce gas consumption and improve engine performance by controlling valve port openness and closing in concert with the engine's requirements.
* The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which receives input from a timing belt driven by the engine's output shaft.
* The rotary cam has a grooved track that displaces a translating means, which reciprocates in a slot to achieve the first reciprocating linear movement.
* The system eliminates the need for springs, which are replaced by a kinematic system that positively controls valve cycling.
* The valve actuation system can be controlled by an actuator, electromechanical or hydraulic, with position information to control the rotation of the link and the amount of port opening.
* The system allows for variable displacement of the valve, enabling the engine to operate at higher speeds and improving engine performance.
* The invention can be applied to internal combustion engines with any number of valves in its cylinders, and can be controlled by a single controller or multiple controllers.

<summary>
• The invention relates to aquarium lighting, specifically a light member with a housing and a lighting control region that includes control channels for controlling different types of light. The lighting control region is sized to receive one or more light-emitting modules that can be coupled to the control channels.

• The light member includes a switch that controls the first control channel, and a second switch that controls the second control channel, allowing for adjustable color temperature output. The blended color temperature is adjustable between a range of 3500K to 15,000K.

• The light-emitting modules are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and include LEDs that emit different colors of light, such as white and blue. The modules can be positioned anywhere along the lighting control region and can be added or removed as desired.

• The invention also includes a remote control module that can be controlled remotely using radio frequency (RF) or other communication/control hardware. The remote control module includes RGB LEDs that can blend red, green, and blue light to create a wide range of colors.

• The light member can be controlled using in-line timers that allow a user to set a time limit for various colors emitting from the modules. The timers are programmable to set on/off times and to gradually ramp power up/down by varying the DC voltage, creating a dimming effect.

• The light member can be used with various types of enclosures and structures, including underneath office or kitchen cabinets to provide lighting beneath the cabinets. The light member can be mounted to a bracket that provides a structure by which the light member is coupled to the cabinet.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine, which operates at high temperatures. The apparatus has a cooled stator blade or rotor blade with internal cooling channels and separating walls that bound the channels.
* The prior art has disadvantages such as large amounts of material in the transitional region from the hot-gas wall to the separating wall, thermal stresses between the hot-gas wall and the separating wall, high blade weight, and complex casting. The invention aims to provide a cooled flow deflection apparatus that avoids these disadvantages and is simple to produce, flexible, and efficiently cooled.
* The invention achieves this by constructing the separating walls as separate inserts that are inserted into the apparatus and secured there, rather than producing them jointly with the apparatus through casting. This approach has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, reduced blade weight, and simplified casting.
* The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials, can be straight or bent into a U-shape, and can be secured by soldering or welding. The invention is particularly suitable for gas turbine blades, which have a complex geometry and can benefit from the simplifications provided by the invention.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control. The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor that sets the throttle valve position for optimum performance.

• The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall, and provides full operation of the vehicle when under manual control. The control unit can detect malfunctions or faults and switch to manual control, and can also be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission.

• The invention improves upon prior art systems by providing a system that does not impair the safety of the vehicle driver or hamper the operation of the vehicle, and allows for full operation of the vehicle even when manual control is required. The system is designed to provide optimum fuel efficiency and minimum exhaust emissions, and can be used in a variety of applications.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a waste fuel burner that can efficiently burn waste fuels such as wood waste, producing minimal particulate emissions and slag formation. The burner uses a combination of underfire air, swirl air, and secondary air to gasify and combust the fuel, with the air flows controlled to maintain optimal temperatures and combustion conditions.

• The burner features a primary combustion chamber where the fuel is gasified, and a secondary combustion chamber where the volatile gases are combusted, with a flame holder separating the two chambers and preventing particulate matter from entering the secondary chamber. The secondary chamber is designed to complete combustion of the volatile gases, producing a clean exhaust gas.

• The control system for the burner is designed to respond quickly to changes in demand, with the air flows and fuel feed rate adjusted to maintain optimal combustion conditions, and overrides and trims provided to ensure safe and efficient operation. The system can be controlled pneumatically or electrically, and can be used in a variety of applications, including boilers, dry kilns, and rotary dryers.

<summary>
* The invention is an evaporative cooler that uses a heat exchanger to separate the dry and wet sides, allowing for cooling without adding water vapor to the air. This design enables the system to operate more efficiently and with lower energy costs.
* The system uses a major portion of the working air from the load, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air, to increase the temperature differential and cooling capacity. The working air is recirculated from the enclosure to the wet side of the heat exchanger, where it is used to evaporate water and cool the system.
* The heat exchanger is designed with an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, which allows for efficient heat transfer and evaporation. The system also includes features such as a plenum, water pump, and manifold tubes to distribute water and facilitate evaporation.
* A hybrid system is also described, which combines the evaporative cooler with a vapor compression refrigeration unit to further cool a portion of the air stream and dehumidify it, resulting in a lower dry bulb temperature and increased overall efficiency. This hybrid system can achieve a dry bulb reduction of 3.8°F compared to operation without dehumidification.

<summary>
* The fluid pump described in the patent application is designed to pump fluids at high volumetric flow rates and high pressure, making it suitable for applications such as pumping liquid manure from animal husbandry operations. The pump consists of multiple pump heads connected in series, with each pump head having an impeller and a housing with multiple fluid conduits.

* The pump heads are connected by a drive structure that commonly drives the impellers, allowing the pump to operate efficiently and effectively. The drive structure may include a tubular connector that bridges the pump heads and is within the fluid flow path between the pump heads.

* The pump heads are designed to be modular, allowing them to be easily assembled and disassembled for maintenance or repair. The pump heads may also be connected to a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, to facilitate operation at a fluid reservoir.

* The pump is capable of pumping fluids at high pressures, making it suitable for applications where high pressure is required. The pump may also be configured to include an agitator nozzle that sprays a portion of the pumped fluid back into the fluid reservoir to encourage mixing.

* The pump is designed to be versatile and adaptable, with the ability to be configured with multiple pump heads and support structures to meet specific application requirements. The pump's modular design and common drive structure make it easy to maintain and repair, reducing downtime and increasing overall efficiency.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an engine compression release brake system that includes a reduced number of engine brakes, which are connected to less than all of the engine cylinders. This design allows for a reduction in engine components, improving the overall robustness of the engine. The system can be modular, allowing customers to choose and pay for the amount of braking horsepower they desire for a specific application.

• The engine brake system operates by using a solenoid-actuated valve to control the flow of high-pressure fluid to a spool valve, which in turn actuates a piston to open the exhaust valve and release compressed air from the cylinder. The system can be controlled by an electronic control module, which determines when engine braking is desirable and how much braking horsepower is required. The engine brake system can be used in a variety of engine applications, including diesel engines and homogeneous charge compression engines.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure, such as an auxiliary gearbox, designed to withstand extreme loads, including those caused by blade-off events. The mounting link includes a male link, a female link, and a pin that selectively retains the male and female links. The link assembly allows for translation of the male link relative to the female link and forms a radial interface that dampens the translation.

• The gearbox assembly includes a gearbox and a link assembly that couples the engine to the gearbox, with the link assembly including a male link, a female link, and a pin. The female link receives the male link, allowing translation and forming a radial interface that dampens the translation. The pin selectively retains the male and female links.

• The mounting link is designed to absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine or transmitting destructive loads to the gearbox. The link allows for a permitted range of motion, and the interface between the female and male links dampens the relative motion within this range. This allows the gearbox to move relative to the engine without damage.

• The female link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end, with the link interface end receiving the male link. The male link includes a link mounting end and a link interface end, with the link interface end being received by the female link. The pin passes through holes in the female and male links to engage and retain them.

• The pin serves as a fusible link, designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly and engine mounting structure. The pin is strong enough to withstand peak non-destructive impact loads, but will break under extreme loads such as those caused by blade-off events. The pin can be replaced during maintenance following a shock sufficient to break it.

• After the pin shears, the female and male links are allowed to translate relative to each other, with the radial interface between the links providing coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by the translation. The amount of damping is determined by the coefficient of friction, geometry, and contact areas of the links. The materials of the links can be selected to provide the desired level of damping.

• The snap ring can be used to limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link, preventing the mounting link from separating after the pin is sheared. The snap ring can be installed after the male link is disposed within the female link to retain the male link at the end of the travel range.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to archery equipment, specifically apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts, providing a small, lightweight point cap system that can be adjusted in weight to achieve perfect balance.
* The invention also includes a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft, and a point cap and balance pin design that work together to provide a means of attachment that suits the use of unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a small arms firing effect simulator that simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation. The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system. The expendable contains multiple rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech. The simulator produces sound and flash by electrically igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion products through the weapon's ejection port.

• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt. The circuit consists of ten functional blocks, including a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, and firing control. The circuit uses seven CMOS ICs, thirty-one SCRs, five diodes, six capacitors, and seventy-four resistors. The circuit is designed to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash.

• The simulator is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of an M16 rifle and is designed for use in training combat troops. The reusable housing has an upper end that inserts into the M16 and a lower end that houses the electrical control circuitry and the plastic expendable. The upper end has an exhaust port that communicates with the lower end via an upper exhaust chamber. The lower end houses the electric control circuitry and the plastic expendable.

• The plastic expendable contains thirty cups, each with a pyrotechnic charge and a bridge wire that makes contact with a conductive area. The conductive area connects to the firing control circuit, which ignites the pyrotechnic charge by heating the bridge wire to incandescence. The pyrotechnic charge burns in a combination mode to produce a rapid increase in pressure, which ruptures the plastic sealant and vents through the exit port. The shock of the rupture and the ensuing venting of pressure simulates small arms fire.

• The invention provides a cost-effective means of simulating small arms fire without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation. The simulator is reliable, low maintenance, and reusable, and provides a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash. The invention also provides a safe and controlled environment for training combat troops. The simulator can be used in conjunction with a MILES unit to provide a more realistic training experience.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an air intake device for an internal combustion engine that utilizes the dynamic effects of air flow to improve volumetric efficiency while reducing noise from the air intake, comprising a tank, two pipes of different cross-sectional areas, and a valve actuated by an engine operating condition.
• The device improves engine performance by optimizing the dynamic effect and reduces noise by providing a resonator effect through the tank and the narrower pipe, and the valve operation is controlled based on engine speed and load conditions to achieve optimal performance.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a two-part bracket for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure, allowing for simple and efficient installation.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be connected together to mount an object to a surface or pole, and can be adjusted to achieve a desired angle or position.
• The adjustable bracket can be attached to the object to be mounted, and the stationary bracket can be attached to the mounting surface, allowing a single installer to easily mount the object.
• The bracket assembly can be used on poles of various sizes, and includes a pole clamp assembly with stepped teeth and a chain to securely fasten the bracket to the pole.
• The invention provides a simple, efficient, and secure way to mount objects to surfaces or poles, and can be used for a variety of applications, including loudspeakers, lighting, signage, displays, monitors, and video cameras.

<summary>
• The disclosed burner system includes a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, air inlets, and an exhaust outlet, and is designed for efficient and clean burning of solid fuels, with features such as secondary and tertiary combustion air flows to reduce emissions and increase efficiency.
• The system also includes a modular design, allowing for the attachment of various heat utilizing appliances, such as cookers, smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers, which can be easily coupled and decoupled from the burner.
• The burner system also includes features such as a pivoting ash pan, a cover to prevent accidental ingress of objects, and a grill for cooking, and can be used for a variety of applications, including cooking, heating, and pyrolysis.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary internal combustion engine with a cooling system that improves heat transfer and reduces thermal distortion. The system features staggered spark plug bosses that allow for separate flow paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer, improving coolant velocity distribution around the boss surfaces.
* The staggered arrangement of the spark plug bosses promotes a controlled flow regime, reducing the formation of vapor films and improving heat transfer between the flow and bosses. This results in a higher heat transfer coefficient, with a calculated increase of 44% in the model study.
* The invention also features a housing structure that facilitates circumferential cooling flow and minimizes thermal distortion, particularly in the zone surrounding the spark plug bosses. The design allows for a more uniform temperature gradient across the width of the gas side of the wall, reducing the risk of thermal failure.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing, using control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow.
* The method involves calculating the total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position, and determining the flow difference characteristic between N and N-1 valves to compensate for the loss of flow when one valve is closed for testing.
* The compensation is achieved by adjusting the flow through the remaining valves to maintain the total mass flow, thereby minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during testing.
* The invention has been tested and shown to reduce pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% compared to not using flow compensation.

<summary>

* The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that combines fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, with a outlet mixture ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
The valve has a valve body with two inlet passages and one outlet passage, and a valve means that directs the two fluids towards the outlet passage in a proportional mixture.
The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range from 0% to 100% of each fluid.
The invention is particularly useful in the commercial airline industry where aircraft are cleaned extensively on a yearly basis.

* The valve system includes a spool valve and a flow restricting device that reduces the flow rate of fluid from one inlet passage to another.
The flow restricting device has a threaded portion and a flow restricting bore that reduces the flow rate of fluid.
The valve body has a bore with a predetermined diameter, and the spool valve is received within the bore.
The spool valve has a cylindrical portion with a bore that extends therethrough perpendicular to its longitudinal axis.

* The valve system also includes a sealing sleeve that is stretched over the cylindrical portion of the spool valve to form a seal.
The sealing sleeve has a pair of perpendicularly intersecting bores that allow substantial alignment of the bores when the sleeve is stretched over the cylindrical portion.
The valve system further includes a seal carrier that receives the cylindrical portion of the spool valve and has a bore that is sized to receive the cylindrical portion.
The seal carrier also has a recess that houses a nut that engages the threaded portion of the cylindrical portion.

* The valve system includes a series of consecutive cylindrical spools that are slidably received within the bore of the valve body.
The cylindrical spools have channels that retain fluid seal rings that prevent commingling of the two fluid sources within the bore and prevent leakage of the two fluids out of the bore.
The fluid seal rings are capable of forming an acceptable fluid seal and are resistant to chemicals such as detergents and solvents.
The fluid seal rings are preferably VITON "O" rings.

* The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids emerging from the outlet passage.
The valve system allows for a mixture emerging from the outlet passage ranging from approximately 0% water, 100% soap solution to 100% water, 0% soap solution.
The valve system is particularly useful in situations where multiple users

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling the gas by heat exchange, and expanding the gas to a lower pressure to achieve the desired exit temperature. The invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method. The arrangement includes compressors, heat exchangers, and valves controlled by an electronic control system.

• The conventional method of cooling gas in compressor stations uses re-cooling plants with separate cooling cycles, which are expensive and pose safety risks. These plants are only used during warm weather periods and are idle for most of the year. The present invention aims to reduce investments and operation risks. The invention utilizes the physical effect of cooling gas when expanded to a lower pressure.

• The method of the present invention includes compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling the gas by heat exchange, and expanding the gas to the desired exit pressure. The excess pressure is selected to ensure that the gas can be cooled to the desired exit temperature during expansion. The expansion can be carried out using a valve or an expansion turbine, which can recover mechanical energy.

• The invention provides a compressor station with multiple compression stages, including primary compression stages and an additional compression stage. The primary compression stages are equipped with compressors having approximately the same pressure ratio. The additional compression stage includes a booster compressor that raises the pressure to the excess pressure. The compressed gas is then cooled and expanded to the desired exit pressure.

• The compressor station can be operated differently during winter and summer seasons. During winter, the compressors can produce the required throughput quantity together with additional units, and the gas can be supplied to the pipeline at a temperature below 0°C. During summer, the compressors are operated in series to produce the excess pressure, and the gas is expanded to the desired exit pressure.

• The invention provides several advantages, including reduced investments, reduced operation risks, and increased availability of the overall plant. The invention also reduces the risk of accidents due to the absence of re-cooling units. The method and arrangement of the present invention can be modified in various ways within the scope of protection defined by the patent claims.

• The effectiveness of the method according to the present invention is demonstrated by an example, which shows that the required pipeline pressure and temperature can be achieved using the invention. The example also shows that the quantity of energy required for the compressor station is not higher than in a comparable compressor station using

<summary>
• Electronic components produce heat, and in some applications, free convection cooling is not sufficient to prevent overheating. In such cases, electric fans are used to move ambient air across the components at a higher rate. The use of cooling fans is a low-cost solution to keep electronic components within acceptable temperature ranges. This is often employed in various industries, including automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation.

• Cooling fans are typically mounted to an enclosure using fasteners such as screws, dowel pins, or rivets, which increases the product cost due to labor and tooling requirements. The embodiments disclosed in this invention aim to eliminate the need for fasteners. The invention can be used in various applications where forced air movement is necessary for temperature control. This includes electrical, mechanical, chemical, or other heat-generating systems.

• The cooling fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier, which is mounted to a panel using a plurality of mounting legs. Each leg has a turned-out portion that is inserted into a recessed portion on the panel. The motor carrier also includes spring members that urge the carrier away from the panel once the legs are seated. This prevents the carrier from moving due to vibrational forces during operation.

• The installation process involves positioning the cooling fan assembly against the panel, applying a compressive force to compress the spring members, and rotating the assembly to move the turned-out portions into the recessed portions. The turned-out portions then enter an intermediate opening, which brings the resilient leg portions together, and finally, they enter a residual opening, where they spring outwardly and capture the leg portions. This ensures a secure mounting of the cooling fan assembly to the panel.

• The invention provides a low-cost and efficient way to mount cooling fans to enclosures without the need for fasteners. The spring members help to prevent vibrational noise and ensure that the fan assembly remains securely mounted to the panel. The invention can be modified or added to without departing from its spirit, and it is applicable to various industries and heat-generating systems. The subject matter of the invention is defined in the appended claims, including all fair equivalents thereof.

<summary>
* Spacecraft structures require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have low damping and vibration dissipation characteristics, which can compromise instrument functionality. Instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM) are particularly susceptible to vibration environment during flight. 14% of spacecraft launches through 1984 suffered vibration/shock related failures, with 50% resulting in catastrophic mission loss.

* Current efforts to modify graphite structures to reduce vibration response may not be sufficient to meet instrument design levels. Additional vibration reduction techniques are needed to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The need for improved kinematic mounts that can reduce vibration transmission to instruments is critical.

* Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration transmission to instruments. These mounts are designed to safely carry launch loads but have no provisions to minimize loads transmitted to the instrument. The six suspension modes introduced by these mounts have very little damping, amplifying flight loads to the mounted instrument.

* The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The invention incorporates a passive energy dissipating mechanism to reduce vibration transmission to instruments. The kinematic mount can be incorporated into existing KM structures.

* The invention uses a damped instrument kinematic mount comprising instrument support means with first and second damping means. The damping means and instrument support means are arranged to provide the desired performance characteristics. The device can be applied to a large number of precision or optical instruments/sensors where alignment stability is important.

* The kinematic mounts have been modified by inserting vibration damping materials into the mounts. These damping materials introduce a damping mechanism into the six mount suspension modes, dissipating energy into heat and reducing high energy disturbances to the instrument. The modifications preserve the fundamental features of the kinematic mounts, such as strength, stiffness, and kinematic features.

* The damping mechanism can be provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts. Two embodiments of the damper design are depicted in FIGS. 3A and 3B, using a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper, respectively. The damping materials used are space-qualified viscoelastic materials (VEM) with frequency-dependent properties.

* The invention provides a kinematic mounting scheme that uses six identical strut elements, reducing manufacturing complexity and costs. The strut elements can be arranged in a pattern that approximately uncouples the mount suspension modes, further improving KM performance. The invention achieves modal vibration tests on coupon sample mounts that yield modal damping values from 5-17% of

<summary>
* The invention relates to a large size oil shear type clutch unit for use in applications such as an aircraft catapult system, which requires high horsepower and precise control.
* The clutch unit features a novel design with separate piston and cylinder means for each clutch disc segment, allowing for simultaneous actuation and minimizing residual drag.
* The unit also includes an auxiliary fluid supply that provides cooling to the clutch discs and retracts the clutch plates, reducing friction and wear.
* The design allows for easy replacement of individual clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire unit, making maintenance and inspection more convenient.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an internal combustion engine that captures and utilizes waste heat energy to increase efficiency, reducing the need for a radiator and minimizing exhaust emissions. The engine uses a combination of combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, with water injection to create steam and drive the expansion cylinders.
* The engine can be configured in various ways, including with multiple expansion cylinders, gear reductions, and catalytic materials to reduce emissions. The system can also include a water recovery system to recycle water and minimize water consumption.
* The invention aims to achieve high thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies, potentially up to 94-96%, by capturing and utilizing waste heat energy and minimizing heat loss through conduction, convection, and exhaust emissions. The engine can be used in various applications, including vehicles, and can operate on various types of fuels.

<summary>
* The invention relates to the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat-treated to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.
* The plates have a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy topped by a layer of metal alloy, and an area at the periphery of the plate has the metal alloy layer removed.
* The removal of the metal alloy layer prevents the formation of intermetallic areas within the welded assemblies, which are sources of the onset of rupture, and ensures good corrosion resistance of the welded and heat-treated parts.
* The invention also provides a method of fabricating a precoated steel plate, a method of welding the plates, and a method of heat-treating the welded blanks to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a remote control system and algorithm for supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) enabling navigation and automatic operation of a mobile energy recovery system. The system includes a mobile structure that extracts energy from severe weather patterns, a central service facility, and a communication system that connects the two. The mobile structure is equipped with sensors and control circuits that communicate with a microprocessor system, which in turn communicates with the central service facility. The central service facility houses a server that aggregates weather data from various sources and runs a SCADA algorithm that determines the optimal path for the mobile structure.

• The SCADA algorithm uses weather data, sensor data, and performance models to optimize energy extraction and navigation of the mobile structure. The algorithm can be overridden by a human operator at the central service facility, who can view and adjust various parameters such as points of sail, rudder rotation, and turbine gate openness. The algorithm also performs least-cost or highest yield path analysis and provides predictive maps of energy availability. The system can be used for various types of mobile structures, including sailing vessels and propelled vessels.

• The mobile structure is equipped with various sensors, including GPS, accelerometers, gyroscopes, wind vanes, anemometers, fuel gauges, and electrolyzer electrode temperature gauges. The sensors provide data to the microprocessor system, which communicates with the central service facility via a wireless communication system. The communication system can use various protocols, including satellite telecommunications, CDMA, and UHF radio. The system can also include video camera data streams and radar and sonar systems for physical object detection and avoidance.

• The central service facility includes a server that aggregates weather data from various sources, including weather satellites, the National Weather Service, and other weather data disseminating entities. The server runs the SCADA algorithm and provides a graphical user interface (GUI) for human operators to view and adjust various parameters. The GUI can display various types of data, including position, heading, velocity, and points of sail, as well as virtual reality representations of the mobile structure and its surroundings. The GUI can also display weather maps with path analysis lines and predictive energy regions.

• The SCADA algorithm performs various functions, including data collection, processing, storage, and analysis, as well as navigation vector determinations. The algorithm can be used for various types of mobile structures and can be adapted to different weather patterns and energy extraction systems. The algorithm can also be used for logistics and vessel navigation, and can provide predictive maps of energy availability.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction. The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, in particular welded, to one another in a production step preceding the formation of the axial profiling.
* The invention reduces production costs by minimizing cutting waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages produced by forming techniques. This is particularly advantageous in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm.
* The flat material ring segments are put together across an engagement zone and in this engagement zone are welded along edge regions which face one another. The flat material ring segments are connected to one another according to a particular aspect of the present invention in the region of the engagement zones across positively engaging joint contours.
* The joint contours form an undercut geometry which preliminarily couples the ring elements to one another in the circumferential direction. The geometric profile of the joint contours is selected such that adequate coupling of the ring segments is produced with as short as possible a weld seam length.
* The flat material ring segments are cut out, in particular punched out, from a sheet metal material, and a relatively high material saving can be achieved by forming the flat material ring segments as 120° ring segments. Only three weld points are then required for joining together a ring element from such flat material ring segments.
* The concept according to the invention of the production of the rolling body guide cage from a welded ring segment is suitable both for the manufacture of radial bearing cages and for the manufacture of axial bearing cages. The rolling body guide cage can be structured such that it is composed of a first ring element and a structurally identical second ring element positioned in mirror-symmetry.
* The method according to the invention for manufacturing a rolling body guide cage includes composing the ring element from at least two flat material ring segments which are joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction, and then forming the axial profiling in a forming step. The ring segments can be welded to one another in the region of a joint formed by these flat material ring segments.

<summary>
* The invention relates to methods and systems for obtaining and processing information associated with a customer service location, including latitude and longitude coordinates, to facilitate efficient and effective customer service in a telecommunications network.
* The invention also includes methods and systems for generating directions for a service technician traveling between multiple customer service locations, using a mapping system and GPS coordinates to provide accurate and efficient routing.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit. The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and can simulate the measurement of electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected.
* The control unit uses a control algorithm that combines the output signals of the two real sensors to generate virtual sensor signals, which are then used to calculate control signals for the compensation coils. The algorithm can be adjusted to accommodate different types of interfering fields and coil arrangements.
* The system can also be used in situations where two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, with the control unit taking into account feedback effects between the two systems to ensure optimal compensation. The feedback effects are described by a 6x6 crosscoupling matrix C, which can be experimentally determined.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering (CARS) microscopy.
• The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.
• The bioorthogonal reaction introduces a resonance site that can be sensed in image-producing fashion using CARS microscopy.
• The method allows for the detection of chemical structures that do not inherently possess resonance sites or do not exhibit the desired localization or specificity.
• The invention is particularly suitable for tagging in biological samples, such as nerve tissue, and for purity checking in food chemistry.
• The method can be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures that are normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy.
• The use of bioorthogonal reactions in combination with CARS microscopy enables dedicated detection of target sites in any samples without negatively affecting biochemical processes.
• The method allows for the CARS-active scattering cross section of the respective target to be increased or generated in the first place by suitable synthesis reactions.
• The invention enables a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in the context of CARS microscopy.
• The method can be used to furnish resonance sites for the structures of the non-resonant background of the sample and correlate a signal component of the resonance signal attributable to those resonance sites with a signal component attributable to intrinsic resonance sites of the sample.
</summary>

<summary>

• The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources, such as clinicians or autosegmentation software, to evaluate their quality and accuracy. The system compares the segmentations to a "gold standard" or reference segmentation, and identifies missing and extra volume elements. The system then provides a metric score based on the comparison.

• The system accepts electronic files containing segmentation data, such as DICOM-RT files, and converts them into voxel models for comparison. The voxel models are adjusted for origin offsets to ensure alignment in a common reference space. The system then compares the voxel models to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.

• The system provides a graphical interface for users to input segmentation files, select structures to compare, and choose a metric method for evaluation. The interface displays the segmentations in a 2D or 3D format, with common volume elements shaded green, missing volume elements shaded blue, and extra volume elements shaded red.

• The system allows users to define custom metric methods using a formula parameter table, which includes parameters for forgiving small errors, upper cutoffs, and weightings for distance-based penalties. The system plots the metric method as a graph, allowing users to visualize the penalty function.

• The system provides a quantitative evaluation of the comparison, including primary and secondary volumes, missing and extra volumes, and a metric score. The system also generates a histogram table tallying the voxels of the missing and extra volumes according to distance measurement bins.

• The system can be used for training clinicians on contouring by comparing their segmentations to user-defined standards. It can also be used for periodic quality assurance testing of anatomy auto-segmentation routines and systems.

• The system can assess anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems prior to customer purchase or clinical application, and evaluate their performance against updated and new imaging technology.

• The system can be used to assess whether a new treatment plan should be prepared based on changes in the internal anatomy of the patient during radiation therapy reflected in the new segmentation.

• The system provides a report of the comparison, including the metric score and quantitative evaluation, which can be printed or saved for future reference.

• The system is designed to be flexible and customizable, allowing users to modify the metric methods and parameters to suit their specific needs and applications. The system can be used in a variety of radiation therapy settings, including external beam radiation therapy and brachytherapy.

• The invention relates to data processing systems and specifically to the apparatus for executing floating point operations. The floating point format represents numerical quantities with a fraction value and an exponent argument value. The principal advantage of the floating point format is the increased range of numbers that can be manipulated without extraordinary procedures or conventions.

• The execution of addition and subtraction operations in the floating point format is more complex and time-consuming than in the standard data format. This complexity arises from the need to align fractions prior to addition or subtraction and potentially normalize the result. The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.

• The effective subtraction operation can be divided into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents of the two operands. When the absolute value is greater than 1, the larger operand is identified, and the subtraction operation is performed to ensure a positive resultant quantity. This approach obviates the need for a separate step for negation of the resulting operand.

• When the absolute value of the difference is less than or equal to 1, the alignment of the fractions can be performed without requiring a separate step before performing the subtraction step. The negation step may be required, but either the normalization step or the rounding step is required, not both. This approach reduces the seven major steps to five major steps.

• The invention uses a difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate the effective subtraction operation. The subset difference is used to begin the subtraction of differences between operand fractions or fractional portions thereof. The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions.

• The apparatus implementing the invention includes a subtraction unit, a detection logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, and a selection logic unit. The 7 least significant bits of the operand exponent arguments are applied to the subtraction unit, and the 6 least significant bit difference is applied to the detection logic unit. The shift and selection logic unit selects the procedures outlined in FIG. 6B.

• The output signals from the shift and selection logic unit are applied to the subtraction unit, and the control signals from the detection logic unit determine whether the output signals from the selection logic unit or the output signals from the shift and selection logic unit are applied to the subtraction unit. The result of the operation of the subtraction unit is applied to the selection logic unit along with the operand fractions.
