<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and system for tracking and managing patient specimens, particularly in a hospital setting. The system uses machine-readable codes, such as barcodes, to identify patients, specimens, and medical staff, and to track the collection and processing of specimens. The system ensures that specimens are correctly labeled and matched to the correct patient, reducing the risk of errors and misidentification. The system also provides a complete record of the specimen collection process, including the identity of the medical staff involved.

• The system uses a computer and barcode reader to read and store the machine-readable codes, and to verify the identity of patients and specimens. The system can also be used to track the expiration dates of specimens and to alert staff to any discrepancies or errors. The invention provides a failsafe and efficient way to manage patient specimens, reducing the risk of errors and improving patient safety. The system can be used in a variety of healthcare settings, including hospitals, clinics, and laboratories.

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide golfers with verbal information on distance and other golf course parameters, and can be integrated into a hat or other wearable device.
• The device can also record and store golf course data, including hazards and fairway boundaries, and can be used for other applications such as hiking, surveying, and scuba diving, and can be connected to a computer for data upload and download.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a design rule checking system and method for integrated circuits, particularly for system-on-chip (SOC) designs that combine logic and memory circuits. The invention aims to eliminate false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules. The invention provides a system and method of checking design rules to determine whether a logic part of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules and a memory part of a mask pattern data obeys memory rules. This method helps users filter out false errors due to logic rule checks in a memory block.

* The invention creates customized design rules for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip, based on modifying a standard logic rule by "pushing" more liberal memory-based parameters onto stricter logic-based parameters. The customized design rules are used to check different areas of an IC layout, depending on the types of regions presented in the IC. The invention ensures that design rules are accurately resolved for a system on chip integrated circuit design that uses a mix or blend of logic and memory circuitry. This principle could be extended beyond just memories to include other design rules for other areas that have differing design rule requirements.

* The invention provides a system and method for deriving customized memory rules from standard logic design rules. The system runs a design rule check on a memory bit cell mask pattern data against a design rule command file that consists of only standard foundry logic rules. The invention analyzes the errors generated by the design rule check to determine how the standard logic rules should be modified for a customized design rule set for the particular memory cell. The invention then "pushes" the appropriate parameter (minimum dimension) onto a modified form of the standard logic design rules to create a set of distinct and separate design rules.

* The invention ensures that all types of memory regions have to fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions have to fulfill logic and memory rules. The invention avoids false errors, is more reliable, and more efficient than prior art techniques. The invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks. The invention can be implemented using conventional computer systems and software routines, and is not limited to any particular embodiment or computer language.

<summary>
• This invention relates to the use of waveguide holograms as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators. The invention was made with government support and the government has certain rights in the invention.

• The invention builds upon the applicant's previous work on thin substrate waveguides, which are characterized by a specific relationship between the width of the incident laser beam and the thickness of the waveguide. These waveguides can be used to provide uniform illumination and avoid difficulties in coupling the optical source to the waveguide.

• Conventional illumination systems require a substantial amount of space and can be prone to stability problems, alignment difficulties, and obstruction of other light beams. In contrast, waveguide hologram illuminators are compact, rugged, and can be optically contacted to the object being illuminated.

• The invention provides a method for selectively illuminating objects, including holograms and spatial light modulators, using a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source. The illumination system can provide extremely high diffraction efficiencies and can be used to pattern the light to hit only preselected areas.

• The diffraction efficiency of the waveguide hologram illuminator can be high, approaching 0.99, and the absence of stray light propagating forward to the observer is a significant advantage. The undiffracted light from the illuminator is trapped in the waveguide, reducing noise and increasing comfort for the viewer.

• However, there are some penalties to using waveguide hologram illuminators, including the need for critical alignment of the laser beam, which can lead to a lack of ruggedness. Additionally, there can be a time delay across the hologram, which can affect clock distribution and spatial coherence.

• Nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction can be a problem, but it can be compensated for by recording the hologram nonuniformly or by using a posteriori compensation. The problem of two-sidedness, where the hologram produces two diffracted beams, can be addressed by absorbing or reflecting the light emerging from one side.

• The invention has been demonstrated using two basic architectures for recording the waveguide hologram grating, and the quality of the reconstructed beams has been analyzed from various points of view. The invention has potential applications in illuminating spatial light modulators and reconstructing 3-D holographic images.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, particularly squirrel cage rotors for induction motors. The apparatus includes a test head with a core of magnetic material, primary windings, and voltage and skew sensing pick-up coils. The test head is designed to magnetize the rotor and sense the resulting magnetic flux. The sensed signals are then processed to determine the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor.

• The test apparatus includes a data acquisition and processing system that controls the test sequence, acquires data, and processes the data to produce test results. The system includes a sample and hold circuit, an analog multiplexer, an analog-to-digital converter, and a data processor. The data processor calculates the power value, mean power value, and root mean square values for voltage, current, and skew signals. The system also determines the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor.

• The test sequence involves rotating the rotor within the test head while applying an alternating current to the primary windings. The voltage and skew sensing pick-up coils sense the resulting magnetic flux and generate signals that are sampled and processed by the data acquisition and processing system. The system acquires 32 samples per cycle of the alternating current and repeats the process 40 times to complete one test sequence. The test sequence takes approximately four seconds to complete.

• The control processor determines the mean resistance, reactance, and effective skew values from the 40 test values obtained during the test sequence. The processor also determines the range of the 40 values for resistance and effective skew, referred to as dissymmetry and skew dissymmetry, respectively. The processor compares the calculated values to predetermined threshold values to determine if the rotor is acceptable or defective.

• The test apparatus includes a dual test fixture system, with each fixture having a test head and a retraction and drive mechanism. The retraction and drive mechanism retracts the rotor to the test position and rotates the rotor during the test sequence. The dual fixture system allows for more efficient testing by reducing operator setup time and increasing the cost-effectiveness of the apparatus.

• The test head is designed to simulate the operating conditions of a dynamoelectric machine, with the primary windings generating an alternating magnetic field that magnetizes the rotor. The voltage and skew sensing pick-up coils are positioned to sense the resulting magnetic flux and generate signals that are proportional to the voltage and skew of the rotor. The test head is designed to be compact and easy to use, with

<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to securing a mobile device by controlling access to native resources of an operating system, wherein a managed library is granted access to native resources in response to validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library, and a managed application is denied access to native resources unless authorized by a digital certificate. This approach allows third-party applications to execute on the mobile device while protecting the device from malicious code.
* The managed library and managed application can be stored in a digitally signed container, and the digital signature is verified before loading the managed application. The manager can prevent the managed application from accessing native resources and/or terminate the managed application if it attempts to access unauthorized resources.
* The native functions of the operating system can be accessed through instructions for a runtime host, which are effectuated by native instructions, and the runtime host can be validated by a digital signature before launching. This provides an additional layer of security and control over access to native resources.

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card containing an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers. The card is designed to protect the electronic components from damage. The prior art smart cards have been made with a rigid core onto which an IC chip and antenna are positioned by means of glue or a mechanical device.

* The prior art methods of manufacturing smart cards involve using molds, which can be costly and complicated. The cards can be subject to damage from bending stresses, and the electronic components can be damaged. The materials used in the prior art cards can become brittle over time, leading to cracking and rendering the card unusable.

* The invention provides a low-cost, easily constructed identification card that protects the IC chip and antenna from damage. The card has two relatively shock-absorbing layers, which may contain indicia, and two rigid outer laminate layers that add structural support and protection. The rigid outer layers disseminate external forces over a broad area of compliant layers, thus protecting the electronic components.

* The core layer of the card is made of a silica-filled polyolefin, and the first side of the core layer has an antenna fixed to it, and an IC chip electrically connected to the antenna. The core layer is then bonded to a bottom sheet of printable, silica-filled polyolefin with an adhesive layer. The adhesive layer may be composed of a co-polyester based adhesive.

* The IC chip is attached to the bottom layer using an additional layer of adhesive, and the core layer and bottom layer are encased between two layers of substantially transparent polymer. The polymer layers provide mechanical strength to the image-receiving layer or layers and hence to the image(s) in the finished document. The thickness of the polymer layers is not critical, but is generally preferred to be at least about 0.1 mm.

* The image-receiving layer of the card may be formed of any material capable of receiving an image by dye diffusion thermal transfer. The image-receiving layer is formed on the side of the polymer layer remote from the core layer, and one or more second indicia intended for human reading may be printed on the image-receiving layer. One or more additional second indicia intended for machine reading may be printed on the image-receiving layer on the back side.

* A protective layer is affixed over at least the portion of the image-receiving layer carrying the second indicia, serving to

<summary>
* The invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a queue, in a functional memory environment. The queue is implemented as a tree-shaped data structure, where nodes have a maximum size and additions and deletions are made in a way that maintains a balanced tree. This allows for efficient updates with a time and space complexity that is logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.
* The tree structure is maintained by adding records to the first non-full node from the bottom and deleting records from the leaf nodes. The nodes are filled upwards, and when a node becomes full, a new node is created to maintain the balance of the tree. This ensures that all leaf nodes are at the same level, and the tree remains balanced.
* A header node can be added to the structure, which contains pointers to the beginning and end of the queue, and an inversion bit that indicates the direction of the queue. This allows for fast inversion of the queue and enables the use of the queue as a double-ended queue. The header node can be updated in constant time and space, making it efficient for large queues.
* The invention can be implemented in a memory arrangement with a header node, which includes an actual memory, intermediate registers, and control logic that maintains the queue. The control logic adds and deletes records from the queue, following the edge of the tree and updating the tree as necessary. The invention can be modified to accommodate different maximum node sizes and record storage arrangements.

<summary>
• The invention relates to electrically programmable read-only memory (EPROM) devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies, allowing for the integration of EPROM devices with other types of ICs, such as DRAM or logic circuits, on the same wafer. This eliminates the need for special EPROM manufacturing technologies and reduces production costs.

• The EPROM devices of the present invention use DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, which allows for higher gate coupling ratios and lower operation voltages compared to traditional EPROM devices. This results in simpler supporting circuits and lower power consumption.

• The invention also discloses a novel type of EPROM device that uses electrical stresses to alter the properties of transistors, allowing for data storage and retrieval. This type of EPROM device, called stress effect programmable read-only memory (SEPROM), can be manufactured using any IC technology and is ideal for embedded applications.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain in a feedback control system, particularly for an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV). The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control using the gain, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value, and repeating the process to determine the optimal gain value. The evaluation value is calculated based on the error and is used to determine the optimal gain value.
* The method is applied to a PID control system, where the P gain affects stability, the I gain affects accuracy, and the D gain affects response. The evaluation functions used to determine the optimal gain values are LR for the P gain, Svv for the I gain, and Asv for the D gain. These functions are calculated based on the error and are used to determine the optimal gain values.
* The method can be implemented in two ways: one involves determining the optimal gain values for each section of a running course separately, and the other involves determining the optimal gain values while the AGV runs continuously along the course. In both cases, the optimal gain values are determined by repeating the process of executing feedback control, detecting an error, and calculating an evaluation value.
* The invention has advantages over prior art methods, including the ability to determine optimal gain values quickly and accurately, and the ability to determine optimal gain values for different sections of a running course. The method is also applicable to other types of feedback control systems and can be used to determine optimal values for other types of feedback gains. The invention can be implemented using a central processor and can be used in a variety of applications, including industrial automation and robotics.

<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with a high relative aperture and a high zoom ratio, while minimizing the physical size of the entire lens system.
* The zoom lens has a small F-number, a high zoom ratio, and a standard image angle at the wide angle end, with a reduced size and high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.
* The lens comprises five lens units, including a first lens unit of positive power, a second lens unit of negative power, a third lens unit of negative power, a fourth lens unit of positive power, and a fifth lens unit with an image forming function.
* The fourth lens unit has a bi-convex lens with a rear surface of strong curvature, and the fifth lens unit has a specific arrangement of lenses with strong curvatures to correct aberrations.
* The invention satisfies specific conditions for the refractive power of the fourth and fifth lens units to achieve good correction of aberrations.
* The conditions include the range of refractive power ratio for the second lens in the fifth lens unit, the range of refractive power ratio for the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth lens unit, and the range of Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit.
* The invention also satisfies a condition for the refractive power of the second lens unit to achieve a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation of aberrations with zooming.
* Four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses are provided, with detailed data for the radii of curvature, axial thicknesses or air separations, and refractive indices and Abbe numbers of the glasses of the various lenses.
* The total length of the lens system is reduced to 9.13φA to 9.19φA, making it suitable for photographic cameras or video cameras.
* The invention achieves a great advance in reduction of the size of the zoom lens while preserving high grade optical performance throughout the entire zooming range.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons, in a detector.
* The method involves generating a charge pulse in the detector when a particle passes through, converting the pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying and processing the signal to detect individual particles or integrate multiple particles.
* The device includes a detector, a first fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second slow amplifier for integrating multiple signals, with the option to switch between the two amplifiers based on the signal rate.
* The detector is tapped on the low-voltage side to prevent leakage current and improve signal-to-noise ratio.
* The method and device can detect both individual particles and integrate multiple particles, without knowing the expected signal rate in advance.
* The invention can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, medical technology, and electrical power engineering.
* The device can be optimized for specific particle detection by selecting the appropriate detector material, amplifier parameters, and signal processing algorithms.
* The invention enables the detection of elementary particles with high accuracy and reliability, and can be used in a wide range of applications.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches, which determines whether the assembly is within specified tolerances and generates an external indication to the operator. The apparatus includes a test enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring that can be moved towards and away from each other.

• The driven disc assembly is mounted on a splined hub between the two rings, and a torque motor applies a predetermined torque to the hub to rotate the assembly. The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring to reduce the frictional force on the assembly.

• The distance between the rings is measured by an electronic sensor, and the difference between the initial and final distances is compared to a standard value to determine if the assembly is within tolerances. If the assembly is within tolerances, the movable ring is rapidly moved away from the stationary ring to allow the operator to remove the assembly.

• If the assembly is not within tolerances, the movable ring is halted, and the operator must manually acknowledge the defective assembly before it can be removed. The apparatus can also generate a visible alert to the operator that the assembly is defective.

• The apparatus includes a control system with a microprocessor that executes a program to control the operation of the torque motor and the movable ring. The program reads signals from the electronic sensor and the torque motor to determine when the assembly has rotated a predetermined amount.

• The microprocessor also controls the display to provide a visual indication of the status of the apparatus and the condition of the tested assembly. The apparatus can store measurements for each assembly tested for statistical process control.

• The invention provides an improved apparatus for spin checking driven disc assemblies that operates automatically without manual involvement by an operator. The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of whether the assembly is good or bad, minimizing the chances of operator error.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software for estimating the age of a person from a face image.
* The invention uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) to extract feature vectors from face images, which are then used to estimate the age of the person.
* The CAM is a statistical model that combines shape and texture information to represent the face.
* The shape model is generated using a modified active shape model (MASM) and the texture model is generated using a quasi-localized texture model.
* The CAM is robust against noise and can distinguish between noise and meaningful signals in an image.
* The feature vectors extracted from the face images are used to train a support vector machine (SVM) to classify the faces as either youth or adult.
* Two aging functions are constructed using support vector regression (SVR) to estimate the age of the person based on the classification result.
* The aging functions are trained using a database of face images with known ages.
* The estimated age is generated by applying the appropriate aging function to the feature vector of the input face image.
* The system can be implemented using a computing system with a processor, memory, and storage, and can be used in various applications such as security, marketing, and healthcare.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, where one image has a higher definition than the other. The device preserves the definition of the higher-definition image and can implement algorithms to facilitate the merging process. The display device comprises a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements, with each arrangement having a first number of pixels dedicated to the first image and the remaining pixels dedicated to the second image. The light intensity signals for each pixel are determined by the corresponding image.

* The invention proposes a specific arrangement of pixels, where each arrangement has four pixels, with three pixels dedicated to the first image and one pixel dedicated to the second image. The second image can be monochrome, and the pixel dedicated to it can be associated with a colored filter. The display of the merged image can be implemented via two operations: mapping the first image to the display device and mapping the second image to the display device.

* The invention also proposes an alternative arrangement, where each arrangement has four pixels, with two pixels dedicated to the first image and two pixels dedicated to the second image. The second image can be two-color, and the pixels dedicated to it can be associated with colored filters that, in combination, can restore the color associated with the first pixel. The display of the merged image can be implemented via two operations: mapping the first image to the display device and mapping the second image to the display device.

* The invention provides means for reinforcing the contrast of the merged image, particularly when the second image covers only a part of the surface. The means can correct the display of the first image by attenuating the light levels of the first image without attenuating the darker levels. The invention also provides a hardware architecture that can be based on a matrix of pixels associated with two controllers, which can offer an advantage in terms of lower consumption in operation.

* The invention has various practical applications, such as combining a first image originating from a night vision sensor with a second graphical image generated by a microcontroller or microcomputer. The matrix display device can comprise a video controller, video interfaces with the night vision sensor and the microcontroller or microcomputer, and an output interface with the matrix of pixels. The matrix of pixels can be formed by a microdisplay of OLED type with active matrix with white emitters, and a red colored filter can be associated with the pixels intended for the display of the second image.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle, which has a housing with electronics and a communication means, and a payment element removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing.
* The payment element can be removed from the housing by the user, and a closure protects and seals the receptacle in the secure state, preventing payment actions and protecting the electronics from moisture and dirt.
* The payment element can have a credit card function and/or debit card function, and can communicate with a payment system to execute payment transactions, and the communication means can be used for both payment and security system communication.
* The invention provides a comfortable and secure mobile identification transmitter with enlarged functionality, allowing users to carry out payment actions and keyless activation of the security system of a motor vehicle.

<summary>
* The disclosed system and method relate to an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use and is put into a "sleep mode" to save energy. When the device "wakes up" from sleep mode, the toner may have a decreased tribo-electro-static charge, which can affect image quality. The system and method aim to address this issue by charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the period of inactivity. The charging process may involve determining the period of inactivity, measuring the toner charge level, and adjusting the charge accordingly.

* The system includes an inactivity determining section, a measuring section, a calculating section, an updating section, a storing section, a charging section, and a performing section. The inactivity determining section determines the period of inactivity, and the measuring section measures the toner charge level. The calculating section calculates the decay of the tribo charge based on the period of inactivity and the measured charge level. The charging section charges the toner to a predetermined level based on the calculated decay.

* The system may use an adaptive algorithm to learn the user's usage pattern and predict the next usage. The system may also store information on the user's usage pattern, predicted next usage, sensor levels, and decay for future use. The system may perform a printing operation after the developer is charged to ensure that the developer is at an adequate charge level for normal printing. The system may repeat the charging process until the toner is charged to a predetermined level.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that can control the recording and reproduction of signals with high precision using plural magneto resistive heads (MR heads) mounted on a rotary drum. The apparatus includes a control signal generator, a decoder, and a current supply circuit to control the bias currents of the MR heads. The control signals are transmitted via a single channel of a rotary transformer.

• The apparatus can switch over among plural heads with high precision, particularly in a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that uses plural MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum. The control data for head switching are transmitted with priority over other control data to prevent loss of reproduced signals. The apparatus can independently control each of the MR heads and recording heads.

• The apparatus includes a regenerative integrated circuit that integrates a current circuit and a regenerative amplifier, and a decoder that discriminates control data transmitted via a rotary transformer. The regenerative integrated circuit is controlled with three kinds of digital signals including Data, Clock, and CS signals. The decoder generates control data for the regenerative integrated circuit to handle the information data.

• The apparatus can control the operating mode of the regenerative integrated circuit, including head switching, MR head bias current setting, regenerative amplifier gain setting, and detection of thermal asperity noise. The control data are transmitted via a single channel of a rotary transformer, and the decoder discriminates the data to control the regenerative integrated circuit. The apparatus can extend the service life of an MR head by minimizing the bias current during the non-operating period.

• The apparatus can transmit the operating state of the regenerative integrated circuit to the stationary drum side at every timing of head switching, allowing for quick detection of any faulty operation of the MR head or occurrence of thermal asperity noise. The apparatus can also read the operating state of the regenerative integrated circuit and re-encode the data to transmit them to the control signal generator on the stationary side. This bidirectional communication enables the states of the MR heads on the rotary drum to be detected from the stationary side.

• The apparatus can record data and reproduce data at the same time using plural recording heads and MR heads mounted on the rotary drum. The recording heads and MR heads are arranged at 90° intervals, and the recording heads and MR heads are mounted opposite to each other at 180°. The apparatus can regulate the bias currents for the MR heads and the recording currents for the recording heads independently of each other.

• The apparatus can be configured to have a

<summary>
• The invention relates to locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• Prior art techniques for locating buried metallic objects include passive and active methods, with the active method using a transmitter to induce alternating currents in non-ferrous metal pipes or cables.
• The prior art method has limitations when trying to locate and trace a cable in the presence of an adjacent cable, as the output signal characteristic becomes distorted and tracing becomes difficult.
• The present invention provides a system and method that improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The invention uses a transmitter with a pair of antennae to induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver that senses the magnetic fields associated with the currents and produces an output signal dependent on both fields.
• The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the cables, and the receiver is moved back and forth over the ground to produce an output signal characteristic with distinct nulls over each cable.
• The invention can produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, making it possible to locate and trace one of the cables more easily and accurately than with prior art systems and methods.
• The system can be modified to use different techniques to make the currents distinguishable, such as using different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different repetition rates.
• The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced, and the effect is enhanced by the fact that the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between an antenna and a cable.

<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication, with features such as automatic answering, timer control, and bypass switch.
• The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, a coupler, a timer, and a reset switch, and can be used on or in connection with a private telephone line or switchboard extension.
• The invention provides a simplified, portable, and readily connectable automatic answering service for automatically interconnecting incoming telephone calls with a speaker phone to permit two-way communication with a minimum amount of circuitry and simple connection.
• The apparatus can be used in various applications, such as for the physically handicapped, convalescents, or individuals whose activities make handling a telephone difficult or dangerous.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the field of optical fiber communications, specifically to system network design and incorporation of branch powered amplification within such networks. The invention aims to reduce or eliminate undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing them with remotely pumped optical amplifiers. The amplifiers are powered by energy transmitted over the same branch cables that distribute communications signals. This approach enables the creation of a more reliable and cost-effective undersea lightwave system.

• The invention utilizes a trunk and branch structure with a ring geometry, which provides strong survivability features in the event of a cable cut. The system remains connected and operational even if an arbitrary single trunk cut occurs, and branch cuts only isolate the corresponding branches. The invention also respects sovereignty concerns that often arise in undersea communications networks. The system is not restricted to fixed wavelength routing schemes and can accommodate reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units.

• The system consists of a hub assembly with remote pumping, which includes a hub, a light emitting power source, and an optical amplifier. The hub is a regional switching office that aggregates, grooms, and routes telecommunications traffic onto the optical fiber cable trunk. The light emitting power source is coupled onto the optical fiber cable trunk and provides energy to the optical amplifier. The optical amplifier amplifies attenuated telecommunications signals using the energy from the light emitting power source.

• The system also includes branch assemblies, each consisting of a cable station, a light emitting power source, a branch fiber optic cable, and an optical amplifier. The cable station is a local switching office that processes one or more signal wavelengths and multiplexes/demultiplexes the signals. The light emitting power source is coupled onto the branch fiber optic cable and provides energy to the optical amplifier. The optical amplifier amplifies attenuated signals using the energy from the light emitting power source.

• The invention enables the creation of a repeaterless trunk and branch ring network, which reduces capital, operating, and maintenance costs. The system is not limited to undersea applications and can be used in terrestrial communications systems. The invention also contemplates the use of different types of multiplexing, such as time-division-multiplexing, and different wavelengths and types of fiber optic cables. The system is designed to be flexible and adaptable to different network requirements.

• The invention provides a number of advantages, including the ability to maintain full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations in the event of a single trunk cut. Branch cuts only isolate the corresponding branches,

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices, which eliminates the need for visible fasteners and provides a finished look. The device consists of a two-part assembly, including an attachment member that is installed over a wiring device and a cover plate member that fits over the attachment member. The attachment member is symmetrical and has latching pawls at its ends, while the cover plate member has a ridge and saw-tooth shaped racks that engage the pawls. The device can be easily installed and removed using simple tools.

* The cover plate device is designed to accommodate various types of wiring devices, including switches, receptacles, and combination devices, and can be used with ganged boxes of different sizes. The attachment plate is attached to the wiring device using available fasteners, and the cover plate is then installed over the attachment plate without the need for visible fasteners. The device can be used with walls that are not flat or even, and the independent operation of the pawls and racks allows for adjustments to be made to fit the wall contour. The cover plate device provides a finished look and eliminates the risk of electrical shock.

* The invention includes various embodiments, including devices for one, two, three, and four wiring devices, with corresponding attachment plates and cover plates. The devices can be installed in a similar manner, with the attachment plate being attached to the wiring device and the cover plate being installed over the attachment plate. The devices are designed to be easy to install and remove, and provide a finished look that eliminates the need for visible fasteners. The invention provides a solution to the problem of unsightly and potentially hazardous fasteners in electrical wiring devices.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, such as a television set or monitor, to prevent irritating reflections of natural or artificial light.
* The known shielding device has several disadvantages, including the need for a special fastening device, bulkiness, and limited viewing angles.
* The object of the invention is to provide an improved extendable shielding device that is compact, easy to fit, and allows for various viewing angles.
* The light-shielding device consists of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner, which can be fixed in front of a displaying screen and slide over one another between a pushed-in and pushed-out position.
* The strips have a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, allowing the light-shielding device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen, making it possible to view the displaying screen from various angles.
* The strips are provided with hook elements or locking elements to ensure reliable folding-in and folding-out of the light-shielding device, and an adapter member provides a flat attachment face for the light-shielding device.
* The invention provides a collapsible light-shielding device that is compact, easy to produce, operates reliably, and can easily be fitted to a monitor, allowing for flexible and convenient use.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to automated speech technologies, specifically a system that automatically informs a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that a listener can comprehend. The system takes into account various factors, including the listener's language proficiency, speaking rate, and speech clarity, to determine the optimal speaking rate.
* The system can be implemented in various forms, including wearable devices, teleprompters, and networked computing devices, and can provide notifications to the speaker through various means, such as vibration, tone, or displayed message. The system can also suggest alternative languages for the discourse if the speaker and listener share a common language other than the one being spoken.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which allows for high and selectable resolution in time with simple means. The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane.

• The device includes a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a beam suppression circuit, which are controlled via a delay device triggered by the output of the counter. The counter supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses, where N/p is an integer greater than 1.

• The sawtooth generator and beam suppression circuit are synchronized with the output pulses of the counter, and the delay time of the delay device constitutes a selectable part of a line period. The line counter is preferably programmable, allowing for adjustment of the counting capacity.

• The device can be used to record rapid processes with a high picture sequence frequency, and the spatial resolution of the picture suffers only in the vertical direction. The resolution in the line direction remains high, making it suitable for processes where high resolution is required in one direction.

• The video signals can be digitized and stored in a data processing device for analysis, and the jumped-over lines can be completed by repetition or interpolation. The device is also suitable for recording IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.

• The invention allows for the analysis of processes that previously required expensive film cameras with rotating mirrors, and it enables immediate analysis by a computer. The device is flexible and can be adjusted to optimize time resolution and spatial resolution depending on the speed of the process being recorded.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to multimedia communications, particularly handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services. It provides a solution in the packet domain for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call. The invention uses a multimedia server associated with a telephony server, and blender software manages blended calls using the functions of the multimedia server and telephony server. The blender software receives the call request and initiates a single session with two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.

• The invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices by allowing existing customer premises equipment and existing network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities. The blender software initiates parallel voice and multimedia components with the customer premises equipment, and the signaling paths pass through and are controlled by the blender. The invention may be used on any number of network systems using a number of different protocols, including Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) environments.

• The communication environment includes a communication network, clients, customer premises equipment, telephony servers, database servers, and multimedia servers. The telephony servers may be connected to or integrated with database servers, which track which clients support which services. The multimedia servers may be positioned throughout the communication network to provide the appropriate quality of service for the present invention.

• The blender software operates off of the data processing devices of the multimedia servers and may be instructions embedded in sequential logic or other hardware. The blender separates the invite into a call request and a multimedia request, and sends the call request back to the telephony server, which rings the telephone type device. The blender also sends the multimedia request to the computer type device, and the multimedia server maintains control over the signaling paths associated with the blended session.

• The invention takes an incoming call from a remote caller and accesses a database to determine if the intended recipient of the phone call has blended capabilities. If the answer is affirmative, the call is directed to a multimedia server with blender software associated therewith. The blender software receives the call request and initiates a single session with two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.

• The invention also handles outgoing calls from a user that has blended capabilities. The telephony server, upon reference to a database to determine that the caller has blended capabilities, refers the call to a blender function on the multimedia server. The blender then initiates two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component. The multimedia server may handle both components as a single session, or may redirect or loop the

<summary>
* The present invention relates to content synchronization frameworks using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices.
* The framework allows devices to perform contextual synchronization over various network topologies, including wired and wireless connections.
* The central reference point, hosted by a server, processes synchronization requests from connected client devices and returns responses including bundles identifying files to satisfy the requests.
* The client device sends a synchronization request with dynamic attributes, such as device location and type, to the central reference point.
* The central reference point constructs a response bundle based on the client's attributes and sends it to the client, which then downloads the files in the bundle in priority order.
* The framework supports data compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to optimize communication bandwidth usage.
* The client device creates a delta list of files to retrieve based on the response bundle and downloads the files from servers indicated in the bundle.
* The framework provides for creation of a delta list of files to retrieve, which is performed by the client device, making the system highly scalable.
* The system allows for resumption of synchronization from the specific bundle that experienced failure during the last connection disruption, improving efficiency and reliability.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to methods and systems for allowing a person to communicate with the owner of a lost or misplaced object, while maintaining the owner's privacy. The system provides a unique ID to the owner, which is associated with the owner's contact information, and a virtual locale, such as a website or email address. The finder of the object can use the ID to contact the owner through the virtual locale, without knowing the owner's actual contact information.

* The owner registers the ID and contact information on a centralized database, and can manage their account settings, including adding or editing tags, viewing open cases, and communicating with finders. The owner can also choose to receive alerts via email, instant messaging, or text messaging. The system verifies the owner's identity and ensures that the contact information is valid.

* A finder can access the system through a website or other virtual locale, and enter the ID found on the object to initiate communication with the owner. The finder can choose to send a one-way anonymous message to the owner, or open a new case and communicate with the owner through anonymous email addresses. The system generates anonymous email addresses for both the finder and the owner, and stores the real email addresses in the case record.

* The system periodically checks for incoming emails and forwards them to the appropriate parties, swapping the anonymous email addresses with the real email addresses as needed. The system also checks for invalid or non-existent case records, and sends auto-generated replies to the sender in such cases. The system ensures that anonymous emails are sent from the same email address registered in the case record.

* The system provides a main menu for owners, which includes options to add a new tag, view open cases, edit account settings, and log out. The system also provides a main menu for finders, which includes options to search for an ID, view open cases, edit account settings, and log out. The system includes various submenus and options for both owners and finders.

* The system uses a "bot-killer" registration screen to prevent automated registrations, and validates user input to ensure that it is in the correct format. The system also includes error handling and messaging to inform users of any issues or errors. The system is designed to be user-friendly and easy to navigate.

* The system can be used for a variety of objects, including attaché cases, keys, portable music players, digital cameras, and cell phones. The system can also be used for other types of lost or misplaced items, such as pets or luggage

<summary>

* The invention relates to electron multipliers, specifically a foil electron multiplier that uses a series of thin foils to multiply electrons in a transmission stage. The foils are arranged collinearly in an evacuated enclosure and a voltage is applied to each foil to accelerate secondary electrons. The invention is designed for use in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates. The foil electron multiplier can be used in electron spectrometers, mass spectrometers, and photonic detectors.

* The foil electron multiplier has several advantages over conventional electron multipliers, including a higher gain per multiplication stage, simplicity of fabrication, lower cost, ability to cover a larger area, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback. The foil electron multiplier can be used to amplify an incident electron flux or detect particles such as photons, ions, and electrons. The invention can be used in a variety of applications, including night vision devices. The foil electron multiplier can provide position-sensitive information on where an incident particle impacted the first stage of the multiplier.

* The foil electron multiplier consists of a series of thin foils held by foil holders in an evacuated enclosure, with a voltage applied to each foil to accelerate secondary electrons. The foils are arranged collinearly, although they can be arranged in an array along an arc. The voltage on each stage can be applied using a resistor divider string or separate power supplies. The electric field between adjacent foils accelerates secondary electrons between successive stages in the multiplier.

* The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by maximizing the electron transmission through the foil, maximizing the transmission through the support grid, and maximizing the secondary electron emission yield. The foil thickness and material are critical in achieving high gain, with thinner foils requiring lower applied bias and materials with high secondary electron emission yield preferred. The foil electron multiplier can be designed to operate at a specific voltage per stage to achieve optimal gain. The gain of the foil electron multiplier can be calculated using equations that take into account the transmission through the foil and grid, and the secondary electron emission yield.

* The foil electron multiplier does not experience ion feedback, which is a limitation of conventional electron multipliers. In the foil electron multiplier, ions generated at the input surface of a particular stage are accelerated toward the previous stage, but cannot penetrate the foil. The ions can initiate another avalanche, but this avalanche is generally indistinguishable in time from the initial avalanche. The foil electron multiplier can be designed to minimize ion feedback by using curved channels or other techniques

<summary>
* The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows viewers to watch 2D motion pictures with a 3D effect using the Pulfrich illusion, which creates depth perception through lateral motion. The system uses special glasses with individually controllable lenses that darken or clear in response to signals from a computer processor.

* The Pulfrich illusion works by delaying the image to one eye, creating a disparity between the two eyes and tricking the brain into perceiving depth. The illusion is most effective when the camera moves laterally or the objects in the scene move horizontally across the screen.

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope uses a digital sensor to capture the video image, a computer processor to analyze the image and identify lateral motion, and a control unit to darken or clear the lenses accordingly. The system can be used with any type of display device, including TVs, computers, and movie projectors.

* The invention solves the problem of 3D motion pictures being a novelty due to the need for special equipment, production, and projection requirements. It allows ordinary 2D motion pictures to be viewed in 3D, without the need for special filming or projection equipment.

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a wearable device that looks like ordinary glasses, with a digital sensor and computer processor attached. The device can be powered by batteries and does not require any wired or wireless connection to the display device.

* The system can be used to view older motion pictures that were not originally filmed in 3D, as well as new releases. It can also be used to view animated movies and other types of video content.

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope reduces eye strain and discomfort associated with traditional 3D viewing methods, as the lenses only darken when lateral motion is detected. The system is also more convenient than traditional 3D viewing methods, as it does not require special glasses or headgear.

* The invention has many potential applications, including home entertainment, movie theaters, and video game consoles. It could also be used in educational settings to enhance the learning experience.

* The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a significant improvement over traditional 3D viewing methods, offering a more convenient, comfortable, and widely applicable solution for viewing 3D content. It has the potential to revolutionize the way we experience motion pictures and other video content.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to the dicing of semiconductor wafers, specifically an apparatus and method for singulating individual die from a wafer using pressure to mechanically separate them. The current method of using a wafer saw is slow, requires maintenance, and can damage the die. The invention aims to overcome these limitations by using pressure to break the wafer along scribe lines, resulting in a "clean break" and singulated die. This method is faster and more efficient than traditional wafer sawing.

• The invention involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer surface, applying a photo resist layer, and etching the trenches to a desired depth. The wafer is then back-grinded to reduce its thickness, and an adhesive tape is applied to the back surface. The wafer is placed on a soft pad, and mechanical pressure is applied to the back surface, causing the wafer to break along the trenches and singulate the die. The pressure can be applied in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion.

• The invention can be used with wafers of any size and type, and the trenches can be formed using various methods, including etching or partially cutting the wafer with a wafer saw. The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described and can be modified to accommodate different semiconductor chip types and sizes. The method is faster and more efficient than traditional wafer sawing and can increase yields by reducing damage to the die. The invention has a wide range of applications in the semiconductor industry.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display device having a protection structure that prevents damage to field emission components by deflecting ionic emission gas away from the cathode. The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that is negatively charged to attract positive ions and prevent them from contacting the cathode.
* The field emission display device includes a cathode, an anode, and multiple field emission elements that emit high-energy electrons when a voltage is applied. The electrons strike molecular nitrogen and oxygen, forming positive ions that are deflected away from the cathode by the negatively charged reduction plate.
* The reduction plate can be fabricated on the cathode plate in a parallel and adjacent arrangement with the cathode strips, or in a meshwork- or net-shaped configuration. The reduction plate is separated from the cathode strips by an insulation layer and is connected to a bias voltage source that applies a negative voltage.
* The invention provides a novel protection structure that prolongs the lifetime of field emission elements by preventing surges in electrical current induced by ionized gases. The protection structure can be fabricated using conventional deposition and etching techniques.
* The field emission display device of the present invention has improved performance and reliability compared to conventional devices, and can be used in a variety of applications such as flat panel displays and electronic devices. The invention provides a significant advancement in the field of field emission display technology.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, which can image in a plurality of planes simultaneously, overcoming the limitations of prior art image sensors that can only image in a single plane.
The invention provides an image sensor with an elongated substrate having opposed major surfaces and edges, with image sensor elements formed in the substrate and located adjacent to the edges.

* The image sensor elements include a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region, and means in the substrate guide charge carriers in the image sensing region towards the charge collection and transfer means.
The guiding means is achieved through the use of doped layers that create a waveguide-like structure adjacent to the edges of the sensor.

* The image sensor can be used in various applications, such as simultaneously imaging two opposing surfaces or the surface imaging of passageways.
The invention can be formed using processing techniques compatible with those used in forming other types of image sensors, making it easily incorporable into various known image sensors.

* The image sensor elements are arranged in columns along the length of the sensor, with each element including an image sensing region and a charge collection and transfer means, such as a buried-channel CCD.
The image sensing region can include a photodiode, and the charge collection and transfer means can include storage gates, transfer gates, and clock phase terminals.

* The P+ layers formed in the top surface of the image sensor between each edge surface and the column of image sensor elements adjacent to the edge surface create a barrier to electron movement, guiding charge carriers towards the middle of the substrate.
This allows the image sensor to effectively collect charge carriers generated by light energy absorbed through the side edges of the sensor.

* The invention provides a principal advantage of being able to image in a plurality of planes, making it suitable for use in various applications such as color document scanning.
The image sensor can be mounted in a suitable arrangement to avoid interference of external connections on an imaging surface, and can be used with imaging lenses and filters to achieve specific imaging tasks.

<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks employing devices with power management systems, where a network master node performs network administrative functions and nominal device functions. The network master node consumes power even when not performing its nominal device functions, which is undesirable from an energy conservation standpoint. The invention aims to minimize total power consumption of the home network while ensuring optimal network administration.

• The invention proposes a method for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device, enabling the master device to enter a power management state. The transfer of functions is initiated by the master device, which sends data to a slave device, enabling it to perform the network administrative functions. The master device then enters a power management state, reducing its power consumption.

• The home network includes devices capable of serving as both network master and slave nodes, and devices capable of serving only as network slave nodes. Each device includes a device manager, power manager, and a master/slave device-network-interface (DNI) or a slave DNI. The master/slave DNI enables a device to perform network administrative functions, while the slave DNI does not.

• The network master node performs network administrative functions, such as beacon transmission, device association and authentication, admission control, and bandwidth assignment. The network master node also performs its nominal device functions, such as streaming video and audio data. The network slave nodes perform their nominal device functions and can request bandwidth from the network master node.

• When a network master node is instructed to enter a power management mode, it sends data enabling network administrative functions to a network slave node. The network slave node then becomes the new network master node, and the old master node enters the power management state. This transfer of functions minimizes total power consumption of the home network.

• The network master node can select a network slave node to transfer the network administrative functions to based on predetermined selection criteria, such as visibility or intelligence/functional capabilities. The selection criteria can be based on the number of devices a slave node can communicate with or its processing power and transmission bandwidth. The user can also select a specific slave node to become the new master node.

• The network slave node receives a transfer request from the master node and sends a request reply indicating its acceptance. The master node then transfers the network administrative functions to the selected slave node, which becomes the new master node. The old master node enters the power management state, reducing its power consumption.

• The invention ensures that the home network is not lost when the network master node enters a power management state. If

• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation, particularly at low elevation angles where ground reflections are significant. The prior art uses a single equi-spaced triplet arrangement, but this has limitations in terms of ambiguity and sensitivity. The invention aims to overcome these limitations by using multiple triplets with different spacings and heights.

• The prior art triplet arrangement is described in UK Patent No. 1449196, which uses a single triplet to define fixed angles in the elevation plane. The triplet outputs A+C and B are functions of the elevation angle θ and the ground reflection coefficient p. The quotient of A+C and B is independent of a, p, r, h, and P.

• The invention uses at least four antennae spaced to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane. Each triplet has a different spacing and height above the ground plane. The antennae receive information signals, which are processed to provide a quotient signal that is a function of θ but not p.

• The array can operate in receive or transmit mode, with the latter requiring coded transmissions from each antenna to enable angle measurement. A common coherent carrier is required for transmissions from each element of a triplet, but coherence between triplets is not required. The invention provides unambiguous angle measurement over a selected sector.

• The invention is described with reference to accompanying drawings, including FIG. 1, which illustrates the prior art arrangement, and FIG. 2, which illustrates the principle of operation of an antenna array arranged as triplets. FIG. 3 shows a practical embodiment of an antenna arranged as three triplets, and FIG. 4 plots signal against elevation for the three triplets.

• The triplet arrays may be used in receiving or transmitting mode, and one application of each is described by way of example. In receiving mode, the signals are processed to determine the quotient, which is a function of θ but not p. In transmitting mode, the transmitted signal from each antenna in the array must be coded to enable angle measurement.

• The design aims to provide unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees, with measurement accuracy and resolution of the order +/-0.05 degrees from 3 degrees down to the lowest angle possible. The number of antenna elements is minimized, with the lowest element not too close to the ground and the highest antenna element at an acceptable height.

• The present invention relates to high-intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high-intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid-tight seal. The invention aims to combat the problems of conventional subminiature lamps, such as adhesive breakdown, thermal cycling, and liquid invasion. The invention provides a solution that extends the life of the bulb and protects users from burns.

• Conventional subminiature lamps have a glass envelope supported by a one or two-piece base, with a low-pitch thread for mechanical fixation and conduction. The glass envelope is typically supported by a metal sleeve, which is fixed to the base using an adhesive. However, this adhesive breaks down over time due to thermal cycling and liquid invasion.

• The use of an adhesive to support the glass envelope has several problems, including breakdown due to thermal cycling, shear movement, and liquid invasion. This leads to early subminiature lamp failures. The invention aims to provide a solution that addresses these problems and extends the life of the bulb.

• The invention uses a high-temperature polymer that directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope. The polymer is supported by a metal base and provides extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack. The polymer material is selected based on its heat resistance, chemical resistance, and ability to withstand sterilization.

• The polymeric seal support forms a housing around both the glass envelope and the abbreviated height one-piece conductive base, making a liquid-tight seal. The polymeric seal support is selected based on its maximum working temperature, chemical non-reactivity, and ability to withstand sterilization. The material can be pre-selected to achieve other objectives, such as color or electromagnetic absorbance.

• The invention provides a longer seal length compared to conventional "o" ring seals, which results in a more reliable seal. The polymeric seal support seal length is approximately 13 times longer than conventional "o" ring seals. The stretch level and compression level of the polymeric seal support are within the recommended range of 1-5%.

• The invention eliminates the need for adhesive or cement, which allows for closer tolerance centering of the subminiature lamp glass envelope to the axis of the abbreviated height one-piece conductive base. The polymeric seal support also provides a more reliable seal compared to conventional "o" ring seals.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for configuring a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) precoder in a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system, which reduces computational cost while achieving no capacity loss. The GDFE precoder is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including 4G cellular networks.

• The method computes a filter matrix C using one of several alternative formulas, and then computes a transmit filter matrix B, a feedforward filter matrix F, and an interference pre-cancellation matrix G based on the computation of C. The filter matrix C is computed without requiring knowledge of the covariance matrix corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise".

• The input covariance matrix Sxx for the downlink channel is computed by first computing the input covariance matrix D for the equivalent Uplink/Medium Access Channel (MAC) with channel gain matrix H H, and then using the equation Sxx = I - [H H DH + I]^-1 λ. The input covariance matrix Sxx represents dependencies of symbols transmitted from different antennas.

• The transmit filter matrix B is computed as B = VΣ^1/2 M, where V and Σ are obtained from the Eigen Value Decomposition (EVD) of Sxx. The feedforward filter matrix F is computed as F = GM H C, where G is a Block Upper Right Triangular matrix with Identity matrices forming its diagonal block.

• The interference pre-cancellation matrix G is computed as G = FR \, where R is a Block Upper Right Triangular matrix obtained from the QR decomposition of C. The matrix C can be computed using several alternative formulas, including one that avoids the use of Szz.

• The method is illustrated with a numerical example, where the channel matrix H is given, and the optimal input covariance matrix Sxx is computed using the technique described in reference [6]. The "Least Favorable Noise" covariance matrix Szz is also computed using the technique described in reference [4].
