• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, which aims to increase the intake airflow rate without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements. The conventional fan has a limited air passage at the lateral side, restricting the design of the blade and wasting space and material. The invention seeks to overcome these limitations.

• The invention provides a heat-dissipating fan and a housing thereof, where the sidewall of the housing extends outwards to enlarge the intake airflow area without changing the assembling conditions with other elements. The shape of the housing at the air outlet side remains unchanged, enhancing the heat-dissipating efficiency of the fan. The fan can be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions.

• The invention also provides a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, where the sidewall of the housing extends outwards to enlarge its intake airflow area, allowing the impeller to increase its dimension and airflow rate. The airflow rate is increased, and the heat-dissipating efficiency is enhanced. The design enables the fan to be mounted to a system or other heat dissipation elements without changing the assembling conditions.

• The invention further provides a heat-dissipating fan and a housing thereof, where the air passage formed by the sidewall of the housing reduces gradually and evenly in its cross-sectional area. The air streams produced by the rotation of the impeller can be effectively concentrated to the center and then blow to the center portion of the heat sink having the highest temperature. The heat-dissipating efficiency is thus enhanced.

• The housing of the invention includes an outer frame having a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to another opening, where the sidewall of the passage of one of the opening sides extends radially outwards. The sidewall of the passage extends radially outwardly with respect to a central axis of the passage in a symmetrical manner. The sidewall of the passage extends radially outwardly with respect to a longitudinal axis of the passage and beyond the peripheral edge of the outer frame.

• The invention also provides a heat-dissipating system, which includes a casing, at least one electrical element mounted within the casing, and a heat-dissipating device mounted on the casing for dissipating heat generated from the electrical element. The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and a housing for receiving the impeller. The housing includes a passage for guiding air streams to flow from an opening to

<summary>
* The electroluminescent display panel of the present invention is able to display different colors according to the situations without using an intermediate electrode. The panel is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer. The first and second luminescent layers are made of materials that emit light of different colors. The second luminescent layer partly overlaps the first luminescent layer, forming a single layer portion and a double layer portion.
* The single layer portion emits green light at a low voltage, while the double layer portion emits lemon light, which is a mixture of green and orange, at a high voltage. The display panel can be used as an instrument panel for an automobile, displaying images in green at night time and in lemon color at day time. The green light is comfortable for a driver's eyes at night time, while the lemon light has a high luminance to cope with sunlight at day time. The panel can be driven by changing the voltage level to display different colors.
* The threshold voltage of the single layer portion and the double layer portion can be calculated using formulas that take into account the thickness and properties of the materials used. The difference between the threshold voltages can be controlled by designing the thickness and properties of the materials. The display panel can be driven at a voltage between the threshold voltages to display images in a desired color. The color purity of the display can be changed by selecting the width of the second luminescent layer.
* The display panel can be manufactured using various processes, including sputtering, electron beam vapor deposition, and dry-etching. The first and second luminescent layers can be formed using different materials and processes. The display panel can be modified to have a square-shaped double layer portion, which is orthomorphic to the shape of the picture element. The panel can also be modified to have a red color filter disposed on the second electrodes to emit red light at high luminance.
* The display panel can be further modified to eliminate the second luminescent layer and use a color filter to display different colors. The first luminescent layer can be modified to have thicker portions that emit light with a higher luminance when a higher driving voltage is imposed. The display panel can be used in various applications, including instrument panels for automobiles, and can be modified to have different shapes and structures to

<summary>
• The invention relates to a portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc. The terminal establishes a wireless connection to a connecting unit, which establishes a connection to a network and/or the Internet, and the terminal can independently control and communicate data packets according to a standardized Internet/network protocol. The terminal can also communicate additional information and/or data with the connecting unit, such as IP addresses, speech mails, commercials, music, and stock exchange and financial news.
• The system according to the invention comprises a service server connected to the Internet and/or a network, which keeps track of which terminals/users are accessible and where, and establishes connections between users who want to communicate with each other. The server can also provide additional services, functions, etc., such as news, reading of mails, chat-lines, chat-rooms, and telephone meetings. The system operates by establishing a connection between users via the Internet, using the service server to obtain current IP addresses and establish two-way connections between users.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry, which involves growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on a semiconductor substrate, and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer. This allows for the integration of ferroelectrics and other high-dielectric constant materials directly on silicon or gallium arsenide substrates without the formation of a low dielectric constant layer.

• The use of a germanium buffer layer between the high-dielectric oxide and the semiconductor substrate reduces the reactivity at the surface and enhances the epitaxy, and a non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide buffer layer can be used to prevent the diffusion of lead or bismuth from the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric oxide into the germanium or semiconductor substrate. This enables the fabrication of high-density capacitors, non-volatile non-destructive readout memory cells, and other semiconductor devices with improved performance and reliability.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a receiver input circuit that enables substantial elimination of undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, resulting in distortions, while maintaining adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit achieves this by using multiple amplification control loops with different response thresholds and frequency bandwidths.

* The first amplification control loop avoids overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes by controlling the amplification of the input signal based on the signal level at the output of the preamplifier stage. The effective bandwidth of this loop is approximately identical to the transmission bandwidth of the network and the signal response threshold is below the modulation limit for the mixer input or varactor diodes.

* The second amplification control loop avoids overloading of the mixer stage and frequency influences on the oscillator by controlling the amplification of the input signal based on the signal level at the output of the mixer stage. The effective bandwidth of this loop is less than that of the first control loop but greater than that of the third control loop.

* The third amplification control loop provides additional protection against strong spurious signals by controlling the amplification of the input signal based on the signal level at the output of the intermediate frequency filter. The effective bandwidth and signal response threshold of this loop are lower than those of the second control loop.

* The control circuits are arranged in such a way that the signal distortions caused by the rectifier circuits do not affect the input circuit, and the control signal is leveled to quickly charge up to the highest value of the signal level and follow the decreasing signal level relatively slowly. This enables greater elimination of interference through the control circuit.

* The input network can be extended to include additional reactance elements and PIN diodes to increase the control range and selectivity of the input circuit. The tunable selective circuit can be connected between the terminal and the signal input terminal to achieve higher selectivity while avoiding strong attenuation during control.

* The invention also provides for iteration-free alignment of the tunable tuning circuits of the receiver input circuit by using a separate supply and adjustment of the tuning voltage for the varactor diodes, and by aligning the manipulated variable generated by the tuning voltage generator to the minimum given tuning voltage at minimum given tuning frequency.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a system and method for setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals using a telephone and a desktop computer. The system allows users to share information, conduct video conferencing, and engage in other collaborative activities while maintaining their initial voice connection. The invention aims to simplify the setup process and make it more spontaneous.

* The system consists of a telephone with a collaborate indicator and a collaborate button, and a desktop computer with a collaboration control program. The collaboration control program communicates with the telephone and other remote computers to determine the availability of collaboration applications and to launch them when requested. The program also compares the capabilities of local and remote computers to determine which collaboration applications can interoperate.

* The system operates by first establishing a voice connection between two or more parties, and then determining whether the parties have the capability to collaborate. If they do, the collaborate indicator is illuminated, and the users can initiate collaboration by pressing the collaborate button. The collaboration control program then launches the selected collaboration application and establishes a connection with the remote computer.

* The invention can be implemented in various architectures, including a client-server architecture with a call control unit, a peer-to-peer architecture, and a system with a separate telephone and computer. The system can also be used for multiparty collaboration and can be deployed over a corporate LAN, WAN, or the Internet. The invention is not limited to a specific type of telephone or computer and can be implemented using various protocols and technologies.

* The invention provides a simple and spontaneous way to set up a collaborative work-sharing environment, which can enhance productivity and communication between individuals. The system is flexible and can be adapted to various environments and applications. The invention can be implemented using a computer program and can be carried on a storage medium or transmitted over a network.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for inserting advertising clips into a video sequence, taking into account the regions of interest of the video sequence and the advertising clips to ensure a continuity of salience between the two. The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and the advertising clips, determining a degree of similarity between the maps, and selecting the clip with the highest degree of similarity to insert into the video sequence.
* The insertion point of the advertising clip can be a shot change in the video sequence, which is detected automatically or manually, and the clip is selected to have regions of interest that are spatially closest to those of the last pictures of the video sequence before the shot change. This ensures that the spectator's attention is not disturbed by the sudden appearance of the advertising clip.
* The degree of similarity between the salience maps can be determined using various methods, including calculating the correlation coefficient, Kullback-Leibler divergence, or Euclidean distance between the maximum salience points of the maps. The method can also involve preselecting the advertising clips according to their semantic content with respect to the video sequence.
* The device implementing the method can be a computer system with a processing unit, memory, and input/output interface, and can be used to process video sequences and advertising clips to insert the clips into the sequences in a way that optimizes their visual impact on the spectator. The device can also be used to detect shot changes in the video sequence and select the advertising clips accordingly.

<summary>
• The invention relates to the use of a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections in very small dimension semiconductor devices, resulting in lower electrical breakdown and improved reliability. This is achieved by positioning a mask member below the surface to be planarized, at a location where the surfaces of the regions separated by the dielectric are undisturbed and have complete integrity.

• The recessed mask structure is achieved through a unique process that permits both the benefit of having a recessed surface of the mask with respect to a device surface where there may be aspects to avoid, and the benefit of having a final mask thickness that is selectable and no thicker than necessary. The process involves removing mask material between points of high electric field concentration, down to a level that is away from the surface where the high fields are located, and continuing until a selected mask thickness is reached.

• The invention provides several beneficial features, including a lower and predictable overall capacitance, which results in faster signal propagation in the interconnect wiring, and minimizes damage to the conductive liner at points of high electric field concentration, thereby preventing metal contamination of the interface. The recessed mask structure also allows for the use of materials with different properties and meets processing specifications.

<summary>
* The Downconverting Digitizer is an analog-to-digital converter that samples and downconverts a modulated intermediate frequency (IF) signal to baseband in-phase (I) and quadrature (Q) components. It uses a predictive loop to minimize the prediction error signal, which is then digitized and processed digitally.

* The predictive loop consists of a sampler, a predictive filter, a digital summing element, and a feedback DAC, which work together to generate a digital representation of the input signal. The predictive filter is implemented digitally, allowing for flexibility and reprogrammability.

* The sampler is a 1-bit ADC that converts the error signal to a digital representation, which is then processed by the predictive filter. The predictive filter generates a prediction of the input signal at the next sampling epoch, and its frequency response is tailored to the signal of interest.

* The predictive filter can be reprogrammed to match the input signal, allowing for dynamic frequency response adjustment. This feature is useful in applications where the carrier frequency changes due to Doppler, transmitter/receiver oscillator drift, etc.

* The Downconverting Digitizer has several advantages over traditional analog-to-digital converters, including lower implementation cost, lower power consumption, and higher dynamic range. The digital implementation of the predictive filter also allows for word length expansion, resulting in higher precision and dynamic range.

* The invention can be used in various applications, including cellular telephony, where it can be used to reduce distortion caused by interfering signals and to dynamically respond to changes in adjacent channel interference.

<summary>
* The invention relates to active solid-state devices, specifically to apparatus and methods for making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that are responsive to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules. The sensors use semiconductor nanotraces with high surface-to-volume ratios to increase response sensitivity. The nanotraces are patterned using nanoimprint lithography, which enables nanodimension features to be patterned without the use of expensive stepper aligner tools. The dimensions of each semiconductor nanotrace are critical for increasing the response sensitivity to a level that provides practical direct electrical transduction of target molecule binding.
* The fabrication process involves depositing a semiconducting active layer over the entire wafer, followed by patterning the layer into a set of parallel nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography. The nanotraces are patterned over the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes, with each nanotrace running parallel with the column of sensor devices and perpendicular to the interdigitated finger region. The distance between the gate electrode and the set of parallel nanotraces is dictated by the thickness of the gate dielectric layer and is a known, regular distance for all of the nanotraces. This design enables nanodimension registration with the interdigitated finger regions of the source and drain electrodes.
* The electrical architecture for addressing each drain electrode involves depositing an insulating oxide layer, patterning vias through the oxide layer, and depositing a tie layer and gold layer to create electrical continuity between the drain electrode stub bonding pad and the drain electrode layer. The drain electrodes are perpendicular to the source and gate electrodes in the underlying layer and provide electrical continuity between all sensor devices in each row. The drain electrodes terminate at drain electrode bonding pads in an area remote from the sensor devices. The fabrication process enables the creation of a multiplex detection array with a large number of sensor devices that can be addressed individually.

<summary>
• The present invention provides a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads of the leadframe to prevent contamination of the lead surfaces.
• The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the plurality of semiconductor dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material.
• The plating material is preferably a material configured not to react with oxygen, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold, and the method can employ full cutting or partial cutting with different blades to form the semiconductor packages.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a dual mode mobile terminal that can selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN).
* The mobile terminal has two network modules: a first network module for connecting to the WWAN and a second network module for connecting to the WLAN.
* The WLAN has a second base station that gathers service information from neighboring first base stations, including signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes.
* The mobile terminal receives the service information from the second base station and uses it to select a serving base station from the WWAN, allowing for faster connection setup.
* If the mobile terminal fails to connect to the serving base station using the service information, it can scan the frequency channels or start an all-channel scanning procedure.
* The invention enables the mobile terminal to switch from the WLAN to the WWAN in a timely manner, reducing the likelihood of dropped or delayed connections.

<summary>

* The invention relates to the production of multilayered components, particularly multilayer capacitors, and provides a new process and apparatus for their manufacture. The process eliminates several steps required in conventional production methods, reducing labor costs and increasing production rates. The invention also enables the fabrication of smaller parts with lower voltage ratings and no shape limitations.

* The conventional process for producing multilayer capacitors involves casting a ceramic slip, printing metal pigmented inks to form electrodes, stacking and laminating the printed ceramic sheets, cutting the compacted structure, and metallizing the ends of each capacitor element. This process requires careful control of various parameters, including dielectric thickness, dielectric constant, active area of the electrode, and number of active layers. The invention simplifies this process and eliminates the need for cutting and metallizing.

* The new process involves providing a first electrode and a first electrical component on a decal, and locating the electrode in a recess formed by the component to produce a first laminate sub-assembly. Multiple first electrodes and components may be formed on a decal to produce multiple sub-assemblies, which can be stacked to form a resultant assembly. The decals are then removed, and the sub-assemblies are brought into mutually stacked relation.

* The electrical components are deposited onto the electrodes using a screening process, and may be cured under mild heat application. The components may be dielectric pastes, and the electrodes may be formed from conductive inks. The invention also contemplates the use of Electro-Therm inks, which are solid at room temperature but become ink-like at higher temperatures.

* The sub-assemblies are brought into precision registration using guide posts and holes in the decals, and the decals are removed by heat application and peeling away. The sub-assemblies are then stacked to form a resultant assembly, which may be a capacitor, coil, or other electrical component. The invention enables the fabrication of complex configurations and shapes.

* The invention eliminates the need for large laminating forces, which can cause density distortions and delamination problems. The exposed electrode tabs at each end of the stack melt and fuse together during the bake-out cycle, forming a capacitor or other electrical component. The invention also enables the formation of end terminations at the same time as the stack is fired.

* The new process allows for in-process inspection of the electrode and dielectric prints for perfection and thickness before commitment to actual construction. It also enables the use of thinner dielectric materials and the provision of lower voltage ratings.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to cellular materials used in structural applications, specifically to materials comprising hierarchical cellular lattices and related methods of using and manufacturing the same. The lattice structures are designed to have improved specific stiffness and strength while maintaining a low weight. The invention has various applications, including use in sea, land, and air transportation, ballistics, blast and impact impulse mitigation, thermal transfer, multifunctional structures, armors, and construction materials.

• The lattice structures comprise unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength. The unit cells can be of different shapes, including tetrahedral, pyramidal, octet truss, and three-dimensional Kagome. The materials used to construct the unit cells can be metals, metal alloys, inorganic polymers, organic polymers, ceramics, glasses, and composite derivatives.

• The lattice structures can be formed by nesting arrays of unit cells, where a portion of a ligament of a higher order cell abuts a ligament of a lower order cell along at least a substantial portion of the length of the ligament of the lower order cell. The arrays can be mated to form a balanced lattice structure, where at least one ligament of at least one of the highest order cells of an array abuts with at least a substantial portion of at least one ligament of at least one of the highest order cells of an oppositely oriented lattice structure.

• The lattice structures can be used as the core of a sandwich panel or other structure, with face sheets attached to the core by suitable means such as brazing, transient liquid phase bonding, welding, diffusion bonding, or adhesive bonding. The panels and/or cores may be implemented with or as part of floors, columns, beams, walls, jet or rocket nozzles, land, air or water vehicles/ships, armor, etc.

• The lattice structures can be fabricated from thermoformable materials through the use of an injection molding process, where a granular thermoplastic polymer is fed into a cylinder, heated into a liquid form, and propelled through a nozzle into a mold. The liquid polymer is then allowed to cool and harden, and the mold is separated to form a unit cell.

• The unit cells can be used as a template for the deposition of other materials, such as silicon carbide, by placing the unit cell in a heated chamber and feeding gases into the chamber that react to form a solid coating on the unit cell. The waste gases

<summary>
• The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons from coal, which integrates an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) facility with a Coal-to-Liquid (CTL) hydrocarbon synthesis facility. The IGCC facility generates power from coal, while the CTL facility produces hydrocarbons from coal. The two facilities share certain process units and utilities, such as an air separation unit and a water treatment stage.

• The CTL facility includes a dry gasification stage, a gas clean-up stage, and one or more Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis stages, which convert synthesis gas into hydrocarbons. The Fischer-Tropsch tail gas is treated to remove CO2 and water, and the resulting fuel gas is used to generate power in the IGCC facility. The CTL facility also includes a product work-up stage to produce LPG, naphta, and diesel.

• The IGCC facility includes a wet gasification stage, a sour shift stage, a hydrogen-enriched gas expansion stage, and a gas combustion and expansion stage, which generate power from the combustion gas. The combustion gas is cleaned and expanded through a gas turbine expander to generate electricity. The IGCC facility also includes a waste heat recovery stage, which produces steam to drive steam turbines and generate additional power.

• The process offers several advantages, including improved efficiency, reduced emissions, and increased flexibility in producing power and hydrocarbons. The integration of the IGCC and CTL facilities allows for the sharing of resources and utilities, reducing costs and increasing overall efficiency. The process can be configured to produce a range of products, including power, LPG, naphta, diesel, and other hydrocarbons.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material, particularly to a method for preparing a solid device with a surface utilized for oxide superconducting material, where an important improvement is imparted to the properties of the material at the surface or portion close to the surface. This is accomplished by providing a blocking film (passivation film) that is uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent the removal of oxygen from that surface.
* The blocking film is formed using a photo-CVD method, and oxygen is added to the surface or portion close to the surface of the superconducting material by ion injection or hot oxidation method, and then heat-treated to position the added oxygen in the appropriate atom location, resulting in a highly reliable surface utilizing-device, especially a Josephson element. The film used for this purpose may be an insulating film such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, or oxidized aluminum, and the superconducting material may be formed into tablets or thin films using various methods.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, allowing for the precise measurement and cutting of thin parallel-sided strips of foam sheet material.
• The apparatus includes a base structure, clamping arrangement, and screw thread specimen advance mechanism, which enables the preparation of repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges.
• The invention provides a method for severing foam test samples with at least two cut sides that are parallel to one another, preserving the structure of individual cells within the sample for examination without distortion or mutilation.

<summary>
* The invention relates to seismometers, particularly those designed to operate on the ocean floor, and provides a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical.
* The invention also provides a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors employed in a seismometer.
* The seismometer is deployed on the ocean floor, and the seismic motion detector is suspended at the end of a shaft protruding from a ball rotating in an annular seat to form a free-moving pendulum.
* A spring-loaded plunger is positioned above the ball and is restrained from contact with its surface by a pin connected to a linearly acting solenoid.
* After the seismometer is deployed, the solenoid is activated, causing the pin to be pulled from the plunger, which then extends to contact the surface of the ball, locking it, the shaft, and detector in their positions.
* The detector is mounted on the inside of the door of the instrument compartment, which is mounted at the bottom of the frame to improve stability and seismic coupling.
* The invention provides a rigid connection between the detector and the frame of the seismometer, ensuring a good acoustic path between the sea bottom and the detector.
* The angle of inclination assumed by the seismometer can be determined by measuring the acute angle formed by the ball, shaft, and detector in their locked position and a surface known to be vertical.
* The invention provides a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination and preserving the orientation assumed by the seismometer during its operation.

<summary>
• The humidity sensing element of the present invention consists of a porous dielectric coating on a first electrode, with minute particles of electron conductive material deposited in the interstices of the porosity, and a second electrode pervious to moisture vapor disposed on the dielectric coating. The impedance between the electrodes varies generally linearly with relation to the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere when excited by a suitable alternating current voltage. The element is physically sturdy, non-hygroscopic, and has a response time of about one second.

• The preferred embodiment of the humidity element is manufactured by anodizing a commercially pure aluminum electrode, depositing nickel particles into the porosity of the anodized layer, and then sealing the layer and depositing a second electrode of nickel on top. The anodized layer is formed to a thickness of about 0.02 to 0.08 millimeters, and the nickel particles are deposited in a quantity equivalent to a layer 5 to 10 Angstrom units thick. The second electrode is formed by depositing nickel in a quantity equivalent to a layer about 100 Angstrom units thick.

• The sensor is suitable for use in a wide range of temperatures and humidities, and has been found to provide a substantially linear response when excited by a 10 Hertz AC voltage. The sensor is self-contained and forms its own protection for the humidity-sensitive portion, while allowing the surrounding atmosphere to circulate freely through the bore. The exact means by which the sensor functions is not fully understood, but it is believed to involve the combination of capacitance and resistance in the dielectric layer.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a motor assembly, specifically a force transmission structure, which improves upon traditional designs by reducing vibration and noise. The force transmission structure comprises a drive plate and a shaft, where the drive plate has a mounting hole with at least three sections interconnected at a common area, and the shaft has a toothed portion with at least three teeth fittingly received in the sections of the mounting hole. This design allows for stable rotation of the shaft and reduces the impact and vibration generated by the traditional design. The drive plate is preferably made of an engineering plastics material, which has good strength and resistance to impact and can absorb vibration.

* The motor assembly also includes a gear train that connects the motor to the drive plate, which drives the drive plate to rotate. The gear train comprises a worm, a worm gear, and a damper, where the worm is driven by the motor, and the worm gear meshes with the worm and drives the damper, which in turn drives the drive plate. The damper is made of rubber material and has a plurality of slots that engage with protrusions on the drive plate. The drive plate is rotated by the damper and the worm gear when the worm drives the worm gear.

* The shaft has a pinion at one end that drives a gear of a window lift system, and the other end has a toothed portion that fits into the mounting hole of the drive plate. The toothed portion has a Y-shaped cross-section and comprises three teeth evenly distributed in a circumferential direction of the shaft. The shape and size of the teeth conform to that of the mounting hole of the drive plate. A circlip is fitted in a slot at the free end of the toothed portion to prevent it from escaping from the mounting hole.

* The invention provides several advantages, including stable rotation of the shaft, reduced vibration and noise, and increased torque capacity. The drive plate and shaft design also allows for a greater contact area between the teeth of the shaft and the coupling of the drive plate, which can withstand greater torque. The buffer holes in the coupling aid in molding the drive plate and reduce distortion of the mounting hole. Overall, the invention provides an improved force transmission structure for motor assemblies, particularly in window lift systems.

• The present invention relates to wireless communication systems, specifically to systems and methods for detection, identification, and monitoring of multipath signals in wideband code division multiple access (WCDMA) systems. The invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver. The mobile time reference is used to acquire parameters required to recover multipath signals and operate a multipath signal receiver. The invention improves the efficiency of detecting, identifying, and monitoring incoming multipath signals.

• The invention uses a free running counter (FRC) that generates a mobile time reference using a high frequency clock (30.72 MHz) and a low frequency clock (32 KHz). The FRC operates in two time domains, 30.72 MHz or 32 KHz, depending on whether the portable transceiver is in active mode or idle mode, respectively. The low frequency clock is always on, providing a continuous clock signal to the FRC, while the high frequency clock is turned off during idle mode. The FRC maintains the mobile time reference during idle mode using the low frequency clock and an estimate of the drift and bias of the low frequency clock.

• The mobile time reference is used by a multipath monitor and a multipath radio signal recovery circuit to recover and track incoming clock information relative to a basestation. The multipath monitor includes a primary sync searcher, a secondary sync searcher, and a gold code searcher, which provide information regarding these searches to the microprocessor. The multipath radio signal recovery circuit includes a single-path processor controller, single-path processors, FIFO circuits, phase correctors, a deskewing and timing controller, maximal rate combiners, and demodulation units. The circuit recovers information from the signal on up to eight channels.

• The invention provides a wideband spread spectrum multipath signal detector, identification mechanism, and multipath monitoring technique that monitors signal strength from a plethora of asynchronous transmitters within a network in the presence of a moving time base, slotted operations, and effects of the mobile radio channel. The system performs matched filtering of the primary synchronization code and creates a non-coherent energy measurement that is transformed into the log2-domain to reduce memory requirements for multiple hypotheses of slot level timing. Hypotheses are low pass filtered to enhance the probability of detection of signals that are candidates for further processing.

• The system recovers the transmitted code groups and frame timing for the received signal components. A parallel set of correlators performs the final identification of the despreading code over all

<summary>
* The invention relates to a protective helmet with a custom-fitted liner assembly that can be adjusted to fit different head sizes.
* The liner assembly consists of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets with arrays of open and unfilled pockets that can deform in response to compressive contact.
* The layers are arranged in a superposed contacting relationship, allowing them to nestle together to an extent determined by the degree of permanent deformation of the sheets.
* The liner is fitted to an individual's head by heating the sheets to a plastic state, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the head, and removing it when cooled to a rigid state.
* The open and unfilled pockets allow the liner to conform to the contours of the wearer's head, minimizing the tendency for the helmet to shift in position.
* The liner can be refitted to accommodate a changed head size by reheating and re-molding the sheets.
* The invention eliminates the need for drawstrings or other tensioning means during fitting and does not require trimming after fitting.
* The liner is relatively simple and inexpensive to manufacture and can be made in different sizes to accommodate a range of head sizes.
* The invention provides a helmet liner that is custom-fitted, adjustable, and resistant to shifting, with uniform and predictable structural characteristics.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a multiorifice structure and method of fabrication, particularly for use in fuel injector valves for internal combustion engines. The structure has a plurality of angularly disposed passages, and the method involves fusing concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members. The fused assembly is then cut into thin wafers, forming a plurality of angularly disposed passageways. The object of the invention is to create a multiorifice structure with passageways that increase in angular displacement from the center of the structure.

• The prior art includes multiorifice structures with parallel passages, which limit the spray cone of the emitted fuel. Techniques such as drilling, punching, and photoetching are impractical, and fusion of small diameter tubes has limitations. The invention improves upon these techniques by creating a structure with angularly disposed passages that increase in angle from the center. This design allows for a wider spray cone and more effective atomization of the fuel.

• The multiorifice structure is made by fusing concentric layers of rods and cylindrical members, with each layer of rods disposed at a progressively larger angle with respect to the axis of the assembly. The interstices between the rods and cylindrical members form a plurality of angularly disposed passageways. The thickness of the wafer is determined by the effective aperture of the interstices and is sufficient to impart a directional component to the fluid passing through. The structure can be made with a variety of materials, including metals and non-metals.

• The invention has several advantages, including the creation of triangularly shaped orifices that are more effective in atomizing the exiting fluid than circular orifices. The structure also has a high degree of uniformity in the size of the apertures, which is difficult to achieve with conventional drilling and photoetching techniques. The invention is also economical and simple to fabricate. The structure can be made with a variety of materials and can be used in a range of applications.

• The fabrication process involves twisting rods about a core rod and sheathing them in a cylindrical member, with each layer of rods disposed at a predetermined angle with respect to the axis of the core rod. The process is repeated to build up the composite structure, which is then fused or sintered to form an integral structure. The rods and cylindrical members can be coated with a thin layer of material having a lower melting temperature to facilitate fusion. The composite structure is then sliced into thin wafers to form the multiorifice structure.

* The invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device, particularly an insulated gate (MOS) field effect semiconductor device having a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure.
* The method involves forming a gate electrode, creating a low concentration n-type region, and then forming a high concentration n-type region using an oxide film portion on the gate sidewall as a mask.
* The invention also includes embodiments where the gate sidewall portion and/or the source/drain region is silicided to prevent hot-carrier injection and reduce sheet resistance.
* The method allows for the creation of shallow junctions and minimization of the size of the device, making it suitable for use in modern semiconductor devices.

<summary>
* The present invention relates to Internet telephony and provides an improved end-user interface for IP telephone communication. The invention addresses the limitations of conventional IP telephones, which require high-performance PCs, extra sound equipment, and are often inconvenient to use. The invention provides a more convenient, economical, and efficient IP telephone solution.

* The invention uses an enhanced radio telephone that can be connected to a PC and used as an improved IP telephone. The enhanced radio telephone includes a speech coder and decoder, and can operate in both wireless-telephone mode and IP-telephone mode. The speech coder and decoder are constructed to operate at high speed using relatively little power.

* In IP-telephone mode, the enhanced radio telephone is connected to a PC, and coded speech signals are passed between the telephone and the PC. The PC formats the coded speech signals using an appropriate UDP/IP network protocol, and transmits them over a network. The PC can be a relatively low-performance computer, as the speech coding and decoding are performed by the enhanced radio telephone.

* The invention provides several advantages over conventional IP telephones, including reduced echo problems, a more comfortable handset, and lower cost. The enhanced radio telephone can be used with a low-end PC, and the speech coding and decoding are performed externally to the PC. The invention also allows for more flexibility in terms of network connections and protocols.

* The invention can be implemented in various ways, including using a PC to convert between coded speech data and network-formatted data, or integrating the conversion function into the enhanced radio telephone. The network interface can connect to various types of networks, including PSTN, wireless radio systems, and public or private data networks.

* The invention provides an improved IP telephone solution that is more convenient, economical, and efficient than conventional IP telephones. The invention can be used in a variety of applications, and can be adapted to different network protocols and connections. The scope of the invention is defined by the claims, and all equivalents are intended to be embraced therein.

* The present invention relates to devices for producing electrical power, pressurized water, or other useful work from surface waves on a water body, particularly ocean waves.
* The invention uses one or more gas-tight containers submerged to a depth slightly below anticipated wave and swell troughs, which expand and contract in response to overhead wave-induced hydrostatic pressure variations.
* The containers are connected to a hydraulic or pneumatic pumping means or mechanical or electrical drive means, and the pressurized fluid flow can drive a motor or turbine with an electric generator.
* The invention differs from prior art in its use of partial evacuation or surface venting of the containers, flexible reinforced bellows, and mechanical connection to a surface float to enhance compression and expansion of the containers.
* The invention also incorporates features such as tidal depth adjustment, wave focusing, and surge component capture to increase energy capture efficiency.

• The invention relates to scraped surface heat exchangers, specifically the mounting of blades onto a central drive shaft. The blades are hingedly connected to the drive shaft by pins, and the invention aims to facilitate the mounting process. The blades have a scraper edge and a hinge edge, and are typically installed at a shallow angle to fit within the outer tube of the heat exchanger. The invention provides a solution to the problem of blades falling off the pins during installation.

• The prior art method of mounting blades involves inserting the blades at an installation angle, then pivoting them to a shallower angle to engage the pins. However, this method can be cumbersome and requires manual intervention to hold the blades in place. The invention provides a more convenient and secure method of mounting the blades. The invention uses L-shaped locking tracks on both sides of the blade to engage with the pins.

• The L-shaped locking tracks have an entry track and an intermediate track, which guide the pins into place and prevent the blade from sliding off. The tracks are designed to interfere with the pins, holding the blade in place while allowing it to pivot. The tracks are provided on both sides of the blade, which allows for a more secure and rigid design. This design also reduces the amount of thinned track area on the blade.

• The invention provides a method for mounting a blade to a scraped surface heat exchanger drive shaft by pivotal connection with a mounting pin. The method involves providing a blade body with a first side and a second side, and a scraper edge and a hinge edge. The blade has at least one mounting hole extending through the blade body, and L-shaped locking tracks on both sides of the blade. The tracks engage with the pin to lock the blade in place.

• The invention also provides a scraped surface heat exchanger comprising a drive shaft having at least one mounting pin mounted to the drive shaft, and a blade having a blade body with a first side and a second side, and a scraper edge and a hinge edge. The blade has at least one mounting hole extending through the blade body, and L-shaped locking tracks on both sides of the blade. The tracks engage with the pin to lock the blade in place.

• The L-shaped locking tracks are designed to guide the pins into place and prevent the blade from sliding off. The tracks have an entry track and an intermediate track, which interfere with the pins to hold the blade in place. The tracks are provided on both sides of the blade, which allows for a more secure and rigid

* The invention relates to a process and apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine of a cigarette-production and/or cigarette-packaging machine. The cigarettes can end up being located transversely to the rest of the cigarettes and block individual shafts or shaft groups located beneath the storage part. This results in the respective shafts or shaft groups being put out of action. The task of eliminating such disruptions is laborious and costly since it is usually necessary to switch off the machine.

* The problem on which the invention is based is to improve the avoidance of disruptions in the cigarette magazine. An operator usually watches the cigarette magazine and removes any transversely positioned cigarette with long pincers. There is a risk of human error since, on account of the monotony of the task, the operator's attention decreases over time. Furthermore, disruptions which remain undetected may take place when the operator is absent.

* A detection process according to the invention is characterized in that, using at least one optical checking element, at least one image of a plurality of cigarettes located in the cigarette magazine is detected, the image is evaluated by an image-processing device and—if, during the evaluation, the scanned image is established as deviating from a reference image and/or from at least one reference value—an error signal is produced. The advantage of this process is the monitoring of a relatively large area of cigarettes rather than merely individual cigarette ends. Provision is thus made for detecting an image of a relatively large area of the cigarette magazine, namely a plurality of cigarettes, and for subjecting this to image processing.

* Furthermore, this process and this apparatus may also be used to register defective cigarettes in addition to incorrectly positioned cigarettes. For example, in the case where images of filter cigarettes are stored, a missing filter can be diagnosed by image processing. It is also possible to register bent or broken cigarettes, since these too constitute a deviation from a reference image. A disruption detected in this way can be eliminated automatically or manually.

* An elimination process according to the invention is characterized in that a defective and/or incorrectly positioned cigarette is detected, in particular in accordance with one of the processes described above, and, in reaction to such detection, an ejecting unit arranged in the region of the magazine is actuated in order to eject a plurality of cigarettes located in an ejecting zone assigned to the ejecting unit. The number of cigarettes ejected in this case is large enough for a transversely located cigarette to be ejected in full.

* The present invention relates to a device for interconnecting high voltage cables with apparatus and/or with other high voltage cables, consisting of a cable termination and a rigid insulator. The object of the invention is to provide a simplified connection system for high voltage cables having ratings up to 400 KV and above.
* The invention provides a common cable connection system for all accessories and interconnections, resulting in advantages such as factory pretesting, reduction of installation time and cost, reduction of tools, and simplified field testing. The interface components do not include any gas or oil, and therefore, they cannot leak or explode.
* The invention uses three interface methods: an inner cone concept, an outer cone concept, and a no cone or slight inner cone concept, which can be used in various applications such as SF6 terminals, transformer terminals, out-door terminals, straight through joints, transition joints, and joints between apparatus. The outer cone concept has the advantage of separating the cable connection further from the apparatus it is connected to, making it less likely for a fault on one side to affect the other side.
* The invention provides a compact design, lower material and installation cost, complete independence between gas insulated switch gear and cable installations, and standardization. The rigid insulator having a conical interface surface is an essential characteristic of the invention, with an angle between 15° and 45° between the longitudinal axis and the boundary surface of the insulator.

* The invention relates to a fixing mechanism for a tool in a machine tool, comprising a tool, its frame, and a tool holder, where at least one of the connecting surfaces is shaped as a curved surface, and the contact surfaces are adjusted to transmit machining force between the tool frame and the tool holder. The mechanism is simple, secure, and can be used in various applications, including machining, cutting, punching, molding, and forming work. The curved surface can be a spherical surface, and the distance between the radius of curvature and the center of the contact surface fulfills a specific formula.
* The fixing mechanism can be arranged in different ways, such as with a curvilinear surface on the tool frame or on the tool holder, and can include clamps and groove-nose joints to fix the tool frame to the tool holder. The mechanism allows for easy mounting and releasing of the tool, and can transmit forces in the mounting direction and perpendicular to it. The invention provides an improved fixing mechanism that is simple, secure, and versatile.

* The invention relates to switching circuitry that drives display drivers, particularly providing switching circuitry that operates at high speeds while producing low electromagnetic interference (EMI) output, making it suitable for driving large digital displays such as those found in Apple iPhone and iPod Touch products.
* The invention achieves low EMI output by configuring parallel source and drain paths in an alternating relationship, and optionally adding terminal paths to absorb any leaking EMI fields, allowing for efficient and high-current output without generating negative EMI effects.

* The invention relates to a power system for a vehicle, particularly a plug-in hybrid electric vehicle (PHEV) or battery electric vehicle (BEV), which includes a battery having a plurality of cells. The system aims to reduce the time spent rebalancing and charging the vehicle battery by determining the target post-charge cell voltage and the required state of charge (SOC) for each cell. The system then charges the cells to the target voltage and SOC to achieve a desired drive range.
* The system uses algorithms to determine the maximum capacity of each cell, the common voltage needed to support a target drive range, and the charge time for the battery pack. The algorithms also determine the resistive circuitry activation time for each cell and control the charging process to balance and charge the cells to the target voltage. The system can be implemented using a processing device, such as a battery charger or controller, and can be delivered in various forms, including software, hardware, or a combination of both.

• The invention is an AC-to-DC converter that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage at a predetermined value set by a potentiometer, providing a constant brightness light that reduces eye fatigue and prevents myopia.
• The converter includes various components such as input protection circuit, EMI filter, rectifier, filter, converter, output filter, lamp, start circuit, control circuit, biasing circuit, sampling circuit, output protection circuit, feedback and dimming circuit, and input monitor circuit.
• The invention can be used in various applications such as bus AC to DC converter, PFC converter, computer power supply, TV power supply, monitor power supply, notebook adapter, LCD TV, AC/DC adapter, battery charger, power tool charger, electronic ballast, video game power supply, router power supply, and ballast.
