* Emily confides in Sam about her struggles with intimacy with Nikolas due to her past rape. Sam encourages Emily to be honest with Nikolas and to try to make love with him. Emily decides to take Sam's advice and tells Nikolas she wants to make love with him.
* Carly is suspicious of Reese and tells Lorenzo about her concerns. Lorenzo reassures Carly that he trusts her instincts. Carly's past with Sonny is mentioned, and she reflects on how she used to pretend to have a sister.
* Georgie wakes up and wants to see Maxie, despite Tony's warnings that she shouldn't be moved. Georgie says goodbye to Maxie, but refuses to accept that Maxie is dying. Maxie's heart stops, and Georgie is devastated.
* Sonny confronts Reese about her past and her lies, and she admits to wanting to keep her past hidden. Sonny demands honesty from Reese, and she promises to tell him the truth. The scene ends with Ric being questioned by Jason about his role in Evan's death.

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

<summary>

Gus confronts Alan about his actions, and Alexandra reveals that she has physical evidence linking Alan to the crime. Frank arrests Alan and reads him his rights, and Alan is taken away. The family is left to process the truth about Alan's actions.

• Meanwhile, Edmund tries to make amends with Cassie and start over, but Dinah's presence complicates things. Dinah reveals that she was faking her pregnancy and tries to make Edmund stay with her. Cassie walks in on the scene and is confused about what's going on. Edmund tries to cover up the situation, but it's clear that things are far from resolved.

The episode ends with a cliffhanger, as Olivia accuses Jonathan of knowing something about her sister's death, and Reva vows to prove that he's guilty. The stage is set for more drama and conflict in the next episode.

<summary>
• Shayne Lewis, a baseball player, is celebrated by his friends and family at a party, where Marina Cooper tries to keep a low profile. Shayne's friends tease him about his newfound fame, and Marina seems uncomfortable with the attention. Shayne reassures her that he's still the same person.

• Cassie Winslow evicts Jeffrey O'Neill from her hotel, and he tries to beg for mercy, but she's unmoved. Jeffrey tries to reason with her, but she's had enough of his condescending attitude. Cassie hangs up on him, and Jeffrey vows to get revenge.

<summary>
* Sharon is struggling with her emotions and feels lost, especially around the anniversary of Cassie's death. She confides in Dr. Watkins about her feelings and her mistakes, including her relationship with Adam. She wants to find a purpose in life beyond just being in love.
* Nick is dealing with his own emotional struggles, particularly regarding his daughter Summer's growing independence. He's upset about her partying and lying to him, and he takes away her car keys. Phyllis tries to reason with him, but he's adamant about being strict.
* Summer is frustrated with her parents and feels they're being unfair. She confides in Courtney about her feelings and her crush on Kyle, who stood up for her against Fenmore. She's excited about the possibility of dating Kyle.
* Fenmore is dealing with the aftermath of his fight with Kyle and his broken heart. He lashes out at his parents, Michael and Lauren, who are struggling with their own marital issues. Michael is upset about Lauren's infidelity and feels she's not taking responsibility for her actions.
* Kyle is drawn to Summer and stands up for her against her father, Nick. He confides in his father, Jack, about his feelings and is met with caution. Jack advises him to be careful due to Nick's disapproval.
* Phyllis tries to mediate between Nick and Summer, but Nick is unwilling to budge. She also tries to talk to Jack about Kyle's interest in Summer, but Jack is hesitant due to Nick's opposition. Phyllis wants to be the "nice mommy" and give Summer space to make her own decisions.
* The episode ends with Nick requesting a paternity-test kit, implying that he may have doubts about his paternity or someone else's. The stage is set for further drama and conflict in the next episode.

<summary>
* Kevin tries to convince Chloe to seek help and go to Fairview, but she's resistant at first. He reveals that he's been looking for her everywhere and wants to help her. Chloe eventually agrees to get help, and Kevin promises to be there for her.
* Ian Ward is celebrating his freedom after the extortion charges against him are dropped. He runs into Nikki and Victor at a coffee shop, and Victor threatens him. Ian tries to provoke Victor, but Nikki intervenes.
* Dylan is upset about Ian's release and wants to take matters into his own hands. Avery tries to calm him down and advises him to focus on their relationship. Dylan eventually agrees to let the authorities handle Ian.
* Paul and Christine celebrate his birthday, but Paul is worried about Ian's release. Christine tries to reassure him that they'll get through this together. Paul is determined to keep Ian from causing trouble.
* Summer confides in Austin about her mother's coma and her feelings of guilt and helplessness. Austin shares his own experience of losing his mother and offers support. Summer appreciates his understanding and they bond over their shared loss.
* Lauren and Michael discuss Kevin's efforts to help Chloe, and Michael is skeptical about Kevin's ability to handle the situation. Lauren defends Kevin and encourages Michael to have faith in his brother. Michael is worried about Kevin getting hurt.
* Avery's web series is interrupted by a mysterious comment from "4mj," which Dylan recognizes as Ian's online alias. Avery is shaken but tries to brush it off, while Dylan is determined to protect her. Austin offers to help with security.
* Nikki is upset about Ian's release and Victor's threats against him. Dylan tries to reassure her that he won't confront Ian, but Nikki is worried about Victor's actions. Victor is determined to take matters into his own hands and deal with Ian once and for all.

<summary>
• Nick Newman is haunted by the death of his daughter Cassie and blames himself for her passing, feeling guilty for letting her go to a party where she got into a car accident. He imagines what his life would be like if he had made different choices, including keeping her grounded that night.

• Nick's relationships with his family members, including his wife Sharon and son Noah, have suffered as a result of his grief and guilt, and he struggles to connect with them. He also has feelings for Phyllis, which further complicates his relationships.

• Through a series of flashbacks and imaginary scenarios, Nick comes to realize that he needs to let go of his guilt and focus on rebuilding his relationships with his loved ones, and he ultimately decides to move back home to be with Sharon and Noah.

<summary>
• Michael and Lauren discuss their day, and Lauren is worried about Daisy's hearing, while Michael is confident that Victor's company will go public successfully. Lauren wants to testify against Daisy, but Michael advises her to stay out of it. Phyllis tries to convince Lauren to back off, but Lauren is determined to protect her family. Michael reassures Lauren that she's his priority.

• At the Gloworm, Gloria and Jeff discuss their tasks, and Gloria teases Jeff about his attraction to Genevieve, a mysterious woman who has just arrived. Genevieve orders expensive champagne and seems to be interested in Jack Abbott. Gloria is suspicious of Genevieve's intentions. Jeff is more interested in making money than in Genevieve.

• Diane visits Jack and offers to share information about Adam's plan to sabotage Victor's company in exchange for his help. Jack is skeptical but agrees to listen. Diane reveals that Adam plans to make a fortune off Victor's I.P.O. Jack is interested in getting in on the deal. Diane wants to protect herself and her unborn child.

• At the court hearing, Daisy testifies about her past and her reasons for giving up Lucy. Rafe questions her motives and points out her past mistakes. Daisy claims she's changed and wants to be a good mother. Phyllis supports Daisy's claim, but Rafe is skeptical.

• Victor is visited by Diane, who reveals she's pregnant and claims the baby is his. Victor is skeptical, but Diane convinces him to take her to the hospital when she starts experiencing cramping. At the hospital, Victor stays by Diane's side as she receives treatment. Diane is grateful for Victor's support.

• Meanwhile, Adam is making deals and scheming to take advantage of Victor's company going public. He sends footage to a journalist and makes a deal with someone to sabotage Victor's company. Jack is also trying to make a profit off Victor's I.P.O. Genevieve seems to be interested in Jack's plans.

• The court hearing continues, with Daniel testifying against Daisy and Phyllis trying to convince the judge to grant Daisy custody of Lucy. The judge takes a recess, and Phyllis tells Leslie to do whatever it takes to win the case. The episode ends with news that Victor has suffered a stroke and may not survive.

<summary>
• Devon paid off Elena's student loans without her knowledge, causing her to feel disrespected and upset. Elena felt like Devon took away her agency and didn't understand why he did it without talking to her first.

• Mariah advised Devon to listen to Elena's feelings and understand where she's coming from, and Devon realized he made a mistake. Devon wants to make things right with Elena and prove that he respects her.

• Kevin kidnapped Phyllis to trade her for Chloe, who is being held by Adam. Michael is helping Kevin, but is worried about the consequences of Kevin's actions.

• Adam is suing Nick for custody of Christian, and Nick is determined to fight him. Michael agrees to help Nick, and they plan to dig up dirt on Adam to disqualify him as a parent.

• Victoria tries to apologize to Nick for giving Adam the money that he used to sue for custody, but Nick is still angry with her. Victoria wants to help Nick, but he tells her to leave him alone.

• Kevin is frustrated with Adam's demands and wants him to release Chloe, but Adam is playing a game and wants Kevin to do something for him first. Adam's plan is unclear, but it's likely to get ugly and Kevin is worried.

<summary>
* Kevin is planning to move to Portland with his daughter Bella, leaving behind his family and friends in Genoa City, citing the need for a fresh start and to escape the painful memories of his past. Michael, his brother, is concerned about the impulsive decision and tries to convince him to stay.
* Nikki is preparing for her charity concert, but her family is worried about her health and ability to perform, especially after a recent MS flare-up. Nick is particularly concerned and tries to convince her to cancel the concert, but she is determined to go through with it.
* Victor is organizing the concert and is eager to bring his family together for the event, but Nick and Victoria are distant and resentful towards him. Abby is trying to help with the preparations, but Victor's expectations are high, and she feels the pressure.
* Chelsea offers Sharon a job at Chelsea 2.0, but Sharon declines, citing her busy schedule and other commitments. Meanwhile, Kevin and Chelsea have a brief encounter, and Chelsea apologizes for her behavior at Chloe's funeral.

<summary>
* Colleen receives a mysterious box from her dad, Brad, and begins to suspect that he is hiding something from her.
* Nick reveals to Phyllis that he is the father of her baby, and they discuss their complicated situation.
* Kevin tries to get $10,000 from his mom, Gloria, to pay off Alex, who is blackmailing him and Daniel over a secret.
* JT investigates the Kaplan murders, which may be connected to Brad's past, and talks to a witness who recognizes Brad as George Kaplan.
* Sharon finds out that Nick is the father of Phyllis' baby and is devastated, while Jack offers to take a paternity test to clear up any doubts.

<summary>
• Victoria is approached by Ashley and Jack with job offers, but she's unsure about what to do. She's also considering going back to Newman Enterprises, which would make Victor happy.

• Phyllis is fired by Billy from "Restless Style" due to her arrest, and he plans to feature her on the cover of the magazine. Nick is upset about Billy's decision and defends Phyllis.

• Adam and Chelsea get married in Kansas and return to a new home, a large estate with many amenities. Chelsea is thrilled with the surprise.

• Nikki and Jack are planning their wedding reception, but Gloria is pressuring Nikki to sign a contract. Victoria offers to help Nikki with her dress design.

• Ashley and Jack have a disagreement about Jabot and Beauty of Nature, with Ashley threatening to remove Jack from Jabot. Jack meets with board members to sway their opinions.

• Anita returns to town, causing tension for Victoria and Chelsea. Victor offers to keep Anita away from them.

• Phyllis is upset about being fired and wants to fight back, but Avery advises her not to write a blog or talk to the press. Nick agrees, saying anything she writes will be used against her.

• Gloria is suspicious of Jeff and Anita's marriage and plans to investigate. She meets with her son Michael, the district attorney, to get to the bottom of it.

• Sharon is spending time with Victor, but he's distant and preoccupied. She decides to focus on her new horse and learning to ride.</summary>

<summary>
* Mariah and Tessa discuss their plan to leave Genoa City to find Crystal, and Mariah decides to leave with Tessa, even though it means giving up her life in Genoa City. Mariah will have to keep the reason for her departure a secret from everyone, including Sharon.
* Hilary and Devon prepare for their wedding, with Devon going to great lengths to make the day special for Hilary, who is still recovering from her accident. Hilary is determined to make the most of the day and not let her illness get in the way.
* Phyllis, Shauna, Mattie, and Mariah give Hilary gifts to celebrate her wedding day, including a heart-shaped rock, a joke book, and earrings. Hilary is touched by their thoughtful gestures.
* Cane tries to comfort Lily, who is feeling guilty about her role in the accident that injured Hilary and caused her to lose her baby. Cane encourages Lily to attend the wedding and be there for Devon and Hilary.
* Hilary passes out before the ceremony, causing concern among her loved ones, but she eventually regains consciousness and is determined to continue with the wedding. Devon is by her side, supporting her every step of the way.
* Devon and Hilary exchange vows and rings, with Devon reading a heartfelt passage about his love for Hilary. Hilary is overcome with emotion as she promises to love and cherish Devon.
* The ceremony concludes with Devon and Hilary being pronounced husband and wife, surrounded by their friends and family, who are all emotional and happy for the couple.

<summary>
* John Abbott is having trouble with his vision and is taken to the hospital, where he is diagnosed with a minor stroke. The doctor says he's lucky to have gotten medical attention quickly.
* Jack and Ashley are worried about their father's health and are frustrated with the lack of information from the hospital staff. They're concerned that John's stroke may be related to his heart condition.
* Gloria is frantic with worry and wants to see John, but the doctor says only one visitor at a time is allowed. Jack and Ashley try to calm her down.
* Meanwhile, Lily is dealing with her own problems, feeling suffocated at home with her parents' constant arguing. She wants to move out and start fresh.
* Neil and Dru are at odds over how to handle Lily's situation, with Neil wanting to push her to get a divorce and Dru wanting to give her space. Lily feels like they're not listening to her.
* Kevin visits the hospital and is relieved to hear that John's condition is improving. He's also happy to hear that John's sentence may be commuted.
* Gloria is finally allowed to see John and is overjoyed to find him sitting up and making jokes. She's worried about him being sent back to prison.
* Ashley visits John and is reassured by his positive attitude. Jack is more skeptical and wants to make sure John doesn't go back to prison.
* Lily runs into Daniel at the coffee shop and is upset about her parents' constant fighting. Daniel tries to offer her a sympathetic ear.
* The episode ends with Lily feeling lost and alone, unsure of what to do or who to turn to. Daniel looks on sympathetically, but it's clear that their relationship is still complicated.

<summary>
* Jack Abbott is interviewed on TV and makes negative comments about Victor Newman, which upsets Nick and Victoria. He also reveals that he has been hacked by someone trying to track down Victor's whereabouts in Mexico.
* Adam Newman becomes the new CEO of Newman Enterprises and fires Victoria, replacing her with Brad Carlton. Victoria is furious and vows to take action against Adam.
* Nikki Newman is in Mexico, searching for Victor and trying to find out what happened to him. She is desperate for information and offers a man money to tell her what he knows.
* Meanwhile, back in Genoa City, Heather Stevens is getting close to Adam and is considering moving in with him, while Jack and Sharon's relationship is strained due to their differing loyalties to Nick and Victor.

<summary>
* The episode revolves around Katherine's anniversary of passing away, and her friends and family gather to celebrate her life. Murphy, Katherine's friend, reveals that she has left letters for everyone, asking them to write their thoughts and feelings and then burn them. The group is skeptical, but eventually, they all participate, sharing their deepest secrets and desires. The ceremony is emotional, and everyone is moved by the experience.
* Meanwhile, Victoria is struggling to balance her health and her desire to be with her son, Johnny, on his first day of preschool. Billy helps her escape from the hospital, and they share a tender moment together. Victoria is grateful for Billy's support, and they reminisce about old times. Billy promises to be there for Johnny and Victoria, and they share a romantic moment.
* Neil, who has recently lost his sight, is struggling to come to terms with his new reality. He is frustrated and angry, but eventually, he opens up to Hilary and writes a heartfelt letter to Katherine. Devon tries to support his father, and the family comes together to celebrate Katherine's life. Neil is grateful for his family's love and support.
* The episode ends with Jill, who has been struggling to find the treasure from Katherine's music box, finally understanding the true meaning of the journey. She realizes that the treasure was the journey itself, and she is grateful for the experience. Jill thanks Katherine and returns the music box, feeling happy and at peace. The episode ends on a hopeful note, with the characters looking forward to the future.

<summary>
* Billy attends Daniel's art show and meets Amber, who is impressed by his charm and confidence. Billy buys one of Daniel's sketches, and Amber is touched by his kind gesture. Billy and Amber share a romantic moment, and it's clear they have a strong connection.
* Colleen and Daniel's relationship is put to the test when Billy buys Amber's sketch, making Daniel jealous. Colleen tries to reassure Daniel that she's interested in him, not Billy. Daniel is still insecure about Amber and Billy's growing closeness.
* River, Eden's father, is arrested and faces serious charges, including terrorism. Michael agrees to help River and takes Eden in, promising to look after her. Eden is hesitant to trust Michael, but eventually agrees to stay with him to help her father.
* Jill is cleared of all charges and is eager to get back to work at Chancellor Industries. She enlists Cane's help to keep Katherine in check and take control of the company. Cane is happy to help Jill, and they form an alliance.
* Amber and Billy grow closer, and their chemistry is undeniable. They share a romantic night together, and Amber is smitten with Billy's charm and charisma. Billy is also falling for Amber, and it's clear their relationship is heating up.

<summary>
* Jack resigns from the Abbott-Winters Foundation, citing his loss of faith in the mission and his desire to focus on Jabot. Neil tries to convince him to stay, but Jack is resolute. Jack's decision is met with shock and disappointment from the other characters. He also asks Phyllis to leave the house and never come back.
* Billy and Ashley argue about his affair with Phyllis and its consequences. Ashley tells Billy to focus on his own life and stay away from Jack. Billy feels guilty and ashamed, but Ashley is unsympathetic. Billy eventually agrees to resign from the foundation board.
* Victoria is upset about Travis's decision to take a step back from their relationship. She confides in her mother, Nikki, who advises her to be honest with Travis about her feelings. Victoria decides to talk to Travis and convince him to stay. She realizes she wants to make a life with him and the kids.
* Phyllis tries to make amends with Jack, but he is unforgiving. She takes responsibility for her actions and asks for his forgiveness, but Jack is too hurt and angry. He tells her he forgives her, but only to get her out of his life. Phyllis is devastated.
* Neil tries to help Billy get back on track, encouraging him to work the 12 steps and make amends to those he has hurt. Billy is skeptical, but Neil is supportive. Neil reminds Billy that he can start over and make a better life for himself and his children. Billy is hesitant, but Neil's words resonate with him.
* Ashley is upset about Jack's decision to resign from the foundation and blames Billy for the situation. Nikki tries to talk to her about it, but Ashley is too angry. Nikki advises Ashley to focus on her own life and let Jack work through his issues. Ashley is unconvinced.
* Hilary tries to make amends with Devon, who is still wary of her intentions. Devon is hesitant to trust her, but Hilary is sincere in her apology. Lily is skeptical of Hilary's motives, but Devon is willing to give her another chance. Hilary is grateful for Devon's forgiveness.
* Travis is hesitant to commit to Victoria, but she convinces him to stay and make a life together. Victoria is relieved and happy, and Travis is touched by her words. They decide to move forward together, with Travis putting his things away in Victoria's house. Victoria is excited for their future.
* Nikki advises Ph

<summary>
* Damon is in critical condition and the medical team is trying to save him. Phyllis is by his side, and Elias' spirit appears to comfort his father. Damon is filled with regret and apologizes to Phyllis and Elias. He is struggling to come to terms with his past mistakes.

* Lauren and Michael discuss Kevin's challenge to a duel over her. Michael is reluctant to fight, but Kevin is determined to prove himself. Lauren is worried about the situation and tries to convince Michael to walk away. Michael is concerned about Kevin's immaturity and lack of conflict resolution skills.

* Ashley is dealing with the aftermath of her confession to Victor. Brad is angry and hurt, and Ashley is filled with regret. She realizes she has lost everything and is trying to come to terms with her mistakes. Brad is moving on and wants to protect their daughter, Abby.

* Lily is struggling to overcome her past traumas and is haunted by nightmares. Kevin tries to comfort her and help her move on. He apologizes for his past mistakes and promises to be there for her. Lily is grateful for his support and begins to open up to him.

* Nikki is upset about Ashley's confession and feels threatened by her husband's feelings for Ashley. Victor tries to reassure her, but Nikki is angry and hurt. She feels that Ashley has ruined their lives and wants her to face the consequences. Victor is torn between his love for Nikki and his concern for Ashley.

* Jack and Nick discuss a plan to hire Sharon at Jabot, with Nick offering to cover her salary personally. Jack is hesitant, but Nick is determined to help Sharon. He wants to boost her self-esteem and prove to her that he cares. Jack agrees to help, but warns Nick about the risks of keeping the arrangement a secret.

* Phyllis is devastated by Damon's condition and feels guilty about her past mistakes. Daniel tries to comfort her, but she is consumed by grief. Damon's spirit appears to her, and she begs him not to leave her. Elias' spirit appears, and Damon begins to let go of his anger and hate.

* The medical team continues to work on Damon, and his condition is critical. Elias' spirit encourages him to live and let go of his past. Damon begins to respond, and the team is able to stabilize him. The episode ends with a sense of hope and redemption for Damon and those around him.

<summary>
* Chance Chancellor is honored with a commendation for bravery, and his family and friends gather to celebrate. Chloe, his girlfriend, is nervous about meeting his family, but they welcome her warmly. Chance's grandmother, Kay, is particularly fond of Chloe and is happy to see Chance happy. Chance and Chloe share a romantic moment, and Chance thanks her for being there for him.

* Meanwhile, Daniel Romalotti is facing legal troubles, and his mother, Phyllis, is desperate to help him. She and Amber discuss the possibility of Daniel fleeing the country to avoid prosecution, but Michael, Daniel's lawyer, advises against it. Phyllis is frustrated and feels that the system is against them. Michael tries to reassure her that he will do everything he can to help Daniel.

* Billy Abbott is dealing with the aftermath of his breakup with Mac, and Kelly, a woman he had a one-night stand with, tries to comfort him. However, Billy is still in love with Mac and is hurt by her rejection. Mac, on the other hand, is trying to move on and is focusing on her appointment at the fertility clinic. Billy tries to win her back, but Mac is resolute in her decision to end their relationship.

* Ryder Callahan is questioned by Kevin and Daniel about his involvement with Deacon Sharpe and the murder of Elkins. Ryder is evasive and secretive, leading Kevin and Daniel to suspect that he is hiding something. Jana, Kevin's girlfriend, is skeptical of Ryder's motives and thinks he is lying. The group is trying to uncover the truth behind Elkins' murder and Deacon's involvement.

<summary>
• Billy and Victoria discuss her possible pregnancy, and Billy is excited at the prospect of becoming a father again.
• Chloe and Kevin take Delia to a Christmas tree lot, where they meet a photographer who offers to take their photo for a Christmas card.
• Cane and Lily go Christmas shopping, and Cane's friend Blake appears, causing tension between them.
• Phyllis and Billy discuss her upcoming article about Sharon and Adam, which is sure to cause controversy.
• Daniel visits Daisy, who is staying with Phyllis, and they discuss their complicated past and the baby she's carrying.
• Kevin and Chloe take a series of humorous and awkward Christmas photos, which they plan to send out as cards.
• Jill and Lily go Christmas shopping, and they run into Blake, who is buying a book.
• Victoria reveals to Chloe that she may be pregnant, and Chloe is skeptical and protective of her own daughter Delia.
• Daniel explains to Summer that he can't take her to visit the woman he's been helping, because she's unhappy and might be mean to Summer.

<summary>
• Hilary and Devon reconcile and agree to work together on their show, with Hilary having creative control and a higher salary.
• Billy spends Christmas Eve with his sisters Ashley and Traci, but is not welcome at Jack's house, leading to a tense confrontation.
• Phyllis quits her job at Jabot and agrees to work for Lauren at Fenmore's, citing her desire to escape Jack's toxic behavior.
• Kevin and Chloe are committed to each other and their daughter Bella, despite Gloria's disapproval and refusal to accept Chloe as part of the family.
• The episode ends with various characters celebrating Christmas Eve with their loved ones, including Devon and Hilary, Cane and Lily, and Kevin and Chloe.

<summary>
• Adam is reluctant to visit his sick grandmother Constance, but eventually agrees to go see her.
• Faith runs away from home after her parents' breakup and is found by Dylan at a coffeehouse.
• Ashley and Stitch's relationship is complicated, and they decide to "reset" and go back to being friends and colleagues.
• Jill is opposed to Joe's warehouse redevelopment project and accuses him of trying to ruin the city.
• Victoria decides to name her daughter Katherine Rose Newman, which upsets Billy, who wants their daughter to have his last name.
• Nick and Sharon try to reassure Faith that they love her and will always be there for her, despite their breakup.
• Constance reveals to Adam that his father did not die of a heart attack, but committed suicide after Victor Newman took over his company.
• Billy is upset that Victoria wants their daughter to have the Newman last name and feels it's a sign that she's moved on from him.
• Ashley thinks Billy is upset because he still has feelings for Victoria and hopes to get back together with her.
• Victoria and Stitch plan to spend Christmas together and exchange gifts, with Victoria hinting that she got him something with diamonds.

<summary>
• Mattie and Charlie attend Sam's welcome home party, where Hilary is also present, much to Lily's discomfort.
• Jill reveals to Cane that she sold Chancellor Industries to Jack, with Cane's job security being part of the deal.
• Ashley learns about the sale and is determined to stop it, believing it will harm Jabot.
• Billy tries to talk Jill out of the sale, citing Jack's current situation at Jabot, where he's no longer CEO.
• Ashley meets with Lauren to discuss her plan to stop the sale and persuade the Jabot board to adopt common-sense measures.
• Reed's parents, Victoria and J.T., discuss their failed marriage and its impact on their son.
• Nick shows Chelsea his plans for their dream home, but she's hesitant, still unsure about their future together.
• Mattie tries to stop Reed from driving after drinking, leading to a confrontation between the two friends.
• Ashley informs Jack about the board's decision to require the CEO to work from the Jabot office, forcing him to choose between his job and caring for his mother.
